While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk foods to the local community. Hermenita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hermenita joined the Hagdan sa Pg-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Hermenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her shop. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kanygul

texts.en:
Kanygul B.  was born in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is a 56-year-old 'deserved mother' of seven children (such a title is given to those women who have more than five children). After graduating from college, Kanygul worked in the trading sphere for a long time. Her colleagues characterized her as a very diligent and responsible person. 

In 1992, using a starting capital of only 5,000 KGS, Kanygul started her business of cultivating potatoes, beans, tomatoes, cucumbers and carrots.  She concentrated all her efforts on supporting and improving her household. For this very reason, Kanygul wants to take out a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy mineral supplements to fertilize her land. It will allow her to provide high-quality products to the local market and to obtain new customers.  With the revenues from this investment, Kanygul plans to give higher education to her children. In the future, Kanygul plans to develop her farm in one more direction of agriculture by engaging in livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Bujuuta 'b' Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Gorreti B., 44, operates a beauty salon business in the Bujuuta B trading center in the Lugazi district. She mostly offers hair dressing services. Weekly, this business generates close to 100,000 shillings as profits. Prior to opening this business, Gorreti, who is happily married with four children, says she was more involved in farming.

This business has been in existence for 15 years, and to achieve this longevity, it has called for a lot of sacrifice, time, hard work and patience. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be T. N. is 62 years old with 3 children. Two of her children have their own families. Be T. N. is providing for a vocational training course for driving for the last son.

Ms. Be has a small restaurant that serves lunch for workers at some nearby workshops. She started her business in 2004 and it developed more when she  borrowed  loans from SeDa credit program.  She is always a good re-payer during  her participation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy more sets of tables and desks to make more seats to meet the demands of customers.

loans.use: To buy more sets of tables and desks to make more seats.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle G. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old. Anabelle is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Anabelle owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, Anabelle also runs a sari-sari store where she sells various products. Anabelle dreams to be a successful businesswoman. 

Anabelle joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her rice crops

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en: Ramla is 28 years old and is married with one child who is 2 1/2 years old. For 3 years she has sold clothes such as clothes for men and clothes for women. Her business is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day. Ramla has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase clothing to sell. If this is reached, Ramla hopes to earn more profits. With these profits she expects to save in the future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
39-year-old Divina is a married woman who has 7 children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Divina is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for more than 19 years. She earns approximately 4500 per month doing this farming.

Divina's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. In the future, Divina hopes for a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana Luz A. U., es viuda con dos hijos pero ninguno dependen de ella solamente tiene un nieto que esta bajo su cargo en edad escolar al que tiene el deber de mantener en sus estudios. Se dedica a atender su propio negocio desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Managua. Desde que inicio el negocio doña Ana se ha caracterizado por ser una persona esforzada y eficiente, ella inicio su negocio vendiendo ambulante y desde  entonces a mantenido su negocio y su núcleo familiar gracias a los múltiples esfuerzo. Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella es la urgencia de comprar los productos de su negocio como lo son; la lotería. Es  por este motivo que acude a cerpodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita comprar  productos a sus proveedores y así continuar comercializándolos para satisfacer las demanda de sus clientes con el único fin de obtener los ingresos para mantener su hogar  continuar brindándole la educación a su nieto.  Ha trabajado diez créditos con ceprodel todos para su negocio.
texts.en: Ana Luz A. U. is a widow with two chilren.  Neither of her children are dependent but she does have a grandson in her care.  He is school-aged and it is her duty to keep him in school.  She has made her living with her own business in the city of Managua for 10 years.  Since she started the business, doña Ana has been known for being hard-working and efficient.  She began selling her merchandise on the street, and thanks to multiple efforts she has been able to maintain her business and her nuclear family since then.  One of the needs that she comes across is an urgency to purchase the product of her business, lottery tickets. This is the reason she turns to Ceprodel, to have the benefit of a loan which allows her to purchase products from her purveyors to satisfy her customer's demand.  Her only goal is to earn an income that will support her household and provide her grandson with an education.  She has worked with Ceprodel on ten loans, all of which have been for her business.

loans.use: to purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina G. P., vive en tecpatan estado de Chiapas México, ella es viuda con tres hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Julio Cesar  de dieciocho años de edad, Marco Antonio de dieciseis años y el más  pequeño  es José Leopoldo  de trece años.
    Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos  por reja para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado),  en  la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva  ocho mese  de lo que nos comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello está logrando incrementar sus ingresos de su hogar.
    Comenzó con esta actividad para solventar sus gastos que se generan en su hogar, comenzando con la educación de dos de sus hijos que estudian en preparatoria y se generan gastos en sus actividades  y ella quiere que tengan lo mas necesario para lograr sus objetivo.
     Lo que más  desea es que con el tiempo pueda tener su actividad más grande para  seguir trabajando  y  continuar apoyando a sus hijos a que le echen ganas y terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Carolina G. P. lives in Tecpatan in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a widow and has three children under her care: Julio Cesar (18), Marco Antonio (16) and José Leopoldo (13).

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of chickens that she will butcher and dress to sell in her area. She has been in this business for eight months and tells us that it is going well, as she is increasing her household income.

She started this business to cover her family’s expenses, beginning with the education of her two children in high school who need money for their activities. She wants them to have the necessities to achieve their goals.

What she wants most is for her business to be larger to continue working and supporting her children so that they are motivated and finish their education.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en: Marcial, a married father of two school-aged children, has been a farmer in the Philippines for 20 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and a variety of corn seeds to be planted on his farm lot. Currently earning PHP 100,000 each crop, Marcial hopes this loan will further grow his farm so he can more ably sustain his family and eventually improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds of corn.

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
Cholpon is the leader of this group. She is 46 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She is raising two daughters and a son; her son attends university in Bishkek and her daughters are at school. Cholpon is engaged in agriculture, cultivating agricultural products and breeding livestock animals. She is the Executive Director of the countryside alliance. Her agricultural activities have made it possible for her to improve the family's living conditions and pay for her children’s education. With money received from this loan, Cholpon plans to purchase three sheep in order to increase the number of livestock. In the near future, she wants to start house repairing.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Abariki Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Nyane est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire « Abariki», âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans leur petit business. La cliente est vendeuse de cigarettes au rond point Birere. Elle vend également des poissons salés pour ses revenus supplémentaires. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  50 $ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec les cigarettes(1 carton de cigarette Stella)à marchander. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Abariki» est majoritairement féminin.
texts.en:
Nyane, a client, is an entrepreneur and the advisor for the business group "Abariki". She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three. She and her husband mutually assist each other in their small business. She sells cigarettes at the Birere roundabout. She also sells salted fish for additional revenue. She has been in this business for five years. She started it with $50 from her husband. 

This new loan must serve to supply her with cigarettes (a box of Stella) to be sold. Her ambition is to expand her enterprise, to educate her children, and to build a house. 

As our client, Nyane thanks Hekima for acting in favor of the poor who are excluded from traditional banking. It's appropriate to note that the business group "Abariki" is primarily composed of women.

loans.use: to buy a box of Stella cigarettes

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia es comerciante de papa, chuño y tunta (chuño y tunta son derivados de la papa). El crédito lo requiere para comprar más de estos productos pues tiene una demanda muy fuerte, lo cual mejorará sus ingresos. Ella viaja a Desaguadero – frontera con Perú- para comprar dichos productos y los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Delia is a merchant who sells potatoes, “chuño”, and “tunta” (chuño and tunta are types of freeze-dried potatoes). The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more of these products since there is stronger demand. This will improve her income.

Delia travels to Desaguadero, which is along the border with Peru, in order to buy these products. She then sells them at the fairs in the city of El Alto. Delia is single and lives at the home of parents in the District of Alto Lima in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to purchase various potato products.

loans.name: Duo Luz Fuerte Group

texts.en:
'Luz Fuerte' Group:

The members of this group are Zoila and María Odett.  The two ladies are married, have three children, and live with their husbands.  They each have their own business but the same goal.  Zoila sells medicine and sews clothing.  She is the leader of the group and started her business several years ago but is aware that she lacks the capital she needs to work. That is why she is requesting a loan to purchase medicine. Both she and María are requesting this loan to buy new clothes and materials for making clothes.  Their dream is to be financially comfortable so that they can provide their children with a better future.

Translated from Spanish:
Duo Luz Fuerte: Este Grupo lo integran Zoila y Maria Odett las dos casadas y tiene tres hijos y viven con sus esposos Las Dos tienen diferente negocio pero un mismo proposito Zoila se dedica a la venta de medicina  y a confeccionar prendas de vestir ella es la lider del grupo  inicio su negocio hace varios años pero esta conciente de que le falta capital para trabajar por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina. al igual que doña Maria ellas estan solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva y telas para confeccionar prendas de vestir, el sueño de ellas es estar bien economicamente para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Akeel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

Akeel has owned a coffee shop since 2009 where he prepares fast food and all kind of juices and hot drinks. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1,800 to renovate his shop and to tile the interior walls in ceramic. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and tile the interior walls

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia; la socia tiene 35 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 2 hijos y ella se dedica al cuidado de la casa y crianza de animales menores, la socia realiza trabajaos de bisutería en casa, la socia compra materiales para la realización de aretes, collares, pulseras, la socia compra alambres, accesorios de ganchos diversos, mostacillas de colores, y luego los lleva a vender a sus amigas y a diferentes instituciones según el tiempo en el cual la socia disponga; el conyugue de la socia trabaja de obrero en diferentes obras y construcciones, la socia siempre está viendo diferente trabajos según la época y de este modo  apoya en casa con el ingresos de sus negocios de temporada y este de la bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar los diferentes  trabajos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucia, 35, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She’s a housewife and raises small farm animals.  She also makes costume jewelry at home.  She buys supplies to make earrings, necklaces and bracelets.  She buys wire, assorted hooks, colored beads.  She then sells them to her friends and to various institutions according to how much time she has available.  Her spouse works as a laborer in various jobs and construction projects.  She is always seeking out work according to the season and this is how she contributes to her household’s support with income from her seasonal work and from her jewelry making.  She is asking for the loan to buy supplies to do her various jobs.

She is very satisfied with and grateful for the support she’ll get through this means and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 30 years old. She has five children. Four of the children are in school. She is a widow. She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the profit she earns to build a store for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and sugar to sell

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru:
Наталья  замужем. У нее двое взрослых детей.  Семья живет  в городе Никополе. Наталья имеет свой бизнес.

Наталья владеет магазином на рынке. Она продает женскую зимнюю одежду: куртки, пальто и шубы. Вещи только качественные. Наталья занимается в этом направлении уже 30 долгих лет и имеет большой опыт. Она знает, какие вещи пользуются спросом.
 
Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 18,000 гривен на закупку эксклюзивных зимних вещей. Появился спрос. Приезжие из России и местные модницы уже спрашивают.
texts.en:
Natalia is married and has two grown children. The family lives in the town of Nikopole. Natalia has her own business.

Natalia runs a shop in the market. She sells women's winter clothes: jackets, coats and fur coats. She only sells quality items. Natalia has been involved in this enterprise for 30 long years and she has quite a bit of experience. She knows what things are in demand.
 
Natalia is requesting a loan for 18,000 Griven to purchase exclusively winter items. There was a demand. Visitors from Russia and the local ladies have asked.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, siembra maíz, vive con su esposa, cuatro hijos y dos nietos, su oficio es atender las labores agrícolas, el trabajar con la tierra, este ha sido su trabajo desde joven, ya que se lo inculco su padre desde muy joven.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla de maíz, esto pues para realizar la nueva siembra, de la cual espera sea abundante y provechoso.
José se dedica cada dia con su mejor empeño, realizando los trabajos agrícolas, para llevar el sustento a su familia y contribuir para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who grows corn.  He lives with his wife, four children and two grandchildren.  His business involves carrying out his farming tasks and working the land.  This has been his work since he was a young man as his father taught him when he was very young.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and corn seed for his upcoming sowing period which he hopes will be abundant and profitable.

José gives his work his best efforts every day, carrying out his farming tasks so that he can provide for his family and contribute towards their development.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seed

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
With a junior high level of education, Ekua cooks Banku (corn dough) with okra soup to make a living.  It is also typically served with stew or a pepper sauce with fish.

To make Banku, Ekua prepares corn dough (maize that has been milled and left for a day) and cassava dough.  She mixes the cassava and corn dough and cooks it until it looks like porridge.  To get the right consistency, she stirs the mixture on a hot firewood stove.  The texture of Banku has to be fine, but firm.
 
The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut, groundnut, peanut or okra, or with hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind.  The most popular side dish for Banku is okra stew.  

The loan will be used to buy maize to make corn dough for Banku.

loans.use: to buy maize to make corn dough for the Banku.

loans.name: Bambanani Group

texts.en:
Fiona lives in Gweru, and is 30 years-old and unmarried. She has three children aged 12, 8 and 3 years-old.  The eldest two attend school.

Fiona rears and sells chickens.  The main constraint is lack of capital. She will use the money to poultry feed and young chicks.

She will use the proceeds of her investment to send her children to school and to expand the business.  In the long-term she wants to relocate her business to a more central location.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Sainte Edwige Group

texts.fr:
Mme Marceline est la représentante du groupe SAINTE EDVIGE. Elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des fruits depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les jardiniers et les planteurs. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes, les enfants et les passagers.

Elle veut s’acheter des fruits (10 kg de pommes, 04 régimes de banane, 03 paniers d’oranges, 01 panier de papaye, 01panier d’ananas et 01 plat de citrons).

Mme compte utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir sa table et augmenter la quantité des fruits. Elle ambitionne avoir une maison pour stocker les fruits et acheter un congélateur pour conserver ses fruits et aider son mari dans la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marceline represents the SAINTE EDVIGE group.  She is the mother of two children.  The oldest is 13 and the youngest is 10.  They both go to school.  She has six people in her care.

She has been selling fruit for four years. She gets her supplies from gardeners and planters.  Her customers are women, men, children and passers-by. 

She wants to buy fruit (10 kg of apples, 4 loads of bananas, 3 baskets of oranges, 1 basket of papayas, one basket of pineapples and one flat of oranges). 

Mrs. Marceline plans to use her loan to buy a larger table and increase her quantity of fruit.  Her goal is to have a warehouse to stock fruit and to buy a freezer to conserve her fruits.  She wants to help her husband with the school expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit (10 kg of apples, 4 loads of bananas, 3 baskets of oranges, 1 basket of papayas, one basket of pineapples and one flat of oranges).

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim who is 43 years old, is a farmer and sells palm sugar which earns her $2 per day.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $2 per day also.  They have four children.  One is studying and the other three are working in a factory.  Each earns $2 per day.  Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on school fees.  She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy construction material to repair her house.  She also plans to buy a plot of land to do more farming and she will also support her daughter in opening a tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair her house.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 37 years old, married, and has two children, aged 2 and 5.  He has been running a grocery to earn a living. Besides, he sells cereals to earn extra income.  He has been in this business for four years.  He was previously employed before he went into business.

He needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals. Harrison hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
Majeedan has no children and lives with her husband.  The couple operate a clothes selling business together, and both of them have vast experience in this field.  Majeedan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah. She will use the money to buy a wide variety of clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow her to attract more clients and increase her sales and profits.  She is very confident that an investment will help her business to grow and that she and her husband will be in better financial shape as a result.

Note: In the picture, Majeedan is third from the left, with a book in her hand.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in bulk quantity for her clothes selling business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Margie is making and peddling snacks like sweetened cassava and cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients in making snacks.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: 36-year-old Antonia has had a sari-sari store business for 12 years. She is married and has an 8-year-old child. Antonia sells various items at her store such as rice, soap, bread and many more. Antonia works hard to improve her family's living conditions. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. Antonia hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is married and has 3 children aged 2 to 7. The eldest are in school. She sells sorghum and beans in a shop she has run for 3 years. The loan will be used to increase the volume of sorghum and beans for sale. Clemantine will use any profits to build a house and pay school fees for her children. She dreams to one day own a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOTE est composé de treize personnes qui habitent le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Inès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Inès est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Ernest. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Inès a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Inès fait de la transformation de la farine de manioc qu'elle vend depuis une dizaine d'année dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Inès vend de l'huile de palme. Inès s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Inès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE , un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: AYIDOTE is a group composed of 13 people who live in the same village. They all have an income-generating activity. This is the second time that this group requests financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Inès, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Inès is 31 and is married to a man named Ernest. They have three children. Some of them go to school. One is still their dependent. Inès quit school at the primary level. To support her family, Inès processes cassava, which she has been selling in her area for about 10 years. Inès also sells palm oil on the side. She buys the necessary produces in a city in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Inès, along with the other members of the AYIDOTE group, is applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava to be processed

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby  is a single parent with four children. They live at Beneyase near Elmina. Baby sells meat which she has done for some time now.  As a single parent she uses her income to clothe, feed and pay her children’s school fees. Baby will use her loan to purchase more meat for sale.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for sale.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is 41 years old and a single lady. Her family are known for making rugs from older generations, but they all used to make them by hand and at their houses. 

Ibtisam has always helped her family since she was young, which gives her the experience to start a business out of them and improve the process of making them. so six years ago she bought special machines for making those rugs and sells them in the market. And through these six years, Ibtisam was able to expand the business and make a medium-sized workshop, employing people to support their families.

She also started participating in showrooms and exhibitions to show her products that were not only limited to rugs used on floors, but she also created wall hanging rugs, and also recently started taking special orders to make a specific picture on the rug using wool.

Now Ibtisam has applied for a loan so start working on expanding her business and build a bigger workshop or a factory for making rugs where she will be able to help more families, and she also wants to start conducting training courses to teach  rug-making for youths.

loans.use: to start working on expanding her business and build a bigger workshop.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is 45 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 21 years, They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Pedro Jorge

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre trabajador de 53 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y también se dedica al cultivo de diversos productos orgánicos y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de haba orgánica. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de habas orgánicas

loans.name: Domitira

texts.en:
Domitira is an energetic smallholder farmer, a person who always has a smile drawn on her face. Ten years ago, she started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Ndia, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Domitira believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

With your support, this mum will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en: Farruh is an active boy. He was born in 1997. He is a student. He is studying at the Tajik state University of Commerce. He is studying very well he participates in a lot of circles. His favorite subjects are math history and chemistry. In a future he wants to work in the sphere of bank. He is married. His wife is a homester. His parent doesn’t work anywhere it’s hard for him to pay his University tuition. He is asking for a loan of 3300 with this aim. He awaits you mercy and help with your help he can continue his studying.

loans.use: to pay University tuition.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Miss Lupita, that is how she is known in the community where she lives, Apodaca in Nuevo Leon. She is married and she is a very entrepreneurial woman. Eight years ago she started selling Forever products, as her husband's salary was not enough to cover all of their necessities, which is why she started this business to generate an extra income. This has helped ease the financial situation of the family, and it has allowed her children to continue with their studies and she can also purchase the medications she needs, a lifelong illness she is battling.

She now needs a loan of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of more products to offer her clients, to increase the volume of her sales, and her income. You have the ability to support Miss Lupita and become an important part of her successes. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lupita, así es como la conocen en la comunidad donde vive, Apodaca, Nuevo León, ella es casada, además de ser una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace 8 años inició con venta de productos forever, pues con lo que ganaba su esposo son les alcanzaba para hacer frente a todas las necesidades, es por ello que busco una actividad que le generará ingresos extras. Esto ha ayudado mucho a sanar un poco la economía familiar, además permitir la posibilidad del estudio de sus hijos y sobre todo el poder comprar a tiempo los medicamentos que ella necesita, pues se encuentra enferma y el tratamiento es de por vida.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en un la compra de más productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así poder aumentar su volumen de ventas y por ende su nivel de ingresos. Tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudar a Doña Lupita, vuélvete parte importante de sus logros, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase household products stocks for his mini-supermarket

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Born in 1961 in Agou Koumawou in the Prefecture of Kluto (Togo), Mrs. Akou A. is married and mother to two children. She is also responsible for raising a cousin. Since her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the basic needs of the family, Akou is obliged to contribute by running a little grocery store.

In order to better serve her customers, whose needs are always growing, Akou is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 so that she can improve her turnover. Once she has achieved that, she firmly believes that she will be able to better her family's living conditions.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Née en 1961 à Agou Koumawou dans la préfecture du Kloto, Madame A. Akou est mariée et est mère de deux (02) enfants et une cousine à charge. Gérante d’alimentation générale, elle est obligée de subvenir au besoin de la famille car le revenu de son mari ne lui permet pas de satisfaire pleinement la famille.

Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle devenue de plus en plus exigeante, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour renforcer son chiffre d’affaires. Une fois cet objectif atteint, elle améliorera les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Stocking her grocery store

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram I. is a 33-year-old father with two children who raises farm animals in his home village of Khoshchobanli in southern Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2003, when he came to Aqorinvest for money to buy one baby calf. Since that time, he has repaid his loan and generated enough income from the cow to buy another calf. Now Bayram would like to further expand his business by purchasing two baby calves for $200 each and one adult milk cow for $800.

loans.use: Going to purchase two baby calves for 200 USD and one milky cow for 800

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 47 year-old married woman caring for six children, two of whom are her brother's. She has a business cutting timber outside of Kampala. After she cuts the timber, she replants seedlings so that the land can become reforested. In total, she has six employees. With hand saws, they fell the trees again by hand and then saw the trees length wise into plank lumber.

Once the trees have been converted to lumber, she takes the lumber to Rubaga. There, it is used to make rough tables and chairs. She has been in business for seven years and has been receiving loans since 1998.

She plans to use a loan to hire transport for the lumber. Transportation must be paid for in advance. In addition, she plans to start farming some of the land. She would like to plant sweet potatoes and root crops. She would then sell those in the city, using the transport. On the land, she hopes to start planting sweet potatoes and root plants.

She loves the land. Her dream is to one day have a tractor and even a truck for transport.

loans.use: To hire transport for her lumber.

loans.name: Juana Burgos

texts.en:
Juana, sixty-one, and her husband have four children, all of whom are married. Juana sells an array of retail items specifically for women. She sells women’s clothing and shoes, beauty products and perfume, as well as houseware items such as curtains and tablecloths.

With her loan, Juana plans on increasing her selection, particularly offering more home décor products and new colors and patterns of curtains and tablecloths. Juana explains that her business plays an important role in preserving her good health – not only because it provides essential income, but also because it brings her great joy.

loans.use: Purchase of new home décor items for sale

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: I am Shamim Bibi and a mother of five children between 10 to 23 years. I live with my family in Lahore. My husband Nazir sells steel, tin and bronze scrap. I fix artificial gems and stones on shawls for someone for daily wages. I need a loan of $500 for my husband’s scrap business. It is difficult to meet our household expenses with our current limited income, and therefore we want to increase our income.

loans.use: Expand scrap business

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (B) Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother of two children. Her current business is fish selling. Joyce usually earns shs 30,000 in profits weekly. She wants to use the extra business profits to start up a poultry business. Gladys and Hellen sell African crafts. Margret has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to expand the business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa lives in the community of Sabana Grande, which is a rural area. Its inhabitants have scace economic resources and live humbly. In the last 18 years, she has made a living by selling used clothing in her home, which has been a favorable alternative for her neighbors, friends, and people from surrounding towns in terms of acquiring clothing.

The clothing that she sells is American, of good quality, and low in price. Every week she buys a package of varied clothing or a package of one specific garment. Her business has let her educate her two children. One is in elementary school, and one is in college. Doña Rosa hopes to buy a package of linens, because her neighbors have asked her for this on several occasions, but right now she doesn't offer this type of product.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Rosa habita en la comunidad Sabana Grande, zona rural, los pobladores son de escasos recursos económicos, viven humildemente. En los últimos 18 años se ha dedicado a vender ropa usada en su casa de habitación, la cual ha sido una alternativa favorable en cuanto a la adquisión de prendas de vestir para vecinos, amigos y pobladores de los alrededores.

La ropa que vende es americana, de buena calidad y a precios muy bajos, cada semana compra una paca de ropa variada o ya sea de una determinada prenda en específico. Su negocio le ha permitido educar a sus 2 hijos quiénes se encuentra estudiando en primaria y el otro en la universidad. La señora desea comprar una paca de ropa de cama, ya que sus vecinos le han encargado en varias ocasiones y actualmente no ofrece ese tipo de prendas.

loans.use: Purhchase of a package of used linens

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 24-year-old father of two. Mahmoud lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car electrician. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es:
Sheila is 34 years old and lives in the Miguel Gutiérrez neighborhood of Managua with her artist/painter husband and three children from a prior marriage. She and her husband have been together for a few months – a second chance for this young woman.

Sheila works very hard to take care of her house and has the support of the father of her children. For 13 years she has operated a business selling clothing and shoes. She caters to her clients in her home and at their houses. If her clients are interested in purchasing her products, she offers them easy payments. Sheila is requesting a loan to increase her working capital – she needs to buy wholesale clothes for her business.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Sheila, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la colonia Miguel Gutiérrez junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos producto de su primer matrimonio, su esposo es un artista Pintor y tienen algunos meses de estar juntos en esta segunda oportunidad que esta joven mujer se está dando.

Ella trabaja muy fuerte para mantener su casa y recibe el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, desde hace 13 años tiene un negocio propio de venta de ropa y zapatos, atiende a su clientela en su casa y a domicilio, si las personas se interesean por sus productos les ofrece facilidades de pagos. Solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo, necesita comprar ropa al por mayor para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale clothes for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lý, 32 years old, second year member of the TYM Fund, lives with her husband and two children, both are at school age. She weaves straw mattresses farms rice paddy for living. Her husband drives truck. She uses the funds from her loans to invest in her mattress weaving business. The monthL. income is 100USD. The weekL. repayment plan fits her well. Her husband chips in when needed. The famiL. economy is relativeL. comfortable and allows her to take care of her children better. She is applying for a loan of 375USD to buy straw, raw material for mattress weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý, 32 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc của chị Lý là ở nhà dệt chiếu và làm ruộng còn chồng chị lái xe chở hàng. Các vòng vốn trước chị Lý thường vay vốn mua cói dệt chiếu. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị khoảng 100USD. Nhờ có thu nhập thường xuyên nên việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Lý rất thuận lợi. Những khi có khó khăn chồng chị lại hỗ trợ một cách tích cực. Kinh tế khá giả nên chị Lý có điều kiện chăm sóc con cái nhiều hơn. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 375USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en: Kaday Kopey is 50 years of age and married with 6 children.  Four of her children are still schooling and her business income contributes a lot to the education of the children.  Kaday's husband is a motor mechanic with irregular income.  Kaday is a group leader.  The group had 5 members, but 3 members decided to rest from taking loans until after the rain season. Kaday sells palm oil and Nazratu K. sells fish; both members are requesting a loan of Le.1,600,000, and Le.800,000 in order to increase their stock and income.

loans.use: Purchase fish and palm oil

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en: Emilia Torrez C. (pictured far right) is the president of her Esperanza Bank of Hope, Vida ("life").  She is the mother of seven children--aged 22, 21, 18, 15, 14, 10, and 9--and is putting her loan funds towards starting a well-stocked underwear store.  Her primary goal for the  future is to work hard so that she and her children can see the business grow.

loans.use: Sale of women's underwear

loans.name: Salma's Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Salma is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 6 months. She became a bites seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with bites sales, charcoal and firewood sales, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gulchehrakhon

texts.en: E. Gulchehrakhon is 38 years old. She is the married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a metalworker and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She is selling women’s underwear in the local market of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today Gulchehrakhon requests $800 USD to purchase additional merchandise to increase the range of her selling goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Gulchehrakhon is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Gulchehrakhon’s business.

loans.use: Gulchehrakhon would like to purchase new women's underwear to resell.

loans.name: Crecelia

texts.en:
Crecelia P. F. lives with her husband and 3 children in Ayacucho. She is a member of the community bank, LLamkasum, which means "let's work together" in Quechua. You can find P. at her house every day with the cows, guinea pigs and pigs that she sells, on order, to her customers.

She plans to invest her loan of 1500 soles in the purchase of more livestock. With her savings, P. plans in the future to build her own house.

loans.use: the purchase of more livestock

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en:
Cassien N. sends his greetings from Musanze, Ruhengeri, the northern province of Rwanda! He is 49 years old, married with 9 children.

This entrepreneur sells various items in local markets such as cooking pots, cassava flour, sandals, and clothes for young children, household utensils, foodstuffs, etc. Besides this business, this client owns various plots of land and grows potatoes, beans, and sorghum both for home consumption and for sale to increase his income. He employs 2 people to help him in the business.

He is applying for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to increase his inventory. He will be repaying this loan over 7 months.

loans.use: expand his inventory

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria tiene 44 años, vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de productos andinos como quinua, cañihua, cebada, etc., en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Demetria ha venido trabajando en este negocio desde hace 22 años, al no tener pareja ni hijos, se dedica netamente a su trabajo para cubrir ese espacio vacío, pero ella ha sabido lidiar con eso y se siente muy optimista en realizar todas sus metas, ya que el negocio va muy bien las ventas son buenas y espera hacerlo crecer aún mas, sabiendo que los productos que ofrece son naturales y le hacen muy bien a las personas que los consumen. Demetria se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para comercializarlos y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Demetria is 44 years old and lives alone in the house which her parents left to her. She sells products from the Andean region -such as quinoa, cañihua (a high-protein grain similar to quinoa) and barley- in one of the best known markets in the city of Juliaca. Demetria has worked in this line of business for the past 22 years. Since she has no husband or children, she is completely dedicated to her work to fill this void. However, she has learned how to deal with this and feels very optimistic about reaching all her goals. The business is going well, sales are good and she hopes to be able to grow even more as her products are natural and very good for those who consume them. Demetria is currently in her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and has been very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she will buy greater quantities of the products she sells so as to achieve greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products she sells

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando C. é natural de Boane um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, é casado e pai de três filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 12 anos e o segundo com três e ultimo com um ano de idade respectivamente.

Fernando estudou até segunda classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras da família, muito novo teve que desenvolver actividade comercial para poder se sustentar teve como seu primeiro negocio a venda de pão e mais tarde investiu num pequeno estabelecimento comercial e começou a vender produtos da primeira necessidade. Hoje tem um estabelecimento maior tipo mercearia. Tem um rendimento mensal aproximadamente 24000,00mt e consegue poupar 2000,00mt.

Para Fernando este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 8000,00mt e aplicou na compra de mercadoria, este também pretende fazer o mesmo. Futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para permitir mais poupança para mais tarde comprar uma viatura afim de ajudar nas compras de mercadorias.
texts.en:
Fernando C. is from Boane, one of the districts in the province of Maputo. He is 35 years old, married, and father of 3 children aged twelve, three, and one respectively. Fernando studied until the second grade, after which he had to stop because his family lacked the financial resources. From a young age Fernando had to work to support himself. His first business was selling bread, and later he invested in a small commercial establishment and started selling basic goods. Today he has a larger, general store type of establishment. His monthly income is approximately 24,000.00 MT and he is able to save 2,000.00 MT. This is Fernando’s second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. His first was for 8,000.00 MT, which he used to buy supplies. He intends to do the same with this loan. In the future he would like to request another loan that would permit him to save more money so that he can later buy a vehicle to help in purchasing supplies.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi A. is 45 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen utensils like spoon, pots, plates, et cetera. She started this business in 2002.

Kemi needs the loan of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She wishes to thank all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Everlyne Susan

texts.en:
Everlyne Susan A. A. is a 29-year-old married mother of two. She lives with her family in the small village of Molem, just outside of Kisumu, Kenya. Everlyne has recently joined the K-MET network of volunteer Community Health Workers. As such, she is eligible for a loan from the K-MET micro-finance department.

In 2005 Everlyne started a business selling maize on the street. She used to be a maid in a private home, but decided that she would rather be her own boss. Selling maize is a fairly easy business and it gives her money for her children’s school fees and lunches.

Everlyne is applying for a loan of approximately 550 USD in order to buy sacks of maize from the wholesalers who travel through town.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika T. is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. Malika has a successful flour-selling business at the local market in the town of Isfara, where she sells an assortment of different sorts of high-quality flour. She has been engaged in this type of business for two years and within that short period has become a very successful entrepreneur. While her business is doing very well, she sees the opportunity to increase her sales by maintaining a larger inventory of goods. Therefore, Malika is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more goods for resale.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Buying flour to increase her stock for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipe surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : Venta de Ropas, Venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa, peluqueria, venta de comidas, taller de costuras y otros . El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000 a 1.800.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente. 

1.	Porfiria S. Rolón- Venta de Comestibles
2.	Celia M. Villalba- Despensa
3.	Alba P.- Despensa
4.	Agustina Fernández- Venta de Peluches
5.	María Silvia M. – Venta de Comestibles
6.	María Antonia S.- Venta de mercaderias comestibles
7.	Graciela C.- Venta de comestibles
8.	Nimia A. Soto- Despensa
9.	Juana S. Rolon- Pasera 
10.	Valentina Ramírez- Venta de Comestibles 
11.	Candelaria Domínguez- Venta de comidas
12.	Nancy B.- Venta de libros
13.	Luz M. Gauto- Peluqueria
14.	Silvia S. Rolon- venta de ropas
15.	Patricia C.- Venta de comidas
16.	Mirian S.- Taller costuras
17.	Edit C.- cocinera
18.     Emilda C. - Venta de ropas
texts.en:
This group from the Barrio Chaipe came into being because of contact with one of the members of the foundation. All of the women are involved in productive activities such as clothing sales; sale of food; running a grocery store; working as a hairdresser; the sale of meals, running a seamstress shop; and others. The amount each woman will receive varies from 300,000 – 1,800,000 PYG. All of the women will use the loan for their current businesses.

1. Porfiria S. Rolón- Foodstuffs Sales 2. Celia M. Villalba- Grocery Store 3. Alba P.- Grocery Store 4. Agustina Fernández- Stuffed Animal Sales 5. María Silvia M. – Foodstuffs Sales 6. María Antonia S.- Foodstuffs Sales 7. Graciela C.- Foodstuffs Sales 8. Nimia A. Soto- Grocery Store 9. Juana S. Rolon- Transports goods from other countries for retail sales 10. Valentina Ramírez- Foodstuffs Sales 11. Candelaria Domínguez- Sales of Prepared Meals 12. Nancy B.- Book Sales 13. Luz M. Gauto- Hairdresser 14. Silvia S. Rolon- Clothing Sales 15. Patricia C.- Sale of Prepared Meals 16. Mirian S.- Seamstress Shop 17. Edit C.- Cook 18. Emilda C. - Clothing Sales

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes; buy foodstuffs such as flour, oil, noodles, herbs, cigarettes,drinks, meat; to buy cosmetics for hair dressing; to buy books, to buy meat for the making and selling of meals; to buy clothes

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow and has three grown-up children. She owns a little store, located close to the market area, and sells women's clothing and shoes. Valentina has been in this business for eight years. Her vast experience helps her to choose the right goods that sell well. Valentina lives by herself in a small apartment.

Valentina would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. The larger the assortment, the more clients she can attract. Valentina would spend additional income to help her children with their living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali S. is thirty–six years old. He is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. He says all of his children are currently in primary school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Ali works very hard to provide for the family. His wife is unemployed at the moment. Ali is a trader. He deals in charcoal and cereals. He buys the cereals from nearby villages and the bags of charcoal from the burners in the nearby communities. He supplies to retailers and food vendors in his community. Ali says he also treks to other towns to supply his goods. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the goods in bulk. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and cereals in bulk

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
K. abra exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle a commencé cette activité en 2007. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, elle fait face présentement à une rupture de stock. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite  de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 cartons de crème « VIT FEE », 15 boîtes de lait « CACAO BOETER » et divers produits cosmétiques.
Elle est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
K. Abra earns revenues from commerce in cosmetics. She started this business in 2007. She stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lome. Presently, she faces inventory shortages. She wants to resupply herself and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy ten boxes of VIT FEE cream, fifteen boxes of CACAO BOETER milk, and various cosmetic products. She is unmarried. With the revenues from her business, she supports herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela K. is a married, Tanzanian woman. She makes and sells traditional clothes called Batick at Mnyamani ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the raw materials from wholesale shops at Kariakoo market. She makes different types with different colors of Batick. Many African women use Batick to make dresses.

She has been in the business for three years and needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more raw materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buying raw materials to make Batick.

loans.name: Nailina

texts.en:
Nailina M. is originally from the town of Moamba. After the Mozambican civil war ended, she moved to Boane in 1994 in search of better living conditions and opportunities for her children. She supports her two children and sends money home to her mother in Moamba.

Nailina is a temporary employee at the administrative building in Boane, where she works as a janitor. This will be her fifth loan with Kiva partner, Hluvuku-Adsema; she has paid back the other four successfully. Nailina intends on using this loan to realize her dream of finalizing the construction of her home.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her home

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en: Aishe makes a living selling cosmetics and hair extensions. She has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Aishe is 20 years old, single, and has no children. She says thank you to all the Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto D., 57-years old, has been farming since 1960. Currently, he is tilling a one and 3/4 hectare rice field which is the bread and butter of his family. He hopes to make his farm productive and that his children will finish their studies.

Hoping for a better harvest, he would like a loan of Php 15,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. He plans to buy fertilizers and chemicals to ensure the healthy growth of his rice plants. The loan will hopefully not just give an abundant harvest but also a bigger family income.

Norberto actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings. He has also received training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Artin

texts.en:
Artin is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a home painter since 1995 and has twenty years of experience in this field.

Today, Artin is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for crop

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre La Esperanza, se conformó en fecha 17 de agosto del 2006, primeramente la Sra. Herma T., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tabaco  fue a visitar a su madre en su domicilio que queda en la compañía   Jugua Ñaro y forma parte del distrito de Itá, de ahí que la misma se enteró de la existencia de ciertos grupos de Comités de Mujeres que ya se habían formado en esa zona. Ella quiso conocer aun más acerca del mismo y se comunicó con una de las señoras que integraban tal comité, se  informó sobre el programa y la incitó a formar su propio grupo con sus vecinas ya que ella vivía en una zona un poco más alejada. Entonces contactó con una asesora así fue interiorizándose más de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 11º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo es excelente, tienen hasta un  comportamiento de pago impecable y el trato entre ellas es inmejorable. Gracias a esto y a su trabajo solidario siguen  adelante incrementando sus ingresos y  trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de  1.125.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de tabaco, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de ropas, venta de gallinas, venta de muebles, venta de miel, decoraciones y venta de comestibles en el kiosco, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías para la despensa(arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos, panificados, gaseosas, etc.) compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comestibles, ETC.

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es: La asociación Flor del Campo está en su Segundo ciclo, además de que la mayoría vive en la zona de Villa Exaltación zona humilde, el grupo está conformado por 14 socios  de los cuales uno es varón. El Sr. Ever se dedica a la venta de guantes, las demás socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como ser: venta de comida, venta y elaboración de masitas y repostería, venta de ropa, venta de frutas, elaboración de chamarras, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de abarrotes, elaboración de edredones esta última es la actividad de la Presidenta de la asociación la Sra. Rosa. Expresan una vez más su voluntad de trabajar con el crédito otorgado por la institución la misma que les será de gran ayuda para el fortalecimiento y expansión de sus diferentes negocios y actividades, algunos de ellos ya han trabajado con tecnologías similares y les ha ido bien, por eso también están con mucho interés para desarrollar el ciclo, y seguir en el futuro con más ímpetu.
texts.en:
The "Flower of the Countryside" Association is in its second loan cycle. The majority of members live in the humble Bolivian neighborhood of Villa Exaltación. The group consists of 14 members, one of whom is male. Mr. Ever sells gloves, and the rest of the members are engaged in different activities including: food sales, pastry sales, clothing sales, jacket making, cosmetics sales, produce sales, grocery sales, and quilt making. This last activity is the livelihood of the association's president, Ms. Rosa. The members would like to express their eagerness to work with the funds bestowed by the institution; this willingness is what will help in strengthening and expanding their respective businesses and activities. Some of the members have already worked in similar capacities with success. For this reason they are very interested in undertaking a new cycle of development, and in continuing on into the future with more momentum.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refinancing to increase capital.

loans.name: Acia

texts.en:
Acia is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Acia is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Acia has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Eki

texts.en:
Eki is a hairstylist and she also sells hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for five years.

Eki is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a businessman. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.en:
Esmelda A. is 57 years old and single. She lives in her own house in Encarnacion.

Esmelda is a merchant. She sells jewelry such as rings, bracelets, and necklaces. Through this work, she has been able to earn a good profit, cover her household expenses, and save enough for a rainy day. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Gs to buy more stock for the end-of-year season.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao. Ella tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 9 hijos (7 D. ellos viven con ella y 2 ya tienen su familia)y estudiò hasta  tercero D. primaria.
Rosalía trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; se dedica a la compra y venta D. verduras los días viernes y domingos, y paralelamente compra y venD. animales como : vaca ,ovejas y otros.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 2 ovejas, 2 chanchitos y que luego los vendió.
Ella solicitarà un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles los que invertirá la mitad en animales y la otra mitad en su negocio D. verduras.
Su visión hacia el futuro es ser mayorista en su negocio y repartir sus productos, y a su vez dejar a sus hijos bien establecidos.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su banco comunal es asistir a las reuniones y charlas que dan las promotoras y aprender a ser puntual.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Community Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” from the district of Pilcuyo, in El Collao province, Peru. She is 43 years old, is married, and has 9 children. Seven of the children live with her and two have their own families. She studied up to third graD. in elementary school. Rosalia has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 4 years. She works buying and selling vegetables on Fridays and Sundays, and also works buying and selling animals such as cows, sheep, and others. She tells us that with her first loan, which was for 300 Peruvian soles, she bought 2 sheep and 2 pigs that she later sold. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Peruvian soles. She will invest half in animals and half in her vegetable business. He vision for the future is to work as a wholesaler in her business and to distribute her products. She would also like to see her children well established on their own. What she likes the most about her community bank is going to the meetings and talks that are given by the organizers, and learning to be on time.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, sheep, etc.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a fifty-five-year-old married man living in El Saksakiyeh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and seven children. Hasan owns a cafeteria and a mini-market, and he sells fruits and vegetables. Being a father of seven children leads to several costs such as school fees, clothes, medications and many other important living expenses. Hasan loves his family and works hard to provide them with all they need. Hasan requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for his mini market; especially since it is the only mini-market in the area, it forces him to work hard to keep in stock everything his customers may ask for. Hasan is also planning to buy an espresso machine, which will provide additional income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his mini-market

loans.name: Porisa

texts.en: Porisa, 38 years old, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and her oldest is 17 years old. Porisa is a farmer. She owns a carabao, which helps her cultivate the land for rice crops. She is now preparing the land for planting. She will need supplies for the farm. She applied for a loan of PHP 5, 000. With this loan, Porisa will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Nani Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Nani Maiya B., a 29-year-old resident of Sainbu-Bhaishepati lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Bisho Ratna B. and her two sons. Her husband is a mechanic. Both her sons are studying in primary school. 
Mrs. B. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. Due to lack of money, she cannot expand her business. So she seeks a loan of Rs 10,000 to buy necessary goods like noodles, biscuits and others to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old. Anaclita is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Anaclita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Anaclita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anaclita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anaclita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Anaclita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Silvia Helena

texts.es: Silvia Helena tiene 43 años, por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su condición económica es la venta de materiales de construcción. Por lo que ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente que se esfuerza cada día para  mejorar su ingresos. Pues todos los días busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos y ha demostrado que puedo mantener a sus 4 hijos, pues tuvo que mantener este negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena, piedrín, cal y cantera. Ella siempre sueña con seguir ampliando su local y proporcionar mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Silvia Helena is 43 years old and has always fought to improve her economic condition. She sells construction materials and has proven herself as an excellent client who strives each day to earn more income.
