Silvia has demonstrated that she is capable of supporting her four children, providing them with an education, and maintaining her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, limestone, and quarry rocks. She always dreams of expanding her business and providing better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement blocks, sand, gravel, limestone, and quarry rocks

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam vive en casa alquilada con su esposo en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de maní endulzado el cual lo vende al por mayor y menor el la calle garita de lima, que es un lugar muy concurrido y con mucha clientela.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más maní y azúcar y poder elaborar su producto en cantidad.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Miriam lives in a rented house in the neighbourhood of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz with her husband. Her job is making candied peanuts which she sells both wholesale and retail in Garita Street in Lima. The loan she is asking for will be used as capital to buy more peanuts and sugar so she can make larger quantities of the product. Miriam has been a client with Kiva partner Impro since 2007, and as she has always made her repayments on time, she is able to have another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar in large quantities

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Julienne est mariée à HOUSSOU Gaspard et est mère de deux enfants. Le couple à trois autres enfants à leurs charges. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Il y a près de six ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Julienne n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis huit ans, Julienne mène comme activité, la vente de pâtes dentifrices et des produits de soins à Agbangandan. Julienne s'approvisionne au marché de Houègbo et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne a bénéficié une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé et a bien effectué les remboursements. Julienne sollicite un second prêt de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Julienne A. is married to Gaspard HOUSSOU and has two children. The couple have three other children in their care. Some of the children are at school. Almost six years ago the family settled down in the Agblangandan district of the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. The couple share responsibility for the various family expenses. Julienne did not go to school. For the past eight years she has been selling toothpaste and healthcare products in Agbangdan. She gets her supplies in the market at Houègbo and also in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Julienne has already had one loan from ALIDé and repaid it without incident. She is applying for a second loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and respond better to customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothpaste and healthcare products

loans.name: Anwari's Group

texts.en:
Anwari is married to M. A. and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her house consists of two rooms in which she lives with her two kids: one son and one daughter, and her husband. Her son reads in 4th standard and her daughter reads in 5th standard. Her husband is a tailor by profession and runs his own tailoring shop in the main market. His earnings support his family.

Anwari is also a very hard working lady. She operates her own handbags sales business, which she purchases from different places of Lahore named (Ichra and Anarkali) and then sells them in the community. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.

Anwari has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance insitutute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase an electric sewing machine to expand her husband’s tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha conversamos con la señora María que desde hace 4 ciclos viene trabajando con los créditos de la Fundación.

La señora María es comerciante de legumbres en el mercado de su parroquia natal, el esposo se dedica a la venta de materiales en plásticos como baldes, cepillos, tarrinas, escobas y mas, ellos juntos invierten el dinero que reciben de la Fundación cada uno en su negocio.

La señora María viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil para surtir el negocio del esposo, lo realiza dos veces al mes, y en las legumbres que es el negocio de ella es el esposo que se encarga de ir al mercado central de Portoviejo a comprar las legumbres para luego que la señora María las venda en su puesto que tiene en el mercado de Picoaza.

Este nuevo crédito que recibirá nuestra socia lo invertía en los productos que ambos venden, cada día sus negocios están creciendo y dejándoles bueno resultados en ganancias. El sueño de nuestra socia es tener su propia casa en los actúale momentos viven en casa de la mamá de ella.
texts.en:
In the communal bank "Mujeres De Lucha," we spoke with señora María, who has participated in 4 cycles of loans from the field partner Fundación. Señora María sells vegetables in the market of her native parish. Her husband makes his living selling plastics, such as buckets, brushes, small tubs, brooms and more. Together, they each invest the money they receive from Fundación in their own businesses. Señora María travels to the city of Guayaquil to stock up on items for her husband's business. She does this twice a month. As far as the vegetables, which is her business, her husband is the one who takes care of going the the central market in Portoviejo. He buys the vegetables there so that señora María can then sell them from her post at the market in Picoaza. This new loan that our member will receive will be invested in the products that both she and her husband sell. Day by day, their businesses are growing and are giving them good profits. Our member's dream is to have her own home, being that they are currently living in her mother's home.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and plastics, such as buckets, brushes, small tubs and brooms.

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
Five people, who make up this group loan, live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Sokhon T. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members.

Mrs. Sokhon T. is a lotus seller in the local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So, to improve her business, she is asking for a loan to buy more lotuses to resell.

Mrs. Sokhon T.’s husband, Mr. Hou Or, is a farmer who rents a small piece of land on which he grows lotus to sell to support his family. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are helping their parents to grow lotus, while the other one is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy more lotuses to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris K. S. is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is located at Mariakani, a very busy market in Mombasa, and it is known by the name "Dama's Cereals." 

She sells maize, beans and peas to the local people.She says the business is very profitable and she would like to grow it more. She says that she really loves what she does and she plans to build a premise where she can run her business better. 

She is using her loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to restock her business. She is hardworking and God-fearing.

loans.use: Maize, beans, peas

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: O. Fatima est née en 1954 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé. Fatima est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Fatima vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Il y a environs une vingtaine d'année que Fatima s'est installée au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fatima n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Fatima vend divers produits (sucre, piles, savons, bougies, insecticides, huile végétale,  etc.) à son domicile. Fatima s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Fatima est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Fatima désire développer davantage son activité et l'agrandir, afin de mieux faire face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Fatima sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Fatima O. was born in 1954 in Adjohoun, in the department of Oueme. Fatima is a widow and mother to five children, all in school and still under her care. Fatima lives together with her children and is the sole provider for their expenses. For about twenty years Fatima has lived in the quarter of Gankpodo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Fatima did not go to school. To maintain the various expenses and support the needs of her children, Fatima sells diverse products (sugar, batteries, soap, candles, insecticide, vegetable oil, etc...) from her home. Fatima stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Fatima is a past client of Alidé, having already received five loans which have all been repaid. Fatima wants to further develop and expand her business in order to better respond to the numerous requests of her clientele which is why she is seeking another credit from Alidé

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (cartons of soap and sugar, cans of vegetable oil, candles, batteries, etc...)

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa I. is 52 years old, married and has 7 children.  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Orepa needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 80 talas or US $33 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Orepa joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Orepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ruena

texts.en: Ruena S. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old. Ruena is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruena raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Ruena has been engaged in farming for more than eight years. She recently started growing hogs for fattening and sale. She hopes for this new venture to grow as well. Ruena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ruena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional piglets. This will be the second loan taken out by Ruena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional piglets

loans.name: Wazaria

texts.fr: en 2002 B. a débuté le commerce de produits d'alimention générale. elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d'atsanvé à Lomé. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Son stock actuel de marchandises est en baisse. elle voudrait s'approvisionner et demande un premier crédit à WAGES afin de s'acheter 10 sacs de riz, 5 sacs d'haricots, 5 bidons d'huile, 7 cartons de sucre et  divers.
texts.en:
In 2002, Ms. B. began selling general food items. She sells her goods at the Atsanvé local market in Lomé. She purchases her stock at the Lomé Grand Market. Her current stock of items is low. She would like to increase her stock and is requesting her first loan through WAGES so she can purchase 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of beans, 5 jugs of oil, 7 boxes of sugar, and other items.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Group

texts.en:
Venuste is 30 years old and the leader of a group called Abajyamugambi.  This group is commonly known for selling a variety of agricultural products and they have been in this business for a long time.  The business hours are from 6 am until late in the evening.

Venuste and his team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once given this loan, they will keep expanding their business by purchasing a large quantity of agricultural products.  With these additional agricultural products, Venuste and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep expanding their business for a better financial stability and start saving for the future of their families.

loans.use: To purchase more agricultural products

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Arístides, de 55 años, vive a lado de su esposo Heraclio de 56 años y de su hija mayor de los 6 que tiene en total, pues el resto viven independientes con sus propias familias. Desde muy joven empezó ha trabajar y siempre pensaba alcanzar el progreso a lado de su familia, es por eso que en la actualidad labora en su restaurante y prepara comida para los trabajadores de una empresa de transportes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues sabe cocinar distintos platillos que son la delicia de sus habituales comensales, que no solo la buscan por la exquisitez de sus comidas, si no también por los económicos precios que ofrece. El paso del tiempo le ha permitido captar clientes fijos que le pagan diario y también una vez por semana, es por eso que tiene capital estable que le permite comprar sus ingredientes sin problemas. Sabe que si se lo propone este pequeño negocio, que ha implementado con gaseosas, podrá ampliarse más, es por eso que para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una pequeña tienda de comestibles dentro de su restaurante. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y promete será cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Arístides ya tiene pensado invertir el crédito dinero solicitado en la compra de  ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para continuar con la preparación de comida, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aristides is 55 years old and lives with her husband Heraclio. They have 6 children together. The eldest daughter still lives with them, and the others live with their own families now. From the time she was very young Aristides has worked and has always thought of improving the quality of life for her family. Today she works in her restaurant preparing meals for the workers of a transportation company. She likes her work a lot, and she knows how to cook special dishes for her regular diners, who come to her not only for her great food, but also for the good prices she offers. Over time, she has developed a good base of customers who pay her every day or every week, which enables her to continuously purchase the ingredients she needs without difficulty. She knows that she could grow this business, and in the future she would like to set up a small general market inside. This is Aristides' 4th loan with MFP, and she commits to continue with her monthly payments. She also appreciates all of the people who provide the support for her to continue with her work. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients wholesale, and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients she uses in her small restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Constructing a room.

loans.name: Daisy Caballa Group

texts.en:
Daisy C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Daisy is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately $66 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Daisy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion G. is a widow who lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food vending business. Consolacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Consolacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, raising the family's standard of living.  For her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the education of her youngest child. Consolacion is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La señora Irene Garcia Juárez es una mujer pensionada y apoyada económicamente por sus hijos que viven es los estados unidos. En este momento desea arreglar la tubería de su casa  que esta tirando mucha agua por lo tanto le sale más caro el recibo. Es por ello que desea arreglar este problema lo antes posible para no estar desperdiciando tanta agua.
texts.en: Sra. Irene Garcia Juárez is a pensioner and receives financial support from her children who live in the United States.  At the moment, she wants to repair the plumbing in her house since pipes are leaking large amounts of water, thereby leaving her with expensive utility bills.  For this reason, she wants to fix the problem as soon as possible to prevent wasting so much water.

loans.use: Pay for plumbing repairs

loans.name: Yurem Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yurem está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es María José G. V. de 21 años quien tiene una pequeña panadería oficio que aprendió de su esposo el cual lo heredo de sus padres. Ella considera su negocio familiar en cual trabaja arduamente para salir adelante y para que su hijo tenga estudio, alimentación, amor y sobre todo niñez.
Las otras integrantes son Zulmira Maltez de 25 años quien vende ropa desde hace años y Martha Lorena F. Hondoy quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y nueva.
texts.en:
Three hardworking women make up the Yurem loan group. One of them is María José G. V., who is 21 years old and runs a small bakery. She learned this profession from her husband, who inherited the bakery from his parents. She considers it to be a family business and works hard to get ahead and give her son schooling, food, love, and above all a good childhood. 

The other members of the group are Zulmira Maltez, who is 25 years old and has been selling clothes for some years, and Martha Lorena F. Hondoy, who works selling both new and used clothing.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene la edad de 39 años, madre de tres hijos, es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado apoyar  a su familia atreves de su negocio.
Tiene una pequeña pulpería y palmea tortilla, negocio que inicio con dinero de su trabajo como costurera debido a que se le bajo su trabajo y no le estaba dando ingreso opto por palmear tortilla y su pequeña venta quien su esposo dio para que comenzara, quien trabaja como cadete de taxi.
Con este préstamo comprara varios quintales de maíz, maseca, leña para elevar la producción de tortilla.
Está contenta por esta nueva inversión a producir más tortillas, lo que espera lograr el objetivo y que gracias Afodenic hará posible.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old.  She has three children and is an enterprising woman who has managed to support her family through her business.

Carmen has a small grocery store and she hand-makes tortillas.  She started her business with money from her work as a dressmaker.  Her work went down and she wasn't making enough income, so she decided to make tortillas instead.  Her husband, who works as a taxi driver, helped her to start up her small store.

Carmen will use her loan to buy several 100kg sacks of corn, Maseca corn flour and firewood, to increase her tortilla production.

She is grateful for this new investment for making tortillas and she hopes that, thanks to Afodenic, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy several 100kg sacks of corn to produce more tortillas and make more profits

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en:
Mr. Amarbayasgalan is 32 years old single. He lives in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He rents a stall in Bumbugur, the second largest indoor market in Ulaanbaatar, where he sells jeans. 

Before 2009, he worked in Korea on a labor contract. When he returned to Mongoloia, he used his savings to start a retail jeans business. Currently his business is doing well and he has gained some valuable experience. He has two younger brothers whom he supports by paying their annual student fees. 

Lately, he has been studying the shoe sales market and decided to sell shoes, too. He needs to increase his working capital to stock some shoes. 

Mr.Amarbayasgalan is planning a quite few improvements in the near future, such as building a house, marrying his fiancee, and opening his own small shop. He is a very ambitious and energetic person. The loan will be used to buy shoes and jeans to sell.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and to buy shoes and jeans to sell

loans.name: Nelson Njoroge

texts.en:
Nelson has been selling shoes in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is 36 years old and married to Loise Wanjiku. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more shoes to sell.

In the future, Nelson hopes to build his own shop from which to operate and save on paying rent.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister’s grandchildren). She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.
Sarah has a retail business selling phones. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works seven days of the week. Sarah sells her products in a retail shop. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mobile phones, phone batteries, chargers and sim cards. Sarah's main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones, phone batteries, chargers and sim cards

loans.name: Maguellitos Group

texts.es:
El señor Sebastián Pérez Hernández, vive en la localidad de San Juan Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con la señora  Elena Pérez Pérez,  Y tiene un hijo  de nombre Sebastián quien trabaja para apoyarlos  con los ingresos de la casa.

         El préstamo que solicito es para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ganados como son  las becerros y vacas, para engordarlo y luego venderlo de nuevo en la misma región, con esta actividad le va bien ya que nos cometa que lleva tres años  y le ha dado buenos resultados.

        Inicio por si solo ya que  para salir adelante con su familia tenía que  tener de donde sostenerse  y de dónde sacar los ingreso para sobrevivir y con el préstamo se ha estado ayudando mucho.
 
        De cada venta que realiza lo ahorra comprando mas ganado para que cuando lo necesite esté disponible para venderlo de nuevo y así seguir trabajando para su familia que  aun que es pequeña  quiere darle lo mejor.
 
      Cometa que llano pide  nada más  solo que dios que le siga prestando vida para seguir trabajando  y tener lo más valioso que es su familia.

     Es integrante del grupo "Maguellitos" y se integra de tres personas un  hombre y dos mujeres, la razón del nombre es porque en ese lugar hay matas de maguey.

    Los integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:

   María Méndez López: invierte el préstamo en la compra de becerros para venderlo en la misma región.

   Míguela Hernández López: invierte el préstamo en la compra de vacas y becerros.

    Sebastián Pérez Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de becerros y vacas.
texts.en:
Sebastián Pérez Hernández lives in San Juan neighborhood, in the town of Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  He lives with his partner Elena Pérez Pérez and has a son called Sebastián who works to help them with their household finances.

Sebastián requested a loan to invest in buying and selling livestock such as lambs and cows which he fattens and then sells in his region.  His business is doing well.  He tells us that he has been in the business for three years and it has provided him with good results.

He started out in this business on his own initiative since, in order to get his family ahead in life, he had to have some means of support, some way of making income so that they could survive.  His loans have been helping him a lot.

Every time he makes a sale, he saves the money and buys more livestock so that when he needs to, he has animals available to sell again.  In this way he continues working for his family.  Although his family is small, he wants to provide them with the best.

Sebastián tells us that he no longer needs anything, only for God to continue granting him with life so that he can continue working and to have the most valuable thing which is his family.

Sebastián is a member of the "Maguellitos" group which has three members: one man and two women.  They gave the group this name because where they live there are 'maguey' (American aloe) plants.

The members of the group are:

María Méndez López, who will invest her loan in buying lambs to sell in her region
Míguela Hernández López, who will invest her loan in buying cows and lambs
stián Pérez Hernández, who will invest his loan in buying and selling lambs and cows.

loans.use: To buy livestock such as lambs and cows to fatten and then sell in the same region

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn S., 31, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia – an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning $2 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $40 US on food and $15 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase a new motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: El Castillo De Playa Group

texts.es: El nombre del grupo es “El Castillo de Paya”,  llamado así porque la casa de reunión tiene muchas Habitaciones,  está ubicado en el estado de Quintana Roo, Playa del Carmen, en  México. La Señora  Asunción María C.  es integrante del grupo, quienes son  muy unidas, ella tiene 41 años y estudio hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica a vender ropa de bazar,  en la entrada de su  casa desde hace 4 años, nos solicita el préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de mercancía  y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 3 pequeños hijos de 9,  5 y 13 años de edad, los cuales se siente muy orgullosos de su madre por el esfuerzo y constancia con que ella lucha día con día por ofrecerles una vida mejor vida y educación.
texts.en: The name of the group is “El Castillo de Paya” [The Castle of Paya]. It is named this because the meeting house has a lot of rooms. It is located in the state of Quintana Roo, Playa del Carmen, in México. Mrs. Asunción María C. is a member of the group, and it is very close. She is 41 years old and went to junior high school. She has sold clothes from the entryway of her house for 4 years. She is asking us for the loan to keep investing in buying merchandise and to give a better quality of life to her 3 young children, aged 9, 5 and 13. She is very proud to be their mother and she works hard and steadfastly every day to offer them a better life and education.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with three children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her desire is to construct a permanent house and educate her children. She runs a crafts shop and has been in this business for six years. She has been able to meet daily family needs and also pay school fees. The only hindrance is that the business is seasonal and her dream is to start an art gallery. 

Sarah needs the loan facility to buy craft items for resale.

loans.use: to buy crafts for resale.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua, El   Sr. Marcos Antonio Flore Téllez, se dedica  arduamente a laborar como oficinista  dedicándose a esta labor desde hace siete  años, es casado y con tres hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Marcos  atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude nuevamente a  ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda por lo que piensa construir un baño   en su casa de habitación. Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en: Marcos Antonio Flore Téllez is an office worker in Managua and has been doing this work for seven years.  He is married, has three children, and wants to provide them with the best conditions for their development.  He needs to make improvements to his home because it is currently in bad shape.  For this reason he has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy building materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron bars.  He wants to make improvements to the bathroom in his home.  This will improve the living conditions for his children and he will be able to provide a dignified room under his family’s heads.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom in his home

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells yams and cooked food at Mfuom near Abura. Maame has been through junior high school. She is married and they live together with her four children. 

Her business is a year old. She is supportive by contributing to the daily feeding of her family. A loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of yams for resale. She hopes to plow her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of yams for resale

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mrs. Mas L. sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman. They have eight children, five sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside the famiL. home, one stays at home, and others assist their father in the fishing business. They live along National Road Number 5, about thirty-two kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

One of Mas’s sons wants to launch a new business selling clothes, using a motorbike to transport the clothes to places away from his house.  He does not have motorbike. So Mas is applying for her first loan of $1,200 to help purchase a motorbike for her son.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to carry clothes for sale.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri lives in the village of Sartichala, West Georgia. He is 29 years old, unmarried and lives with his mother and sister. 

Dimitri works as a provider in a village store. He gets a salary for his job. Dimitri’s family also owns three milk cows. The milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold in the store where Dimitri works. Dimitri’s sister works as a salesperson in a supermarket in the same village. The total monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Last year, Dimitri received a loan from Credo, part of which was used for starting renovation of his house. The other part was used for expansion of his dairy farm. Now Dimitri received a second loan from Credo. He plans to use it for finalizing the renovation of the house. His family is happy, because finally they will have a renovated house and better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for materials and services for house renovation

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 29 years old, married and has one child. For the last two years, he has made a living by dairy farming and supports his family by selling milk produced by his cows. Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save money and gained important knowledge about managing a business. In the future, he hopes to open a cattle ranch. He is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy a freezer for preserving milk.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for preserving milk.

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Antonela está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias del reparto Martin Castellón en la zona urbana de Nindirí. Este grupo tiene 11 préstamos con Adim y tres con Kiva, en los cuales sus negocios han mejorado y se han perfilado como excelentes clientes.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lea de 37 años, tiene tres hijos los cuales son su motivación para salir adelante. Ella se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata negocio que poco a poco ha ido desarrollando en el cual invertirá el crédito en mercadería.

Las otras integrantes del grupo Claudia María se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, Ana es comerciante de ropa (pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños…etc.) y Arely desde hace 7 años vende prendas de oro y plata.
texts.en:
The Antonela group consists of four hardworking and enterprising women from the Martin Castellón neighborhood in the municipality of Nindirí.  They have had 11 loans with ADIM and three with Kiva in which their businesses have improved and they have achieved excellent client profiles.

The group coordinator is Lea, 37.  She has three children and they are her motivation to get ahead.  She sells gold and silver jewelry and little by little her business has been growing.

The other group members are Claudia María who sells cosmetics, Ana who sells clothing (pants, shirts, children’s items, etc), and Arely who has been selling gold and silver jewelry for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry of gold and silver jewelry (rings, bracelets, chains, etc)

loans.name: La Palma Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada la Palma la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera y tener unos de los rios mas bonitos y mas visitados de toda la region. En esta comunidad existe un grupo que lleva el nombre de la comunida la Palma el cual esta integrado por 10 personas.

La señora Elvira es una de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Gabriel con el cual tiene 2 hijos, Isais de 19 años que estudia la universidad y Gabriel de 9 años que estudia la primaria, ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su padre le enseño a elaborar los dulces tipicos de la region (cocadas, dulces de leche, dulces de ajongoli, jamoncillo y alfafores) y desde que se caso inicio a hacerlos y salir a venderlos a las comunidades cercanas como son Vicente y Tetela, ella vende sus dulces casa por casa ya que desea ganar un poco de dinero extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella nos platico un poco sobre la elaboracion de algunos de esos dulces, las cocodas las elabora con cocolo molido, los dulces de leche se preparan con leche y azucar, dulces de ajongoli con ajongoli, el jamoncillo con semilla de pipian y los alfafores con maiz, ellas nos dice que la elaboracion de sus dulces no algo muy facil ya que debe ponerle mucha dedicacion y saber los tiempo que necesita cada dulce para su elaboracion.

Ella necesita este credito para invertilo en la compra de maiz, semilla de pipian, ajongoli, leche, azucar, coco, piña, para porteriormente elaborar su deliciosos dulces y salir a verderlos.

La señora Elvira espera que su negocio prospere ya que desea que su negocio prospere y poder invertir un poco en la venta de perfumeria la cual piensa vender con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad. 

Los demas miembros del grupo son: 

claudia - venta de ropa por catalago
sandra - venta de calzado tejido
amalia - venta de antojitos mexicanos
bernardino - venta de pollo
arcadia - venta de dulces 
guadaluopa - molino 
irma - venta de ropa 
ofelia - venta de ceramica
Geronimo - venta de dulces
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called La Palma which is characterized by being located in a sugarcane region and having one of the most beautiful and most visited rivers of the entire region. In this community there is a group named the La Palma Community, which is made up of 10 people.

Señora Elvira is one of the members of this group.  She is 39 years old, has attended school only through secondary level, and is married to Señor Gabriel with whom she has 2 children.  Isais is 19 years old and studying at university, and Gabriel is 9 years and attending primary school.  She tells us that from a very young age, her father taught her to make the sweets typical of the region; cocadas (coconut sweets), dulce de leche (caramels), dulce de ajongoli (sesame seed sweets), jamoncillo (fudge), and alfafores (cookies filled with dulce de leche).  Since that time, she began making the sweets and going out to sell them to nearby communities such as Vicente and Tetela.  She sells the sweets door to door, and she wants to earn a little extra money to help her husband with household expenses and the education of their children.

She talks a little about the preparation of some of the sweets; she makes the cocadas with ground coconut, the dulce de leche caramels are made with milk and sugar, the dulces de ajongoli with sesame seeds, the jamoncillo fudge with pipian seeds (a type of squash) and the alfafores cookies with corn.   She tells us that the preparation of the sweets is not very easy, because it requires a lot of dedication and knowing the time needed to prepare each kind of sweet.

She needs this loan to invest in purchasing corn, pipian seeds, sesame seeds, milk, sugar, coconut, pineapple, to subsequently make her delicious sweets and go out to sell them.

Señora Elvira hopes to grow her business because she wants her business to flourish and to be able to invest a little in the sale of perfumes which she plans to sell to her friends and neighbors in the community.

The other members of the group are:
Claudia - sells clothing via catalog
Sandra - sells fabric shoes
Amalia - sells Mexican corn-based foods
Bernardino - sells chickens
Arcadia - sells sweets
Guadalupe - provides milling services
Irma - sells clothing
Ofelia - sells ceramic
Geronimo - sells sweets


En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada la Palma la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera y tener unos de los rios mas bonitos y mas visitados de toda la region. En esta comunidad existe un grupo que lleva el nombre de la comunida la Palma el cual esta integrado por 10 personas.

La señora Elvira es una de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Gabriel con el cual tiene 2 hijos, Isais de 19 años que estudia la universidad y Gabriel de 9 años que estudia la primaria, ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su padre le enseño a elaborar los dulces tipicos de la region (cocadas, dulces de leche, dulces de ajongoli, jamoncillo y alfafores) y desde que se caso inicio a hacerlos y salir a venderlos a las comunidades cercanas como son Vicente y Tetela, ella vende sus dulces casa por casa ya que desea ganar un poco de dinero extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella nos platico un poco sobre la elaboracion de algunos de esos dulces, las cocodas las elabora con cocolo molido, los dulces de leche se preparan con leche y azucar, dulces de ajongoli con ajongoli, el jamoncillo con semilla de pipian y los alfafores con maiz, ellas nos dice que la elaboracion de sus dulces no algo muy facil ya que debe ponerle mucha dedicacion y saber los tiempo que necesita cada dulce para su elaboracion.

Ella necesita este credito para invertilo en la compra de maiz, semilla de pipian, ajongoli, leche, azucar, coco, piña, para porteriormente elaborar su deliciosos dulces y salir a verderlos.

La señora Elvira espera que su negocio prospere ya que desea que su negocio prospere y poder invertir un poco en la venta de perfumeria la cual piensa vender con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad. 

Los demas miembros del grupo son: 

claudia - venta de ropa por catalago
sandra - venta de calzado tejido
amalia - venta de antojitos mexicanos
bernardino - venta de pollo
arcadia - venta de dulces 
guadaluopa - molino 
irma - venta de ropa 
ofelia - venta de ceramica
Geronimo - venta de dulces

loans.use: to sell sweets that are typical of the region.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He is an orphan living with his brothers.  Fares is a freelance IT specialist. He repairs PCs and electronic equipment, a hobby he picked up at an early age. He has lots of customers asking for his services due to his unique skills in his neighborhood and his fair prices. In parallel, he works in a local restaurant in order to get extra money and improve his standard of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a printer, which will facilitate his operation and keep it confidential since he will be using it mainly to print his quotations, bills, receipts etc. In the future, he is planning to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a printer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is John, who is 37 years old. He is married to a businesswoman and has 1 child, aged 11 years. He also has 1 other dependent who lives with him because he is a school-going child.

John established his own electronics business in 2004, after first joining his brother in selling cassettes. He began his business because he did not have any assistance to further his studies. He works 6 days a week, 10 hours a day, and earns about 650,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) per month. 

John would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now needs a new loan in order to buy 5 cartons of cassette tapes @ 430,000 SLL, 10 dozen VCDs @ 6,600 SLL, and 5 cartons of DVDs @ 4,500 SLL. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.

In the future, John plans to further his studies, build a house if he can access more loans and maximize profits, and see his child through school. The rains are affecting him because the construction of the market center has required changes in location that are not favorable for his business. Competition is always high, but in going for quality products he has always had good sales, and he serves good numbers of customers in the main town and surrounding villages.

John usually goes twice a week to Freetown to buy his goods. He normally goes by vehicle. He plans to open a big shop where he can order a large volume of goods. He is hardworking and honest, his business is good, and he hopes to access more loans in the future.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy assorted cassettes, VCDs, and DVDs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has five children.  Two of her children are currently in school. Jennifer has a business selling clothes, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jennifer hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Jennifer hopes to expand her business. Jennifer is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina: de 54 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales desde hace años ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es un oficio que le gusta mucho, y ademas porque le gustan mucho lo animales,le da gracias a Dios porque la crianza de sus animales a aumentado, ahora ella esta solcitando este credito para la compra de mas animales pequeños para que ya cuando esten grandes venderlos y asi aumentar sus ganancias para estar mejor aconomicamente.
texts.en: Sabina: de 54 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales desde hace años ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es un oficio que le gusta mucho, y ademas porque le gustan mucho lo animales,le da gracias a Dios porque la crianza de sus animales a aumentado, ahora ella esta solcitando este credito para la compra de mas animales pequeños para que ya cuando esten grandes venderlos y asi aumentar sus ganancias para estar mejor aconomicamente.

loans.use: Compra de animales para la venta.

loans.name: Digna Eulalia

texts.es:
La Señorita. Digna es socia del banco comunal Tres de Noviembre, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables, carismáticas y trabajadoras.

La Señorita. Diga tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá quien se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de su mamá.
 
Nuestra socia trabaja en una lavandería y lleva 4 años en el trabajo, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para apoyar a su mamá en el negocio.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Digna is a member of the 'Tres de Noviembre' community bank.  She lives in Cumbe parish which is a cold-climate area.  The locals work in commerce, farming and livestock raising.  They are very kind, charismatic and hard-working people.

Digna is 19 years old, single, and lives with her mom who raises and sells animals.  The house in which she lives belongs to her mom.

Digna works in a laundrette and has been in her job for four years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.

This is the first loan that Digna has taken out a loan from her community bank, which she was invited to join by her mom.  She will invest her loan money in buying livestock in order to support her mom in her business.

Digna's goal is to buy herself a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Anayeli es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene 23 años de edad y tiene dos niños, la mayor de 4 años la cual estudia el preescolar y un niño de un año. Ana como es conocida por sus vecinos y familiares tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace aproximadamente un año. Platica Ana que emprendió su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de los niños y para estar mas al pendiente de ellos ya que están pequeños. Anayeli pidió un crédito a la financiera para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella comprará azúcar, leche, frijol, detergente, cloro, pan, enlatados, pañales, servilletas, papel higiénico etc. Ana esta muy contenta por que dice que es la segunda ocasión que lo pide y que gracias a los créditos  tiene una fuente de empleo con la cual ayudar a su esposo. 
Las otras nueve integrantes del  grupo se llaman Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Blanca, Argelia, Susana, America y Karen Alejandra, ellas invertirán su crédito en una papelería, en club nutricional, tienda de ropa, antojitos mexicanos, taqueria, frutas y verduras y deposito de refrescos.
texts.en:
Anayeli is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and has two children. Her older child is a four-year-old preschool student and her other child is only a year old. Ana, as she is known to her neighbors and relatives, has managed a grocery store for approximately one year. She says that she started this business in order to help her husband with their children’s expenses. Ana also wants to provide more for them while they are still young. She is requesting a loan to restock her grocery store. Ana will buy sugar, milk, beans, detergent, bleach, bread, canned goods, diapers, napkins, toilet paper, and other products. She is very pleased because this is the second time she has requested a loan. Thanks to the financing, she has a source of employment by which she can help her husband.

The other nine members of the group are Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Blanca, Argelia, Susana, America, and Karen Alejandra. They will invest their loans in a stationery store, a nutritional club, a clothing store, a Mexican street food business, a taco shop, a fruit and vegetable stand, and a soft drink repository.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mulinge

texts.en:
Mulinge is a widow with one child who has finished school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a beauty salon for the past three years.  Her clients are the local community residents. She faces a major challenge of a lack of customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs10,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her salon. She decided to join Yehu because of easily accessed loans.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Osmar Daniel

texts.es: Omar Daniel se dedica a la venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Lo inicio porque en su finca realizaba la crianza  y venta de cerdos pues la experiencia la tiene por un buen tiempo. El sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda ya que no ha podido realizarlo porque no ha tenido el dinero necesario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues en algunos lugares de su comarca les ofrecen los cerdos a precios favorbles.
texts.en: Omar Daniel sells pigs; he’s had the business for over four years.  He started it because he raised pigs in his farm to sell and he has quite a bit of experience.  His dream is to finish building his house that he hasn’t been able to complete for lack of funds.  The loan is to buy pigs because there are places in his area selling them at favorable prices.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de sesenta y dos años de edad vive con sus hijos y nietos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues a pesar de ser una excelente vendedora lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio que les ofrece Graciela es inigualable siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro; es una mujer amante del trabajo, para ella no existe en el mundo nada más poderoso que una mujer trabajando por un objetivo, es por eso que ella es dedicada a su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos etc. Graciela tiene la confianza que así lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Graciela, 62 years of age, lives with her children and nephews in her own home.  She own a business selling beauty products such as perfumes, creams and others.  She has lately obtained many customers because in addition to being a good sales person, the quality of her products is very good and the prices are more than reasonable.  Also, the service that Graciela offers is unequalled, she always greets her customers with a smile.  She is a woman that loves to work.  For her there does not exist anything more powerful than a woman working towards a goal, this is why she is so dedicated to her business.  She is requesting a loan fro INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc..  Graciela has confidence that thru her work she will be able to give her family financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jus Makmur Group

texts.en:
Komariah is 47 years old and married with four children.  They are all of school age and are currently attending school.  She has been selling eggs, rice, flour, and sugar from a shop in front of her house since the year 2000.  Her husband is a driver.  She hopes that their combined income is enough to send all of her children to university in the future.

She enjoys her business because it is a daily stream of income and so far it has been going well.  However, there has been increased competition recently so she feels that by having this loan to increase her products she can grow her client base.

loans.use: to pay for more eggs, rice, flour, sugar to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie has 2 children. She has been a maize farmer for 14 years. She would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor and fertilizer costs during maize production: they need fertilizers to increase production.
 
With the profits from her farming she wants to invest in her business so that, in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is separated with 1 child. 
Rodrigo is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.
Rodrigo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Rodrigo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for his transport service

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is 37 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and two children, which are his priority in life. Eugenio has fertile land on which he plants rice. Eugenio is an experienced farmer and has been in rice production for 10 years. According to him, he needs to provide maintenance to his crops so that he can produce more sacks of rice and can sell to traders.

He is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy inputs for growing rice, such as fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Eugenio hopes to earn money for the college education of his children.

loans.use: to buy inputs for growing rice, such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 42 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school.

Carmelita buys and sells native products such as baskets in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional native products for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy baskets and other native products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 30-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school.   She has operated a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for four years.

Lucy is requesting this loan through Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil.  If she is able to realize any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to use it to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more kale seeds.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott is 22 years old now, and his business is doing well, and his monthly income has gone up to 6,500 Kenyan shillings.

He has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his curio shop. 

In the future he wants to be able to expand his curio shop into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy handcrafts for sale

loans.name: Yeredon 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  YEREDON 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  N’TENKONIBOUGOU un des villages de Dogo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  SITAN, 1ère personne assise de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  N’TENKONIBOUGOU après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  120.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Uzma Kousar

texts.en:
Uzma is a 34year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children, one attend the high school. Her husband is responsible to fulfil the needs of the entire family. But Uzma has been running embroidery business 2 years ago to meet the other expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relation her business has increased. She is a brave woman.
Uzma buys materials such as Hand- Embroidery kit,   Ribbon, Needles and Embroidery Machine from market. Another person handles her transactions with her customer .she has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. So, Uzma demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance, to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand. 

Therefore, Uzma humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.
Uzma and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender’s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.
.

loans.use: To buy embroidery raw material for herself

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is 29, single, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
Having borrowed a loan of $300 and built a store. 
The second loan amount of $600 he spent to buy food stuffs: flour, sugar, tea, granulated sugar.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 o expand he area of his business.

loans.use: To expand he area of his business

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Ms. Minerva A. and her husband, Mr. Armando Tovar, have been running their business for 5 years. “We are located outside a very large market, and I would like to invest in more shoes since I lack many models and styles. I also need to buy a covering for the shoes to protect them from sun and rain.” I am asking for $1,000.00 to purchase footwear and protective coverings.
Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Minerva A. y su esposo el Sr. Armando Tovar tiene 5 años con su negocio “El lugar en donde estamos ubicados es afuera de un mercado muy grande me gustaría invertir en la compra de más calzado ya que me faltan muchos modelos y estilos diferentes, también necesito comprar una lona para cubrir el calzado del sol y de la lluvia”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la compra de calzado y unas lonas para protección.

loans.use:
To purchase more footwear and protective coverings.

Comprar más Calzado y lonas de Protección.

loans.name: Fiodémégbé

texts.fr:
Mrs Agniglio Fiodemege, mother of four,was born in 1962 at Mawussigan. She earns a living by making and selling strings. Her husband, a cultivator, helps balance the budget but Mrs ANIGLIO is the main provider for the children’s expenses.

She goes into the bush everyday to collect the leaves needed for making strings. At night she weaves the strings she will sell in a local market, to the rhythm of songs. She asks for a $750 loan, to buy the leaves and product a bigger quantity of strings to sell in the markets. Thus, she can earn more and improve her miserable living condition

translated from French by Monique Guchard, Kiva volunteer

Née à Mawussigan en 1962, Madame A. Fiodémégbé est mère de quatre enfants. La fabrication et la vente de cordes est l’activité qui lui procure de revenus. Son époux, cultivateur participe aux dépenses du ménage mais, Madame A. reste le parent le plus proche des enfants en matière de dépenses. Chaque jour, elle va dans la brousse, à la recherche des feuilles qui rentrent dans la production des cordes. Le soir, au rythme des chansons, elle se met à tisser ses cordes qu’elle vend dans les marchés locaux.

Réputée pour la bonne qualité de ses produits, Madame A. Fiodémégbé sollicite ce crédit de $750 pour acheter les feuilles afin d’en produire en grande quantité et de les écouler sur les marchés. Par ce moyen, elle réussira à dégager plus de revenus et changer sa situation de vie miséreuse.

loans.use:
achat du matériel pour la production en  grande quantité  des cordes
Buying material for the big quantity production of strings

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old has a mini-market in Kirkuk. He is applying to get $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop. He has two children, both of them in school. He wants to increase his income and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 27 years old, married and has one small child. She operates a small, eight-room hotel with her husband. She keeps it clean, but the building is old and worn. The rooms are large but quite sparse with merely a bed and one chair. In addition, she runs a small secretarial service. She has a computer and printer. She and her husband have been in business for the past seven years and has received two previous loans.

This is a very industrious woman with lots of ideas for improving her hotel. She dreams of converting the garage into a small dining room where she can serve breakfast to her guests. She and her husband had a small bakery in the past, but the worker absconded with the funds and almost left them destitute, so they decided to focus on the hotel and secretarial service.

With her loan, she plans to buy 15 pairs of bed sheets for the hotel. Step by step, she will continue to improve her hotel and the lives of her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional 15 pairs of bedsheets for her hotel

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman M. is a very creative person. As a professional tailor, he created a tailoring school for girls who drop out of school and war-abused girls. Abdulrahman started with one sewing machine and later acquired three more. After several loans from SMT, he obtained four more machines, making eight total. Contracted by local NGOs to train war-affected youth, Joseph now has 55 trainees learning in two shifts for a year. The experienced trainees also sew clothes for selling and generate income for the school.

Thirty-six-year-old Joseph is planning to provide two years of training to the trainees to enable them to become more professional and also train more youth to be self-employed. He is therefore requesting a $550 loan to buy two ordinary machines, two machines for designing, and sewing materials such as threads, lace, etc.

loans.use: Increase his assets by purchasing additional sewing machines

loans.name: Sawya

texts.en:
Sawya is 36, married, and cares for 2 orphans in addition to her own 8 children. I was in a discussion with the credit officer who helps me translate (there are 52 different languages in Uganda) and told him that in the United States, people have an average of two to three children to a family. He asked, “Why do you not have more?” I discovered that to many people, children are wealth and seen as extra provision for parents because they are expected to look after their parents in old age.

Many people in Uganda have land that was given to them by their king. The thinking there is that as long as you have land that you can give to your children, you should have lots of children. The credit offer's father had 16 children and is considered a wealthy man. The problem of course becomes that the land is continually being divided into smaller and smaller plots. Currently, Uganda has one of the highest birthrates in the world and half of the population is under the age of 15, with no job prospects.

Sawya operates a restaurant where she serves typical Ugandan food of beans, meat, matooke, rice. In rural area, it is all but impossible to find any other type of food. She plans to use her loan to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant. She hopes that she will be able to pay school fees so that her children will be able to finish school and even attend university.

loans.use: Sawya plans to use her loan to buy more cooking material for her restaurant

loans.name: Kinaawa C(Iii) Group

texts.en: Josephine has a charcoal business. She sells charcoal on retai business. She wants to use the extra profits to complete her residential house that is under construction.Betty and Regina sell snacks and want to use the loan to expand the business. Cissy has a bakery business and intends to use the loan to buy more conatiners. Teo sells used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Orlando José

texts.es:
Mr Orlando R. is a humble countryman who has been working, for many years, in agriculture and cattlefarming in Villanueva, Chinandega. He is married, with one child who he supports and also who supports him in this work.

His main priority at the moment is the reconstruction of his humble home because, for many years, it has been in poor condition. But he has begun to reconstruct it in order to improve his family's quality of life. This is why he has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan which he can invest in the purchase of a door and roof installation. His current credit history is two loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El señor Orlando R. es un humilde campesino que por muchos años se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería en el municipio Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es casado y con un hijo que mantener que también le apoya en este trabajo.

Su mayor necesidad actualmente es la reconstrucción de su humilde casa debido a que por muchos años ha estado en malas condiciones pero ha iniciado a reconstruirla para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su humilde familia. Es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel con la necesidad de obtener créditos para invertirlos en la compra de una puerta e implementación del techo. Su record crediticio actualmente es de dos créditos.

loans.use: To invest in the construction of his home

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. He owns a DVD store. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sante Se Riches Group

texts.en:
Paulin lives in Trou du Nord, Haiti with her four children (ages: 10, 12, 14, 16). With this loan, Paulin wants to buy fish to sell from a small wooden stand on the street. Over the past couple of weeks, there has been increased distress in Haiti because of continually increasing food prices. Paulin said that she will use her profits solely to feed herself and her children. Her goals for the future are to continue sending her children to school and to have her own house.

Esperanza would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders that will support these men and women, and we look forward to watching them grow as individuals and as a community. God Bless!

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell on the street and in the local market.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria is married and his husband works as a gas station attendant. They have four children who are 1, 13, 17, and 18 years old. She started her business because her needs were increasing because her children were getting older and she needed to help her husband with their school expenses. Five years ago on her own initiative she started selling mail-order linens and shoes to her friends, aquaintances and to people are her children's school.

She needs a loan of US$600, which she will repay in 6 months, to be able to purchase seasonal shoes and thus to increase her sales. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria es casada su esposo trabaja como despachador en una gasolineria, tienen cuatro hijos de 18,17,13 y 1 año. inició el negocio por la necesidades que se incrementaron a medida que sus hijos crecian y ella necesitaba apoyar a su marido con los gastos de estudio de ellos. Comenzó hace cinco años por iniciativa propia vendiendo blancos y zapatos por catalogo entre sus amistades y familiares, y en la escuela de sus hijos.

Ella requiere un prestamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar zapatos de temporada y asi incrementar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Niso

texts.ru:
Niso A. lives in the region of Vakhsh. She is 41 years old, married, with five children. She has a technical, secondary education. She buys and sells cloth. She has a small shop at the Vakhsh market, and over five years of experience working in the field. This work allows her to support her large family, since at the moment her husband has gone to Russia to earn money there. Niso wants to increase her product line, and she needs funding for that. She has decided to take out a three-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Эшонова Нисо жительница района Вахш. Возраст 41 год,замужем,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое. Занимается куплей продажей ткани.Имеет небольшой магазин на рынке района Вахдат.Опыт работы в бизнесе имеет более 5 лет. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою бошльшую семью.Так как в данное время ее муж уехал на заработки в Россию.Сейчас Нисо хочет увеличить ассортимент товара,на что ей нужны деньги.Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Increase the variety of the product line

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus has sold breakfast meals from a cart for 20 years. She sells in the market near her house from 7:30 in the morning until mid-day. The loan that she's requested has been used to pay household expenses and the costs of the ingredients she needs for the meals she sells.

Jesus would like to be able to improve her cart because it's falling apart.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Jesús vende desayunos en su carreta desde hace 20 años. Ella vende en el mercado que está cerca de su casa desde las 7.30 de la mañana hasta el mediodía. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para cubrir los gastos de la casa y para los ingredientes de los desayunos que ofrece.

A Jesús le gustaría poder mejorar su carreta ya que está deteriorada.

loans.use: Household costs and ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large amount of fruits and vegetables to resell in her community.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar baji is the wife of Z. I. and lives in the historic Yadgar area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 29 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her eldest daughter is married. The next eldest has completed her 14th level in school. Her youngest daughter has completed her 12th level in school.

Naseem Akhtar baji’s husband runs a cosmetics and movie-making business. Basically, he divides his shop into two parts: one part is based on cosmetics sales and the second part is comprised of movie-making equipment, such as cameras and film rolls. Her husband is a well-known person in the community and has run his businesses for the last 35 years. People from within and outside the community call upon him to make movies of various functions, such as birthdays and weddings. In Pakistan, people usually get married between the months of September to December, and this is the busy season for her husband. Therefore, Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy a digital movie camera for her husband so that he will be able to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy a digital movie-making camera for her husband's business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata B., 47 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois TP Tackou Ligueye de depuis 8 ans.
