Elle veut acheter des habits prêt-à-porter pour homme et pour femme de l’huile de palme et du miel et revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aminata B. is 47 years old, married and has 5 children in her charge. She has been a member of the village bank TP Tackou Ligueye for the last 8 years. She wants to purchase men and women's ready-to-wear clothing, palm oil and honey to retail. Her income allows her to participate in the family's expenses.She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of clothing, honey and palm oil

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is 29 years old and married with two children. She owns a centrally-located store in the city of Ayacucho where she sells office supplies and offers photocopying services to individuals and institutions. She rents the space and works alongside her husband.

Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy CDs, DVDs, and tapes. She dreams of building her own home and of expanding her business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.

Juana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, local que es alquilado en donde vende artículos de librería, servicios de fotocopiado, también vende a instituciones, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cds, dvds, cintas. Juana sueña con construir su casa, ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy CDs, DVDs and tapes

loans.name: Edita Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Edita Graciela tiene 60 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal Bellavista II y vive en la calle Los Angeles 861, distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Es autodidacta, sola aprendió a leer y escribir ya que por falta de apoyo no fue nunca a la escuela. Decidió vivir con el compañero de su vida desde la edad de 20 años y ahora tiene un hijo.
Edita tiene un puesto en el mercado de su calle, lugar donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y también comida. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300, cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en arreglar su puesto, le colocó techo.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en comprar panetones para las fiestas navideñas.
Edita sueña con tener una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Ms. Edita Graciela is 60 years old and lives on 861 Los Angeles Street, district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Bellavista II microfinance institute.

She is an autodidact, which means that she learned how to read and write on her own because she did not attend school due to a lack of support. She decided to live with her domestic partner at the age of 20, and they now have a son.

Edita has a stand at the market on her street, where she sells basic need items and food. She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, in fixing up her stand—she added a roof to it. With this 1,200.00 loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase panetones (Peruvian holiday fruitcake) for the Christmas festivities.

Edita dreams of owning a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Peruvian holiday fruitcakes

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by three borrowers, all residents of Kandal Province. The group leader, Mrs. S. K., is 45 years old and a widow. She runs a small restaurant and sells boiled eggs and roasted sausages to neighbors. She can earn average of $3 per day, and has been doing this since 2005. She is responsible for five children, all of whom are single. To help provide more for the family, one daughter is working as a garment worker. K. is applying for a loan to buy furniture to use in the family home. 

The another two borrowers are:
Pheng C. is age 22 and is single. She is a garment worker who is requesting a loan for her sister to use as capital to expand her business.
Bou S. A. is 56 years old and makes a living selling rice and foods. She requests a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family to ride.

loans.use: To buy furniture to use in family home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA F. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Lima Nº 296 del Distrito de Calleria, tiene 60 años de edad, 06 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, su esposo es obrero, es socia de Manuela ramos hace 06 años.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro arroz, azucar, fideos, aceite, leche y golosinas, hizo una pequeña bodeguita en la esquina de su casa de ahí se inicio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro mas abarrotes, entre ellos gaseosas 06 cajas, amplio su local e hizo arreglos interiores, como pintar mas andamios.

Muy ahradecida con Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
ROSA F. S., belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Valiant Women) located in the Calleria District of eastern Peru. She is 60 years of age and has six grown children. Her husband is a laborer. Rosa has been associated with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for six years. The first loan, of 300 New Sols, that she received was used to buy rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk and sweets. She created a small grocery store in the corner of her house; that is how she got started. With this loan of 1000 New Sols she will buy more groceries including six cases of carbonated beverages. She will also expand her shop and make interior improvements, such as painting the shelving. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the trust they have shown her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más abarrotes, entre ellos gaseosas 6 cajas, ampliar su local e hizo arreglos interiores (como pintar más andamios).

loans.name: Josinta

texts.en:
Josinta A. O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya, where she will be trained by K-MET to begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour, a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET, to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Josinta, who lives in the Nyamasaria district of Kisumu, is 36 years old, married, and has four children; she also cares for three orphans. She has a business at the Molem Market selling fresh fish caught in Lake Victoria, upon whose banks the town of Kisumu is situated. She normally buys the fish straight from vendors at the lakeside, but at times will purchase stock from middlemen in town.

Josinta has applied for a loan of $325 from K-MET for both the purchase of additional fish and the upkeep of her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is 50 years old. She is a widow and had ten kids but lost four through ailments. Out of the remaining six, the last-born is still in school. Faustina lives with her children in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number is also involved in trading and other business activities. Faustina is in the business of palm oil production. She has been in business for four years.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community and processes them in her house to produce the oil, then sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Faustina desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Irma Reyna

texts.es:
Desde hace veintidós años, Irma es presidenta del comedor popular de la zona donde vive. Sin embargo, lo que es trabajar ella lo conoce desde que era una niña y vivía en provincia. Cuando su mama vendía ropa ella empezó a vender ropa interior siendo aún muy pequeña. Conforme fue creciendo iba a aprendiendo como hacer negocio.  

Hoy en día además de organizar los almuerzos en el comedor popular también vende ropa importada y productos naturistas. Ambos trabajos los realiza como ambulante e incluso viaja a diversas provincias para vender. El negocio de ropa lo ha tenido desde siempre. Mientras que los productos de medicina natural los vende desde que un familiar suyo le encargo parte de su trabajo como curandero naturista. 

Irma es una señora muy activa, dice que le gusta viajar y vender sus productos movilizándose por diversos lugares; sin embargo es consciente de que en algún momento no podrá transportarse con la misma facilidad de ahora. A sus cincuenta y ocho años y con sus hijos ya mayores e independientes, ella piensa en el futuro terminar de construir su casa y abrir una tienda naturista en su casa.
texts.en:
Irma has been the president of a popular dining hall in her neighborhood for 22 years. She has known what it is to work since she was a girl living in the country. When her mother sold clothing, she began selling underclothes, although she was very young. She grew up learning how to run a business. Currently, in addition to organizing lunches in the dining hall, she also sells imported clothing and natural products. She carries out both jobs as a traveling saleswoman, and travels to various provinces to sell. She has always had the clothing business. She has been selling natural medicines since one of her relatives put her in charge of part of his work as a natural healer. Irma is a very active woman; she says that she enjoys traveling and selling her products in diverse locations. She is aware, however, that at some point she will not be able to get around as easily as she does now. At 58 years of age, with her children grown up and independent, she is planning to finish building her house and open a naturalist store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Mrs. Daisy T. is 48 years old. Her husband Gil is a fisherman. Daisy is a mother of five: four of her children are in school and the youngest is a two-year-old boy. Her husband is tireless in his support of the family through fishing, and Daisy works in tandem with Gil in selling the fish in their neighborhood.

In order to obtain added income, Daisy manages a small food store. She manages her business well: in fact, the income from the store allowed her to acquire more fishing materials.

She would like to utilize her loan to purchase a pumpboat machine for fishing. She wishes to improve their livelihood and hopes that someday all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase a pumpboat machine for fishing.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Marta Milagro

texts.es: Marta Milagro B. D. L. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en San Pedro Masahuat junto a su esposo. Ella posee un comedor llamado “Comedor Karlita”, en el cual venD. frutas, jugos, comida entre otras cosas más. Dicho negocio lo posee desD. hace 36 años  y es muy querida por las personas del lugar, es por esto que cuenta con muchos clientes. Milagro desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar materia prima para los platillos que realiza, esto con el fin D. poder brindar mayor variedad a sus clientes D. manera que ella sea la única a la que prefieran en el lugar. Así también desea aumentar sus ventas, ya que este negocio es la única fuente económica que posee ya que su esposo trabaja junto a ella atendiendo el comedor y ambos sobreviven D. las ganancias D. este.
texts.en:
Marta Milagro B. L. is 53 years old, and lives in San Pedro Masahuat with her husband. She owns a diner called "Karlita Dining", which sells fruit, juices, and food among other things. Marta has had this business for 36 years, which is loved by local people, and that's why she has so many customers. Marta wants to get a loan, which would proviD. the capital necessary to buy raw materials for the dishes she makes. This would allow her to proviD. a greater variety to her customers so that they will prefer to continue eating in her restaurant. She also wants to increase her sales, because this business is her only source of income. Her husband works with her serving guests in the dining room, and both live off of the profits from the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her restaurant

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa B. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 46 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosa has a business providing construction services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used for the same reason. This loan will be her third PMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her construction business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (417970534) is a 57 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, C. owns & operates a business raising ducks for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  C. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND to be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be C.’s 7th loan from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina I. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All are currently in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a trader. Amina is also a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, etc. Amina wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years. Amina aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Member Good Group

texts.en:
Here are Aminata S., Kadiatu M., and Abbie T.. They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Member Good – a Krio phrase meaning 'think good'. This will be the very first loan these women are accessing from SMT/Kiva. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs due to the lack of sufficient capital. They thus applied to SMT for loans of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to develop their businesses.

Aminata S. (middle) is the leader of the group. Aminata was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-five years of age, married to a prison officer, and they have three children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School One (JSS I), the other in class six and the third in class one. Aminata sells clothes for babies and has been in this business for nineteen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Zawad

texts.en:
Zawad started her own clothing business selling clothes two years ago. She works four hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings. She is a 35-year-old woman, married and the mother of one child. Her child is 10 years old. She also cares for two other dependents. Zawad is a member of the Uvumilivu borrower group in Msamvu Morogoro. 

This is Zawad`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zawad hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Kolawole

texts.en: Kolawole is 37 years old and married with four children. She has a shop where she rents video compact discs. She wants to add foodstuffs to sell in her shop. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha estado muy relacionada con las diversas tareas del campo; ahora, junto a su esposo, cultiva las tierras que heredó, en las cual siembra papa, maíz, trigo, habas, entre otros. Cuando llega la época de cosecha, lleva a vender sus productos al principal mercado de su zona o en algunas ocasiones compran sus cosechas por parcelas, es decir por área de terreno cultivado. Aunque en muchas oportunidades el precio del mercado no recompensa el arduo trabajo realizado, esa es la forma de vida que le permite estar en familia y es por esa razón continua con las tareas agrícolas. 
Esta es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal y es una de las integrantes más activas de su grupo. El dinero solicitado será invertirlo en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Lucila is 29 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. Since childhood, she has been closely linked to the various tasks involved in farming. Together with her husband, Lucila cultivates the land she inherited by planting potatoes, corn, wheat, beans, and other crops. When it comes time to harvest, she sells her products at the main market in her area. Sometimes her customers will buy her crops by the parcel based on a determined unit of cultivated land. Many times the prices she gets at market does not reward her hard work, but that is part of the agricultural lifestyle her family accepts and gives her a reason to continue working.

This is Lucila’s fifth loan with MFP. She is thrilled to be part of her Communal Bank and one of the most active members of the group. The money she requested will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en: Suzy D. sells ladies clothes, cosmetics  and so on at castle.  Suzy has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Suzy has been selling clothes, ladies under wear for quite some time now. She supports the husband in the payment of school fees and settlement of utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothes, cosmetics and ladies under wear for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business, to plough back into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more clothes, cosmetics and ladies under wear for sale

loans.name: Antaiza

texts.en:
Antaiza J. is currently in the business of selling bread, green vegetables and groundnut phaste (spread or paste), and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of pulses (peas, beans, etc.) to sell.  Antaiza is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has four children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bigger shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of pulses (peas, beans, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 49 years-old and married with three children. Her husband is a teacher. She is very happy because her eldest child is already a graduate. She sells drinks, food and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused and hard worker. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries, food and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, food and drinks.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El socio FLORENTINO pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco.

El socio tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos: tres hijos varones y una mujer. El hijo menor estudia en el colegio y los mayores estudian o tiene estudios superiores. El tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación (taller de carpintería) de muebles y los vende a sus clientes.

El es carpintero y fabrica muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. El tiene también un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, el quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado de los muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Florentino is a member of the Mercamueble Communal Bank and lives in the imperial city of Cusco. He is 61 years old, married, and has 4 children (3 sons and 1 daughter). His youngest child is in high school, while the older ones are either studying or already have their degrees. He has a small carpentry shop where he sells furniture to his customers.

Florentino makes desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, beds, etc. He also has a furniture vending post at the Mercamuebles Market, located at the main bus stop in San Sebastián District of the Province of Cusco. Florentino has been in business for a number of years and has done very well due to his hard work and determination.

He is requesting a loan to increase his business capital for manufacturing and selling furniture. The materials he needs to buy include wood, paint thinner, lacquer, sandpaper, carpenter’s glue, and other items. Florentino is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, cuenta con estudios secundarios  y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos recientemente, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener más capital y mas préstamos para mejorar su negocio.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lidia, 29, is a member of the "Manuelas de Hoy II" communal bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a single mother of one son. She finished secondary school and she is a small farm animal merchant. She associated with the Manuela Ramos Movement recently and her first, 500 new sol, loan from her communal bank was used to buy animals. Her wish for the future is to have more capital and more loans to improve her business. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is 40 years old. He is married and has 4 children. His eldest child is 10 years old. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells clothes to also support the home. He has a computer centre where he provides computer services to his customers. His customers are mostly residents and friends. He is a LAPO client. (LAPO) Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more stationery. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery.

loans.name: Success

texts.en:
Success is 35 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband works at an oil firm in Benin City, Edo State.

Success owns a pharmacy where she sells medicines to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Success is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Laweng

texts.en:
Laweng  is in the business of brewing and selling of local alcohol beverages and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials for distillation .  Laweng is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more brewing materials for distillation

loans.name: Talosia

texts.en:
Talosia S. is 48 and married with 5 children (ages 6 - 15).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Talosia has 4 years of experience in this business.  Talosia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Talosia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Talosia S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 32-year-old father of two school-going children. He owns a mechanical and electrical garage where he provides clients with mechanical, electrical, panel beating and re-spraying services. He has been running this business for 11 years and says that the environment of his business is good and friendly. He has requested a second loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy electrical tools and a compressor. He says that Faulu Kenya has enabled him to be a good businessman, since he can afford most of the things required by his customers. He describes himself as dedicated and serious.

loans.use: To buy electrical tools & a compressor

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
El señor Danny vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es el servicio de Internet, venta de tarjetas de celular y venta de celulares.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar accesorios de computadora etc., de esta manera mantener estable su negocio y ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2009 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Danny lives in his mother's house in the Munaypata neighborhood of La Paz. He has an Internet cafe and sells cell phone calling cards and cell phones. He will use the loan to increase his capital buying computer accessories, etc. in order to keep his business stable and offer more products to his customers. He has been an Impro client since 2009 and has a very good credit history; therefore, he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer accessories for his Internet Cafe and other items to sell.

loans.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Suerte esta conformados por tres mujeres que se han especializado en estilismo y estética en sus diferentes rubros.  Empezando por la coordinadora Sonia Claribel Basto quien vende cosméticos por catalogo. Ella inicio con el negocio cuando una promotora de la Avon le explico cómo funcionaba el negocio y la incentivo. 
Mientras Meyvi María Rugama Sevilla inicio con la comercialización de cosméticos del mercado pero al pasar del tiempo y por la demanda de sus clientes a  los productos  Avon decide afiliarse a esta marca. Además de vender joyería de oro y plata.

Por otra parte Lissette del Socorro Navarro quien estudio estilismo y belleza empezó trabajando en un salón donde realizaba manicure, pedicura, tintes, alisados y peinados de todo tipo lo que le permitió hacer clientela  e ir comprando su utilería  para luego instalar su propio salón de belleza.  Esto fue posible en el 2005 y desde entonces ha ido invirtiendo en el negocio.

Ellas invertirán en productos de belleza desde labiales, delineadores, rubor, pintura de uñas, cremas, productos de limpieza facial etc.
texts.en:
The “La Suerte” (Luck) group is made up of three women who are in various aspects of the beauty industry. First is the group coordinator, Sonia Claribel Basto, who sells catalogue cosmetics. She started out when an Avon representative explained to her how the business worked and motivated her. Meyvi María Rugama Sevilla started out selling cosmetics but, as time went by and her customers insisted on asking for Avon products, she decided to affiliate herself to that brand. She also sells gold and silver jewelry. Finally, Lissette del Socorro Navarro, who studied cosmetology, started out working in a beauty salon doing manicures, pedicures, hair coloring and straightening, and all styles of haircuts. This led to a regular customer base and made it possible for her to gradually purchase work tools and eventually set up her own salon in 2005. Since then, she has invested in this business. They will invest the funds in beauty products like: lipstick, eye shadow, blush, nail polish, creams, skin cleansing products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon products.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes tiene la edad de 29 años, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación.  María tiene 3 hijos todos están a su cargo. Tiene la actividad económica de la venta de ropa y calzado. Dio inicio a este negocio de una manera muy humilde, ya que tenía muy poco capital para comprar todos los productos que sus clientes le habían solicitado. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esto la conlleva a solicitar este financiamiento para la compra de atería prima. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 29 years old. She has spent a lot of time working with Fundación. María cares for three children.

Her business is the sale of clothing and footwear. She began the business very simply because she had very little capital to purchase all the products that her customers wanted from her. She has been involved in the business more than 11 years. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase inventory. Her wish is to maintain the value of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
When Ana moved to the United States from El Salvador with her husband fifteen years ago, she found herself naturally falling into jobs that involved taking care of children. While working as an assistant at other daycare centers, “I was given more and more responsibility for the children we cared for,” she says. “Eventually, I knew it was time to open a daycare of my own.” 

Ana enrolled in classes through a program for childcare providers run by Santa Clara County and learned the ins and outs of managing a childcare facility. The same program now helps her by referring new clients, and her in-home daycare is fully enrolled with children from eighteen months to eleven years old. 

She is very proud of Cecy’s Day Care, which she runs with her husband. “I feel good doing my job,” she says. “My work helps others to be able to go to their work. I find it very gratifying, especially when I receive cards from parents to say ‘Thank You’ or for the holidays.”

Ana wanted to make improvements to her daycare, but, as an immigrant, she has not built up the credit history necessary to qualify for a small business loan from a bank.  A $10,000 loan from Opportunity Fund will allow her to purchase a computer and educational software for the children, improve the safety of her outdoor play area, and invest in new recreational equipment. These improvements will help her to attract new clients. Eventually, she and her husband hope to be able to move the daycare to a larger space outside of their home.

loans.use: Purchase computer and educational software; improve safety of outdoor play area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs his store

loans.name: Akou Delali

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la restauration, sa spécialité est la cuisine togolaise, elle est très réputée dans son entourage car elle fait de la bonne cuisine. Son stock de produits nécessaires à l’activité de la restauration est épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 5 sacs de haricot et un sac de piment.
Elle est  mariée et mère de 4 enfants, avec son revenu elle contribue aux charges financières du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady’s activity is preparing food, and she specialises in Togolese cuisine. She has developed a solid reputation in the area because of the quality of her cooking. As the stock of supplies she needs to prepare food is now depleted, she is requesting her first credit loan from WAGES to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 containers of vegetable oil, 5 bags of beans and one bag of chilli peppers. She is married and the mother of four children, and uses her income to help cover household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products necessary to prepare food

loans.name: Segundo Anastacio

texts.es:
Don Segundo es casado con 2 hijos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en la ciudad de San Ignacio, en el centro de la ciudad cuenta con un copetín y hamburguesería donde todos los días trabaja con su señora y sus hijos.
El solicita un  crédito para adquirir más mercaderías como carne, panificados, mayonesas, condimentos, y otros con el fin ampliar la disponibilidad de comidas rápidas en su local.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por el trabajo que está realizando ya que mediante ingreso él puede mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is married with 2 children, and lives with them and his wife in the city of San Ignacio. He has a fast food stand in the center of the city where he works every day with his wife and children. He is requesting a loan to buy more supplies like meat, bread, mayonnaise, condiments, and others in order to expand the availability of fast food at his stand. The client expresses his satisfaction with his work since it maintains his family.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, condiments, mayonnaise, bread and others

loans.name: Silieni

texts.en:
Silieni J. is 36 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Silieni has 1 year of experience in this business.  Silieni needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Silieni joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Silieni's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Zozan

texts.en:
Zozan is a 39-year-old mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband, Nafez, works in the vegetable market in Jenin, a city in Palestine. One of Zozan's sons is a National Palestinian Authority employee who has a very low salary because he is a college student. The rest of her children are school students.

Zozan's dream is to help her son continue his education, and earn a B.A. degree so he can get a better job and help the family live a better life. Zozan came to FATEN and took a $2,000 loan to pay for her son's college tuition.

Zozan's husband, Nafez, appears in the picture here in FATEN's office, because Zozan is a conservative woman who doesn't like having her picture published.

loans.use: Pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Kuvvanjbek

texts.en:
Selling construction supplies at the market has become the only source of income for Kuvvanjbek, a 23-year-old man who's been doing this for three years. This young man has many projects for his future, and to build his own house and family is one of them. He's good at what he does, and this is why he's been able to support himself and his whole family through his business. 

His wish is to add more goods and in that way increase the range of materials and supplies to offer to his clients. Kuvvanjbek would pay back this loan and with the money earned he would be able to pay for his technical career education.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing pipe, angle bar, and other construction materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming for the last five years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her main products are tea, bananas, vegetables, tomatoes and maize which she sells in the local market. Grace is 23 years-old. She is married and has two children aged one and four. One of the children attends school.

She has requested this loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will assist her in improving the living standards of her family.

Her primary challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions, pests and diseases and the lack of an available market for her farm produce. She hope that, in five years time, she will have acquired five dairy cows and expanded her farm by buying another piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mario Pedro

texts.es: El Señor ingreso a la institución el año 2004 con el grupo solidario Raza de Bronce, trabajando 12 secuencias y actualmente se independiza con el crédito individual con la garantía del mismo grupo anterior. El señor es una persona responsable con sus pagos, con el dinero del crédito  desea implementar su taller de lavados de autos maquinaria. Don Mario esta casado con la señora rosa tiene tres hijos a los cuales hace estudiar con mucho esfuerzo con la actividad que tiene de chofer asalariado, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona villa victoria. Tiene muchos deseos de superación para su persona, mas para  sus hijos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario is married to Rosa and he has three children who he keeps in school through much effort as a salaried driver. He joined the institution in 2004 as a member of the “Raza de Bronce” (Race of Bronze) communal bank participaing in 12 cycles. Currently he is going out on his own with an individual loan but backed by the same previous group. He is a responsible person with respect to repayments. He will use the requested funds to set up a car wash. His home is in the Villa Victoria neighborhood. He has a strong wish for self improvement and even more so for his children. He is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a car wash.

loans.name: Flor Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Flor de Bosque se encuentra conformado por Johana de los Ángeles T. Guzmán, Daysy del Rosario González Rodríguez, Isaura del Carmen C. B. y Pedro Rolando Gaitán Guzmán. Johana como medio de subsistencia se dedica a la fabricación y venta de comidas en especial fritangas los días viernes, sábados y domingos; esto desde hace 4 años.

Daysy, vende frutas en el mercado Oriental del departamento de Managua, vende todo tipo de frutas pero en su mayoría la de la temporada ya sean estas naranjas, melones, piñas, pitahayas, entre otras. Isaura tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación la cual es pequeña pero consigue de ahí para el pan de cada día; así mismo Pedro tiene también una pequeña pulpería la cual a pesar de ser pequeña es el principal sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the "Flor de Bosque" ["Flower of the Forest"] solidarity group are Johana de los Ángeles T. Guzmán, Daysy del Rosario González Rodríguez, Isaura del Carmen C. B. y Pedro Rolando Gaitán Guzmán. To earn a livelihood, Johana makes and sells foods, especially fried foods, on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. She has been doing this for four years. Daysy sells fruits in the West market of the department of Managua. She sells all types of fruits, but in this season, she sells mostly oranges, melons, pineapples, dragon fruit, and others. Isaura has a pulpería [small grocery store] in her house. It is small but this is how she brings home the bread each day. Likewise, Pedro also has a small pulpería which, despite being small, is the principal livelihood of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock basic grains, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba S. uses her mill to blend vegetables, such as tomatoes, cereals and others at Abura. Araba is a widow and has no educational background. She is responsible for paying her rent and utility bills. Her loan will help her to acquire another machine that will help her to meet the needs of her customers. The increased income which she hopes to get will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: acquire another mill

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora E. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora plants rice to sell. Leonora has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10500 PHP from PMPC. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10500 PHP, which will be used for rice production. This will be the twelfth loan taken out by Leonora from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For rice production

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma R. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Thelma is married and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Thelma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Thelma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for vegetable farm

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
El Sr. Derlis tiene 36 años, casada con la Sra. Myrian  Ojeda de 31 años, tienen tres hijos de edad escolar, viven en la ciudad de Caacupé barrio San Blas.

Donde posee su taller de producción de zapato, una vez terminada de producir él mismo lo lleva a la ventas en la zonas de Concepción, Pilar y Pedro Juan , en donde tiene sus clientela formada. 

El Sr. Derlis trabaja muy bien no obstante necesita de mas capital para la compra de cuero para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, es por ello que solicita un crédito a la Fundación y Kiva y a la vez agradece el apoyo obtenido.
texts.en:
Derlis is 36 years old.  He is married to Myrian Ojeda who is 31 years old.  They have three school-age children and live in San Blas neighborhood, in the town of Caacupé.

Derlis has a shoemaker's workshop.  Once he has made his products, he takes them to sell in Concepción, Pilar and Pedro Juan districts where he has an established customer base.

Derlis' work is going very well but he still needs more capital to buy leather so that he can fill his customers' orders.  This is why he is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  He is grateful for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: To buy leather which is the main raw material for his shoemaking business

loans.name: Ls Divinas Group

texts.es:
LAS DIVINAS

Salustiana tiene 39 años de edad es Presidenta de La alcancía comunal “LAS DIVINAS” que recién comienza a formar parte de Edaprospo-Prosperidad la cual esta compuesta por 7 integrantes, quienes acordaron colocar este nombre al grupo por que son mujeres y quieren destacar esa cualidad.
La señora Salustiana tiene 4 hijos 2 son independientes y 2 son dependientes la señora junto a su pareja comparten gastos del hogar, Salustiana para poder ayudar a sustentar los gastos del hogar trabaja vendiendo golosinas frente a un colegio inicial y por las mañana prepara y vende tamales. Salustiana quisiera tener un capital de trabajo para poder instalar una bodega en su casa y de esa manera seguir adelante con un negocio nuevo.
texts.en:
LAS DIVINAS

Salustiana is 39 and is the president of the "Las DIvinas” community group, which recently became part of Edaprospo-Prosperidad.  "Las divinas" has  seven members. They chose this name because they are women and want to emphasize that fact.   Salustiana has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and her husband.  To pay the household expenses, she sells food in front of a local school, and in the mornings she makes and sells tamales.  Salustiana is seeking capital so that she can install a bodega in her house, and with this new business, get ahead in the world.

loans.use: To build a bodega in her house.

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en: Byambajav S. is 55 years old and a single mother who lives with her four children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her oldest daughter helps her with the business, two others attend university and her other daughter works in the local theater. Byambajav operates a timber, wood items, and wooden frame trading business. She started her business in 2006 after previously operating a meat business at the local trade center. After many years owing a business, she has gained much experience as a businesswoman and has built a stable and successful operation. For the future, Byambajav hopes to expand her business by establishing a new sales chanel with Germany. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy two ornamented ger frames for her wooden item trading business.

loans.use: To buy ornamented wooden ger (tent housing) frames

loans.name: Geoffrey Kuria

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been repairing bicycles in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 38 years old and is married to Martha Wairimu.  They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 30,000 in full and in good time.  He plans to buy more bicycle spare parts with this second loan.

In the future, Geoffrey hopes to open a spare parts shop to run side-by-side with his repair shop.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s construction supply slaes business. With the loan, he will buy cement, bricks and sand, etc. and improves the sales of his business.  

Khursheed is a widow. She lives with her 2 sons in a 3-room brick house in a city called Pakpattan, located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry.  She has had a very difficult life since the death of her husband and in raising her children alone. Now both of her sons have become young men and are doing their businesses. Khursheed spends most of her time at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. 

She is very hopeful about the positive growth of her son’s business.  She wants to marry him off and hopes that an increased income will help her save some money for this purpose. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supply sales business

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea A. is from the village of Lagag. She is 60 years old and married. To make a living, Irenea sells rice, corn and other vegetables that she plants. She also raises pigs.

In 2008, Irenea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional pigs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Irenea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Bano's Group

texts.en:
Bano lives in Faisalabad, Pakistan, which is famous for its textiles industry. She owns a two-room house there and has been living in it with her family for the past two years.
 
She is a 27-year-old business lady, selling cosmetics from her home. Her clients are mostly from her community. They give her orders for cosmetics, which enables her to earn well for her family.  

Besides her business, she also manages her household responsibilities very well and gives the required time to her family. She is married to M., who is a janitor with a meager income. Bano lives in a combined family with her brother-in-law, who has a construction supplies business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her cosmetics business. With the loan, she will buy cosmetics in a larger quantity, which will help her to fulfill orders on time and to increase her sales.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that she will be able to achieve a better financial position in her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for selling

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lila, tiene 5 hijos, es conviviente  y  trabaja con Edaprospo por primera vez, Lila  es integrante  del grupo “El Esfuerzo es Grande”, grupo conformado por 8 amigas que le pusieron este nombre porque el esfuerzo para poner un negocio es grande. Lila  trabaja vendiendo comida almuerzos, marcianos desde hace 3  años, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha  logrado darles a sus hijos educación, ha construido su casa  y a su vez le ha brindado una mejor calidad de vida a  su familia. Con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar un carrito sanguchero  y así vender sanguches, salchipapas. Sabemos que Lila  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en:
Sra. Lila is in a common law marriage and has five children. This is her first time to work with EDAPROSPO. Lila is a member of the group “El Esfuerzo es Grande” (The Effort is Great), which consists of eight friends who chose this name because starting a business requires a great deal of effort.

Lila has been selling lunches and frozen fruit treats for three years. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has been able to provide her children with an education, build her house, and give her family a better quality of life. In order to continue growing, Lila is requesting a loan to buy a food cart for selling sandwiches and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). She is confident of accomplishing her goals through much work and effort, and with the help of the loans from EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: To purchase a food cart.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a thirty five year old married man. He has three children and the family is living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For four years he has been operating a retail shop and with the income earned, he has been able to provide for the family. He has the challenge of limited funds to meet consumer demands. His dream is to become a wholesale trader. Robert needs the loan facilities to buy bread, sugar and rice to resell.

loans.use: to purchase bread, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis M. es originario de Telica municipio de León donde labora arduamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Es padre de dos hijos a los que debe apoyar con los estudios para que ellos se desarrollen. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo directamente en el pago de los estudios universitarios de estos dos hijos debido a que lo requiere a lo inmediato. Espera confiadamente en que será beneficiado con dicho crédito y así invertirá para el bienestar de sus hijos ya que como todo padre, su único sueño es que muy pronto sus hijos puedan ser grandes profesionales y tengan mucho éxito en la vida.
texts.en: Mr. Luis M. is from Telica, in the region of Leon, where he works hard to support his home. He is the father of two children, whom he supports in their studies so that they can develop as adults. The loan that he is asking for will be invested directly to pay the university fees for his children, which are due immediately. He confidently hopes that the credit will benefit his family and will result in the well-being of his children since as a father, his only dream is that his children will soon be professionals and have much success in life.

loans.use: to finance his children's education.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: Avelina tiene 52 años de edad y es originaria de la población de Zitacuaro ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido  por que muy cerca de ese lugar esta el santuario de la mariposa monarca. Doña Avi como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos se dedica a la venta de joyería fina (Oro blanco y amarillo)  y esta pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra de aretes, cadenas, esclavas, anillos. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 7 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus joyas para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y también porque se quería sentirse útil. Ella surte en la ciudad de Guadalajara. La meta que tiene la señora Avelina es invertir en un local de comida para llevar ya que cerca de su casa esta un hospital y le iría muy bien en ese negocio. Doña Avelina esta casada con el señor Arturo el cual es taxista y tuvieron 2 hijos que ya están casados. Ella está contenta porque Fundación Realidad le hará el préstamo y porque se le hace poco lo que pagara de intereses en comparación de otras financieras con las cuales ella ha trabajado y no le gusto, está agradecida por la confianza que depositaron en ella.
texts.en:
Avelina is 52 years old and from the town of Zitacuaro which is located in the State of Michoacán.  It is well known because it is very close to the Monarch Butterfly sanctuary.

Avi, as she is known to her friends and neighbors, sells jewelry (yellow gold and white gold).  She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in buying earrings, chains, bangles and rings.  She has been working in her business for approximately seven years.  She tells us that she started selling jewelry to help her husband with their household expenses and also because she wanted to feel useful.  She goes out in the city of Guadalajara.

Avelina's goal is to invest in premises for a food business since there is a hospital near her home and such a business would do very well.  Avelina is married to Arturo who is a taxi driver.  They have two children who are now married.  Avelina is happy that Fundación Realidad will give her this loan and that she won't have to pay much interest compared to what she paid with other loan companies that she worked with and didn't like.  She is grateful for the trust that has been placed in her.

loans.use: to buy yellow gold and white gold jewelry

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius N. is 29 years old, married, and has two children.  He has been in both the dairy business and crop farming in Gitaru village in Kikuyu for one year .  His monthly profit is 18,700 KES. He has a good credit history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his fourth loan of 80,000 KES, which he will use to buy a dairy cow. The anticipated income will be used in his business.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business and operate his own dairy company.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a 44-year-old, married woman with 4 children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. Specifically, for 15 years, she has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She generates additional income as a retailer of rice.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, such as sugar and other groceries. Notably, Amy has borrowed and successfully repaid 5 prior loans from NWTF. Amy aspires to expand her business to improve her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional items.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old and married to Ann. They have four school-going children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 16 years.
  
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labor as he will employ one person to help him with preparing and planting.

In the future, David hopes to increase the size of his farm and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es:
Ania es una joven, que se ha proyectado en las ventas, desde hace tres años logro poner una pulpería, con dinero de su trabajo, y ahorros que su esposo dio. En donde ha venido surtiendo con productos nuevos, gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado. Logrando aumentar las ventas.
Está contenta ya que pronto nacerá su hijo, y es un gozo. Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, bidón de aceite, gaseosas, cosméticos, productos de limpiezas, golosinas entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes. Logrando tener mejores ganancias ya que tendrá que gastar mucho con la venida de su bebe.
texts.en: Ania is a young woman who works in retail sales. Three years ago she managed to set up a general store with money earned from her job and savings given to her by her husband. She has used her Afodenic loans to stock her shop with new products. She has succeeded in increasing her sales. She is happy as her baby is due soon and it will be a great pleasure for her. She will invest this new loan in buying basic grains, such as rice, sugar, beans, tins of cooking oil, sodas, cosmetics, cleaning products, sweets and other products required by her customers. Consequently she hopes to make a greater profit as she will have to spend a great deal of money once her baby arrives.

loans.use: Will buy basic grains, sweets, fizzy drinks and cosmetics to help increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing like: skirts, blouses, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a resident and farmer in the Kisii area of South Rift Kenya. She is aged 54 and has been in farming for the last 30 years, employing four farmhands on a casual basis and producing a variety of products but mainly onions, vegetables, potatoes, millet and milk. She is married with seven adult children, though the last two are still taking their post secondary education. 

Loice has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the income generated will be used to put the last two children through their education. She also adds that the milk will improve their nutritional consumption. She says she wants to expand her farming, especially by raising pedigree cows and growing high value crops  

Loice sees limitations in finances and a poor transportation system as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elizabeth del Carmen es una señora de 47años de edad, quien es vecina de una comunidad llamada San Francisco de la Palmera, localizada en San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que a través de las actividades agrícolas es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros.
 Elizabeth desea continuar con sus estudios  de enfermería pero necesita algún tipo de ayuda ya que no tiene suficiente ayuda económica para seguir.
Actualmente Elizabeth está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢594,000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro  mil colones) para continuar con su carrera universitaria, ya que la inicio hace tres anos.
Con esta inversión espera poder surgir en sus metas personales y crecer mucho más como profesional. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. 
Elizabeth es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth del Carmen is a 47-year-old woman who lives in a community called San Francisco de la Palmera located in San Carlos, Alajuela Province.  This is a rural community with much potential for development because through agricultural activities it’s managed to develop associated activities and services in the community like raising livestock and opportunities for small business and micro businesses, among others.

Elizabeth would like to continue her nursing courses but needs some type of help because she does not have enough economic resources to continue.  She is asking for a micro loan of ¢594,000 (five-hundred ninety-four thousand colones) to continue her university studies that she started three years ago.

She hopes that with this investment she’ll be able to continue toward her personal goals and to grow much more professionally.  All of this will help her improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Elizabeth is a member of the San Francisco de la Palmera communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be her fourth loan and she hopes with it to continue to grow both personally and economically as well as actively participate in a credit institution in her community.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima, vive en una localidad lejana en donde las personas se dedican a sembrar milpas, frijol, chayotes  y es un lugar muy bonito donde hay árboles muy grandes.

    Ella se dedica  a la compra  de de pavos  chicos engordarlo para después venderlo en la misma localidad y en ello lleva trabajando hace cinco años y once meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso para su hogar.

     o que lo motivo a dedicarse  a esta actividad fue su esposo quien lo insistió  que juntos trabajen para mejorar su calidad de vida  y así poder salir adelante.

     Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo solicitado y su actividad pueda ahorrar para comprar algunas cosas que le hace falta en su hogar.
texts.en:
Máxima lives in a remote area where people work planting corn fields, beans, and chayote.  It is a beautiful place where there are very big trees.  

She works purchasing young turkeys to fatten and later sell in the same place.  She has done this work for five years and eleven months, and says that it is going very well since she has had a better income for her home.

She was motivated to start this work by her husband, who insisted that they work together to improve their quality of life so that they could get ahead.  

She hopes that with the loan requested and her business, she can save to purchase a few things that she needs for her home.

loans.use: to purchase feed to raise turkeys.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
María de 54 años vive en la isla trinitaria zona periurbana de la ciudad en una casa de caña, su pequeño negocio le ha ayudado a satisfacer su necesidades como no es casada ha tenido que subsistir sin la ayuda de nadie. Se ha esforzado mucho y está realizado un crédito para comprar bloques y empezar a hacer su casa de cemento, además comprar mercadería como cosméticos, perfumes, bisutería etc.
Siempre ha tenido el sueño de terminar su casa  y asegurarla ya que la delincuencia son factores que no se detienen, espera vivir mejor y ser directora de la línea de productos de la  que es miembro así tendrá más beneficios y descuentos.
texts.en:
María, aged 54, lives in the Isla Trinitaria periurban area of the city in a house made from cane.  Her small business has helped her meet her needs, and as she is not married, she has had to survive without help from anyone.   She has worked hard and is taking a loan to buy blocks to start making a concrete house.  She will also buy merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, jewelry, etc.

She has always had the dream of completing her home and making it secure, as crime is something that does not go away.  She hopes to live a better life, and to be director of a line of products for a company of which she is a member, so she can get more benefits and discounts.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume and jewelry.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la carpintería, este oficio lo inicio cuando trabajó en un carpintería, actualmente trabaja en lo propio y no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar.
Él está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para comprarse madera, pegamento, barniz, para la  elaboración de muebles, esta compra le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para ejecutar su trabajo y mejorar los productos a los clientes.
El objetivo de Luis es poco a poco tener un negocio amplio, tener la oportunidad de ser distribuidor, y apoyar a sus hijos y esposa en todo lo necesario, velando por su bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his family (his wife and two children).  He is a carpenter and started out in this trade when he used to work in a carpenter's workshop.  He currently works in his own workshop and doesn't work fixed hours.  He is requesting a new loan in order to buy wood, adhesive and varnish for making furniture.  This purchase will help him to have available everything he needs in order to carry out his work and improve the products he makes for his customers.

Luis' goals are to gradually expand his business, to become a wholesaler, to support his wife and children and to ensure their well-being.

loans.use: to buy wood, adhesive and varnish for his workshop

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 39 años es casado y tiene 3 hijas, vive con su familia en Pimampiro que está a 45 minutos de Ibarra. Luis se describe como una persona trabajadora que le gusta la agricultura.

Trabaja con su esposa y un trabajador en la siembra de fréjol, tomátes y legumbres es el cuarto crédito que le solicita a FODEMI el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de semillas de fréjol lo cual aumentará su productividad y mejorarán sus ingresos que es ,o mejor para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder construir su casita y dar el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
39-year old Luis is married and has three daughters. He and his family live in Pimampiro which is 45 minutes from Ibarra. Luis describes himself as a hardworking person who enjoys working on his farm.

Along with his wife and a worker, he grows beans, tomatoes, and vegetables. This is his fourth loan with FODEMI which he will use to buy bean seeds for planting. His fields will produce more and he will increase his income so he and his family can have a better quality of life.

His dream is build a house of his own and provide an education for his daughters.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 39-year-old woman who is married and has four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker with decent salary. 

Abeer wants to finish paying the university fees for two of her sons. She has money, but not enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN to add to what she has and pay. 

When Abeer gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay the university fees for her two sons. This will enable her sons to  complete their university degrees and improve their living standards and live with the family in better life conditions. Abeer is photographed in the picture in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for two of her sons.

loans.name: Rupi

texts.en:
Rupi owns and operates a business venture selling food products in the local community. She is 40 years of age and married with four children. Rupi has four years of experience in this business. 

Rupi needs a loan of 2700 tala to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks, candies, tinned food and freezer [foods]. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Rupi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Rupi's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks, candies, tinned food and freezers (mutton flaps, sausages and pork)

loans.name: Ranel

texts.en: Ranel is 31 years old. He is married and has 2 children.  Ranel has a unit of motorela (a motorcycle with a 2-wheeled 4-6 passenger cabin attached to the back) used to load passengers and transport them within the village. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of the motorela and to buy some needed parts for it. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ranel hopes to improve his business.
