loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his motorela.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 63-year-old married man with six children living with an extended family of twelve people in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and build a strong self-reliant family. He has been farming for the last ten years and the challenge faced is seasonal changes. Christopher needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: 3.1.62 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Len operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables for resale.

Len is 57 years old and is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 3.1.62 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 
Len lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Len joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Len has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Len has been involved in this business for 2 years.
The main hardship she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profits, Len hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean,59, is married and lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She has ten children, seven of whom are dependents, working at the rice field and tailor shop. To earn a living and feed her children, she has been farming on her rice field for 40 years. Before the loan, she earns less than 8 US dollars per day to feed her family. 

Now applying for a first loan with VisionFund,Sean will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field and use some of the loan to build a small tailor shop for her daughter. With this loan, she hopes she can earn more income to build on some savings for future needs, especially for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to build a small tailor shop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Maazam

texts.ru: Маазам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Маазам занимается торговлей семечек и и детских игрушек рядом с домом. Этим видом деятельности она занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Maazam lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Maazam sells sunflower seeds and toys from a tray close to her home. She has been working like this for the last four years and wants to take out this loan to expand her business into an actual store at the market.

loans.use: to purchase a market stall at the central market and increasing goods turn over

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is a conservative woman, so her husband Sa'ed is photographed instead. Ola is a 24-year-old woman. She is married with two daughters, and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary in addition to his work in agriculture. Ola has a small grocery store that helps her to share living expenses along with her husband. She wants to improve her store by purchasing more basic groceries to resell, such as rice, sugar, canned foods...etc. So, she wants to take a loan from FATEN to help her purchase these groceries. When Ola gets the loan, she will be able to have a different collection of groceries to resell and increase her income. This will enable Ola to share with her husband to offer better living conditions to the family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Bitty

texts.en:
Bitty is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Bitty has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Bitty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bitty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de variedad de frutas para ofrecer a su clientela. Teodora  es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Teodora has a fruit stand. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of fruits to offer to her customers. Teodora is married and has five children. She lives in her own home in the District of Alto Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Martiale (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 30 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau universitaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Martiale vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Martiale est une secrétaire de formation vend parallèlement a son activité des vêtements et des produits cosmétiques depuis cinq ans ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Martiale s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Martiale ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter  des vêtements et des produits cosmétiques .

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est composé de trois  personnes qui  sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Assiba Aline (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Assiba Aline est mariée à un soudeur du nom de François. Le couple à six enfants, tous  scolarisé et deux  à leur charge. Assiba Aline  vit ensemble avec  son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage  sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Assiba Aline vend de l’igname frite et des beignets depuis une quinzaine d’année. Assiba Aline s’approvisionne dans une région et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Assiba Aline ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicite pour une sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter de l'igname, du haricot et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cheril works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish.  Cheril is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to  buy fishing equipment like fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

Cheril has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment like fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice received 100 dollar grant from Village Enterprise Fund.

She started a small scale business of selling essential commodities.

When she realized a good profit, she decided to start a new business of buying and selling used clothes. This is a very paying business because of the open market.

Most of our people in the community are very poor such that they can not afford to buy brand new clothes. Therefore all are ready to go in for used clothes.

Eunice is making some good money out of her little capital.

Given a loan of 300 US Dollars, she will improve on her business by buying better quality Mitumbas that can raise good profit for her.

She is capable of handling the loan and also to refund it.

loans.use: Buy used clothing (mutumbe) of higher quality so it can be sold at a higher price for higher profits

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
My name is Clemente C. and I am a traveling salesperson of socks, underwear, towels for the kitchen, and handkercheifs. I have had my business for 2 years and because of my business I am able to support my family. I have a good clientel because I sell my items around the government offices. My goal is to have a wider variety of products because, these types of goods often sell quickly and with the additional earnings, I will be able to feed my family and to send my only daughter to a private university to study.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Clemente C. me dedico a la venta ambulante de calcetines, pantaletas, toallas para cocina, pañuelos, tengo mi negocio hace dos años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en oficinas gubernamentales, mi meta es tener una mayor variedad de productos ya que este tipo de productos se vende rapido y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia y darle un estudio privado de universidad a mi unica hija.

loans.use: To purchase: socks for men, women and children, towels, underwear and handkercheifs.

loans.name: Osariemen

texts.en: Osariemen is 34 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, and has been running her own business since 2000. Osariemen she is a hairdresser. She is requesting a loan of US$400 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more hair-dressing materials

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
B. Tahir Jamil oglu settled in Imishli town and has 6 family members. He has 4 children studying at secondary school. He started his business 10 years ago. But he cannot improve his business because he has a small working capital. It is only the business of his family.

Increased demands for his family pushed him to apply to Agroinvest CU for credit. He requested 1200 USD. The half of this sum is for working capital to purchase goods and the second half for renovation of his shop. He hopes to meet family demands by increasing the scale of his business.

loans.use: Firstly, to purchase goods, and the second half for renovation of the shop

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. is a married 32-year-old with one school-aged child and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She opened a shop at home selling pork and chicken-rice and soft drinks to the people in her area. With this business activity, she generally makes around $5 in revenue, while her husband earns about $4/day from weaving handbags and selling them to the wholesalers. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more equipment and utensils.

loans.use: Mrs. Sokheng would like to purchase more equipment and utensils.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie is thirty-five years old and married with one child.  He is engaged in the selling of cosmetics in the outskirts of Makeni town.  He raised his initial capital from working as a casual laborer,but has added to his capital with loans from SMT and increased his stock.  His business is the only source of income for his family.  With the profits, he has managed to meet his family expenses.  He plans to expand the business and is therefore requesting a loan of $250.

loans.use: Increase his cosmetics inventory available for sale

loans.name: Reneh

texts.en: Reneh is 38 years old and married with 6 children.  Her husband is a village elder and very influential as a local leader.  Reneh sells onions, salt, rice, and other food items.  She is also engaged in buying and selling palm oil.  With previous loans, Reneh expanded her business and she said the income has helped her pay one of her children’s school fees. Her future plan is to raise sheep.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy sheep and also to invest in her current business.

loans.use: Purchase sheep for rearing and to supplement her current  food business.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhorn Y., 48, is a mother of four children and works with her husband as traditional musicians, earning collectively about $10 per day. One of her children is enrolled in school, while the rest of them are married and live away from her. Mrs. Chhorn Y. has humbly requested for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation because she and her family has spent a lot of money on using a motor-taxi service day-to-day. She believes the loan will save her family a lot of money and also help increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation

loans.name: Shell Ii 2085(B) Group

texts.en:
Barbra is married with two children. She also cares for four dependants. She wants to use the profits she earns from her business to buy a mortocycle for commercial purposes. Sarah sells fresh foods. Betty has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Rebecca has a retail shop business. With the loan, she would like to increase her inventory.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets and supply capital for the other businesses.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramon, 28, makes a living buying and selling livestock, raising cattle in the town of Villanueva in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Chinandega. He's married with 5 young children who he must feed and educate.

Over the years, Ramon has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. It should be noted that, in the past, this man endured hard economic times for a while, but he's managed to come through thanks to the help provided by Ceprodel. Ceprodel has granted loans that Ramon has used to buy calves, the reason, too, that he needs this loan now.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Ramon E. es un caballero que desde hace 28 años se dedica al trabajo de la ganadería criando terneros en Villanueva municipio de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Es casado y con 5 hijos entre adolescentes y niños de los cuales debe de alimentar y proporcionarles la educación requerida.

A través de los años, el señor Ramón ha venido obteniendo destrezas en lo que respecta a la crianza de estos animales así como su alimentación, tiempo de parto y nacimiento, etc. Es necesario destacar que este caballero por mucho tiempo atrás ha atravesado difíciles situaciones económicas pero ha logrado superarlas gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel al brindarle créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de terneros que es su necesidad nuevamente hoy en día.

loans.use: Buy a calf to develop livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do paperwork for a new vehicle

loans.name: Allpachaca Group

texts.es:
The Allpachaca Communal Bank is a young bank that was formed 1 year ago. It is starting it’s third loan cycle with 17 associates. The associates of the Allpachaca Communal Bank are from the community of Allpachaca, which is located about 4 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The people are dedicated to agriculture and the raising of animals, especially dairy cattle for the production of milk.

The associates work in different businesses like selling clothes or groceries, agriculture and the majority of the associates are dedicated to raising dairy cattle and the production of cheese.

The associates need different loan amounts such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles… making a total of 6300 soles of loans for the Communal Bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying sugar, rice, oil, fertilizers and food for the cattle.

The dreams of the associates are to have more cattle, to improve their businesses, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Allpachaca es un Banco joven que tiene 1 año D. formación, inicia el tercer ciclo con 17 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal Allpachaca son D. la comunidad D. Allpachaca que esta ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, donD. los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza D. animales en especial D. ganado vacuno para la producción D. leche.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, abarrotes, agricultura, y la gran mayoría D. socios se dedican a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, producción D. quesos.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 6300 soles D. préstamos del Banco Comunal.

Sus préstamos seran invertidos en la compra D. azucar, arroz, aceite, abono y alimentos para el ganado.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener más ganado vacuno, mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, fertilizers and food for the cattle.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Armawati

texts.id:
After Ni Ketut Armawati was married to I Made Ariasa, she started running a small kiosk in front of her house. She chose the business because she was already used to selling merchandises, just like her mother. She sells various snacks, coconut ice, coffee, etc. Everyday she opens the kiosk at 7 am and closes at 6 pm. Despite a lot of other kiosks near her house, it doesn't decrease her income. Her daily gross income is Rp 500,000 and her net income is up to Rp 60,000 per day. Before getting a loan from Dinari, her kiosk business was not so good as she only offered a few merchandises. However, she has more merchandes and customers nowadays. The loan that she gets is used as the business capital for adding more varieties of merchandises.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Setelah menikah dengan I Made Ariasa, suaminya, Ni Ketut Armawati mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih karena dari kecil Ni Ketut Armawati sudah terbiasa untuk berjualan mewarisi keahlian ibunya. .Barang yang dujual aneka macam makanan kecil , snack, es kelapa muda, kopi dll.Setiap hari Ni Ketut Armawati membuka warung pada pukul 7.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 06.00 sore. Walaupun banyak ada warung disebelah kanan dan kiri rumahnya, tidak mengurangi penghasilan yang didapatnya. Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat dari hasil warungnya Rp 500,000,-, dan penghasilan bersihnya mencapai Rp 60,000,- perhari. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari usaha warung Ni Kt Armawati sepi karena dagangannya sedikit tetapi sekarang sudah banyak dan pelanggangnya pun bertambah. Dengan modal yang didapat betul-betul dipakai untuk modal usahanya menambah dan melengkapi jenis barang dagangannya.

loans.use: To add business capital to get more merchandises

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two kids. She runs a small business selling audio CDs and movies in the central mall of Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She has a variety of products for sale at reasonable prices in her stall. Natalya started her venture two years ago and has developed a stable enterprise since then. Currently, she has over 6000 Ukranian Hryvnias in inventory. Her monthly net profit is little over 700 Ukranian Hryvnias.

Natalya has many loyal customers. They always come to buy CDs and DVDs from her because they know she offers no low-quality products. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Alla would love to expand her trade and why she is requesting a loan for $550 US to increase her turnover capital. We believe Natalya’s determination and desire to provide only the best quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a very cheerful woman. Her parents used to trade cattle so she bacame involved in this business at a very early age; these days trading sheep is one of her family’s indispensable sources of income. Francisca has another business activity: she makes beautiful gold chains, crafted with patience and skill, joining piece by piece until a beautiful work is finished. Thanks to her business ventures, her dear daughters grew with financial stability, and they have always been of great help. Francisca would like to have capital to invest in her sheep trade business and make enough profits to install basic services in her home. Francisca waits for your kind answer.

Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Francisca es una mujer muy alegre, desde pequeña siempre estuvo ligada a la compra y venta de ganado, actividad que heredó de sus padres quienes fueron sus mejores maestros, ahora hizo de esta actividad uno de sus indispensables ingresos familiares. Doña Francisca se dedica a dos negocios: a la compra y venta de ganado ovino y a la artesanía, elaboración de hermosas cadenas de oro que con paciencia y habilidad une pieza por pieza con los materiales que le proveen para sus bellas obras. Gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con estas actividades, pudo brindarles seguridad a sus dos queridas hijas quienes en todo momento la apoyan en su labor. El deseo de Francisca es contar con mayor capital de inversión en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado, con el propósito de obtener mejores ingresos para por fin hacer instalar los servicios básicos de su domicilio, puesto que eso fue postergando por falta de recursos económicos. Francisca se encuentra en expectativa de tu respuesta.

loans.use: Investment capital for sheep trade business.

loans.name: Mwandawa's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Mwandawa is 33 years old and married with 3 children aged 9, 5 and 1. She has been a clothes and firewood seller since 2007. Every day she works from 7 AM to 8 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Mwandawa now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Jina and Asia, who have businesses dealing with firewood & clothes sales, and cosmetics & food sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Ida Ayu Ketut Sudiarti

texts.id: Ida Ayu Ketut Sudiarti adalah sosok ibu rumah tangga yang sangat ulet. Sehabis mengantar anaknya sekolah dan menyelesaikan semua pekerjaan rumah tangganya, Ida Ayu Ketut memulai aktivitasnya membuat jajan tradisional. Aktivitas ini hampir setiap hari dilakukan mulai jam 09.00 pagi hingga jam 12.00 siang. Untuk membuat jajan tradisional ini memerlukan proses yang sangat panjang hingga bisa dijual ke konsumen. Dari proses mengolah bahan baku hingga menjemur, menghabiskan waktu satu hari. Modal yang di perlukan Rp. 500.000.- untuk membeli  ketan, gula serta bahan campuran lainnya. Kurangnya modal yang dimiliki Ida Ayu Ketut membuatnya sangat berharap mendapatkan bantuan dari  Dinari yang bekerja sama dengan organisasi didesanya. Jajan yang sudah siap jual, langsung dibawa ke pasar tempat para langganannya. Jajan ini sangat laku terjual karena hampir setiap saat dipergunakan untuk sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu di Bali.Keuntungan bersih yang diperoleh dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah kedua anaknya, karena penghasilan suaminya yang tidak menentu, tapi Ida Ayu Ketut merasa bahagia  walau  tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana,  namun terlihat asri dan mereka bahagia.
texts.en:
Ida Ayu Ketut Sudiarti is a persevere housewife. After taking her children to school and finishing house chores, she starts making traditional delicacies. This is an everyday activity from 9 AM until 12 PM. It is a long process before the delicacies can reach her customers. From mixing the ingredients and sun-drying them, it takes one whole day. The capital she needs to buy ingredients suh as sticky rice, sugar and others is USD 55. Her lack of capital, makes her in need for capital loan from Dinari that cooperates with her village organization. Ready for sell delicacies are directly taken to her customers in the market. The delicacies are easy to be sold, as it is always used as an offering for Hindu's rituals in Bali. The net profit she makes is utilized to meet her daily needs and for education of her two children. Eventhough her husband does not have fix income, she is still happy. And she is happy lliving in modest yet pretty nice and neat house.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Mansor

texts.en:
This is Mansor K.. She is 28 years of age, and married with three children, all of whom are in primary schools. Her husband works for a local non-governmental organization (NGO) in Kabala and the two work hand-in-hand to maintain the family. Mansor is in the business of selling ready-to-wear-clothes to females.  

This is the fourth loan she is getting from SMT.  Previously, she received a loan of Le 3,000,000.00.  The loan was a great help to her business and life. She was able to solve many of her problems with the profit made from the loan. She repaid the loan successfully while maintaining additional capital.

Mansor buys her goods in Freetown and sells in Kabala. It is in Freetown that she can get the best clothes at a cheaper price. 

She is requesting a loan of Le 6,000,000.00 (US$1,200). This time, she wants to invest this loan on local produce like beans, rice and palm-oil. She will keep the goods in a store and wait until the prices of such commodities rise, then she will sell them. Meanwhile, she will continue selling her ready-to-wear clothes.

Even though her business faces no serious challenges, she does have a great goal of building her first home.

loans.use: Buy more products to add to her business.

loans.name: Harerimana

texts.en:
C. Harerimana says “Mukomere” (Get strong) the greetings from the Northern province of Rwanda! C. is 30 years old, married with 2 children.

This client has been in a credit association since 2005. He sells different items like clothes, used shoes, home utensils like cooking pots, sandals, blankets, basins, cups, plates etc in the local market in the town. He has a small shop where he sells from and during the market days, he transports his items on his bicycle to sell them to the local people who come to the market. He employs 2 people to run the business.

He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to increase on his stock by buying more clothes; shoes since he is anticipating increased sales during this Christmas season. This loan would be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his capital

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 53 años, es natural del pueblito de Pusi, vive sola, ya que no tuvo esposo ni hijos. Reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 32 años, saliendo de su pueblito natal en busca de un mejor porvenir, se dedica a la venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria hace 6 años después de haber realizado todo tipo de negocios. La venta de golosinas es muy rentable y gracias a ello obtiene buenos ingresos, lo más difícil es tener que enfrentarse sola al trabajo, ya que pasa largas horas atendiendo su pequeño puesto, lo bueno de esto es que ha ganado muy buenos amigos gracias a su cordialidad y alegría, lo cual hace que los clientes sean muy asiduos a su puestito. Teofila se encuentra en segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para poder comercializar, es por eso que recurre a nuestra ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofila is 53 years old and is originally from the town of Pusi. She lives alone, and has never been married or had any children. She has been living in the city of Juliaca for 32 years, leaving the town she was born in to find a better future. She has been selling sweets as a street vendor for 6 years, after having tried all types of jobs. Sweets sales is very profitable and thanks to that she has obtained a good income. The most difficult aspect of this job is working alone and she must pass long hours attending her small stand. The great thing is that she has gained many good friends thanks to her warmth and cheerfulness, making many of the clients regulars of her little stand. Teofila is asking for her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, following very punctual payments on her first loan. With the money that is lent, she will buy the more sweets to sell. For this, she is asking again for our help to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of sweets she can sell

loans.name: Emprendedoras Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá en el Barrio María Auxiliadora distante a 3km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas se dedica a la venta de los ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida . 
Los distintos tipos de actividades que desarrollan son: 
Mirtha Graciela C.	Mercería
Gladys Z.	Vendedora ambulante 
Marta C.	Venta de ropas
Isabel V.	Venta de remedios yuyos
Daisy V.	Venta de productos Avon
Heriberta Britez	Empleada de servicio
Ma-Elena González	Empleada de servicio
Mirta M. 	Vendedora ambulante
Aida Báez	Tejedora
Pánfila C. 	Venta de verduras
Rosana P.	Venta de Comidas
Inés F.	Venta de chipas
Liliana Z.	Vendedora ambulante 
Patrocinia E.	Empleada de servicio
Lourdes M.	Empleada

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual. 
No pudo asistir para la foto  Pánfila C.
texts.en:
In the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood of the city of Carapeguá, three blocks from Fundación Paraguaya's Carapeguá office, a group of low-resource women found out about the Enterprising Women Committee and decided to get together to find out more about the program. These women are very active. Most of them are vendors, and they sell the goods listed below. They are looking for a little more support, in the form of credit, to increase their families' incomes and improve their quality of life. The women work in the following areas: Mirtha Graciela C., Haberdashery Gladys Z., Street vendor Marta C., Clothing sales Isabel V., Herbal remedies Daisy V., Avon products Heriberta Britez, Service worker Ma-Elena González , Service worker Mirta M., Street vendor Aida Báez, Weaver Pánfila C., Vegetable sales Rosana P., Food sales Inés F., Cheese pastry sales Liliana Z. , Street vendor Patrocinia E., Service worker Lourdes M., Maid The women need these loans to invest in their respective businesses in order to attain sustainable growth, both on a group level and a personal level. Pánfila C. was unable to attend the meeting at which the group's picture was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread, dustcloths, clothing, flour, pasta, vegetables, fruits and herbal remedies

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe

texts.es:
VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE L. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ” ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano “Víctor Maldonado Begazo” en el Jr. Oroya Mz. 10, Lt. 07 de la C.F.B. km. 7.000 del Distrito de Callería, ella tiene 41 años de edad 06 hijos, madre soltera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, detergentes todo en poca cantidad, crecía poco a poco la bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró Mouse, audios para sus computadoras.

La señora Virgen de Guadalupe gracias a su esfuerzo, empeño y la ayuda de Manuela Ramos, logró implementar en su casa cabinas de internet y telefónica, del cual tiene mucha clientela, sobre todo no deja la bodega, sigue creciendo todo gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Virgen de Guadalupe L. B. belongs to "La Amistad" community bank, located in the District of Callería. She is a 41-year-old single mother with six children. With the first loan she received, 300 soles, she bought basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs and detergent, all in small quantities, expanding her store little by little. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy a mouse and speakers for her computers. Thanks to her effort and determination and the help of Manuela Ramos, Virgen de Guadalupe has been able to install internet and telephone booths in her home. Her store has a lot of customers, and continues to grow thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer mouse and speakers for her internet business

loans.name: Riaz M. Akhtar Bhatti Group
loans.use: To buy electric items for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà năm nay  50 tuổi, gia đình chị có 7 con đều đã trưởng thành trong đó có ba con đang sống cùng bố mẹ. Các con của chị đều đã đi làm . Chị Hoà tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán rau và sự hỗ trợ của các con hàng tháng với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho chăn nuôi và kinh doanh buôn bán rau
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hoà is 50 years old. Her family has seven children, all of which are grown. Three of the seven children are living in her household. All of her children work. Ms. Hoà has participated in TYM Fund since 1998. At the moment, the work that provides the family's income are the businesses of rearing animals, buying/selling vegetables, and the additional monthly support from the children - they have an income of 6,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in their businesses of rearing livestock and retailing vegetables.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying/Selling Vegetables and Raising Livestock

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
CARMEN P. RODRÍGUEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre” vive en la Av. Arborización Mz 2 Lt 9 del distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 57 años de edad, 10 hijos, y su pareja se dedica al negocio de madera.

Se inició en el negocio de artículos para belleza y perfumes, y la venta por catálogos, y el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrarlos, cuenta con clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo, también está ingresando de algún modo al negocio de la madera en conjunto con su familia.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la madera ha mejorado.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos, y unos 900 nuevos soles, esta invirtiendo junto a su familia para la compra de madera.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Carmen P. R. belongs to the "Amigas por Siempre" (Friends Forever) Community Bank. She lives in Av. Arborización Mz 2 Lt 9, in the Yarinacocha district in the city of Pucallpa. She is 57 years old, has ten children and her husband is dedicated to the wood business. She began in the cosmetics and perfumes business and selling through catalogs. With the first loan of 300 soles, she bought a small display case so she'd be able to show her products. She can rely on customers and her business has been growing. Also, she is entering in some ways into the wood business alongside her family. Today, she has progressed with her family and the wood business has improved. With this loan of 1,800 soles, she will invest in the purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and new products and she is investing some 900 soles, along with her family, in the purchase of wood She said, "Manuela Ramos is an ONG that supports a great number of families with small loans that allow women of this area to start or improve their businesses and I am happy with this help." “

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, cosmetics and other items for her stock.

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicine to make a living. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Jesús Arturo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del  señor Jesús Arturo M. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas ya que las que tiene actualmente están en mal estado, y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar le a la persona que realizara las nuevas protecciones. 
    En la casa de don Jesús Arturo vive su familia y su mamá quienes se hacen sargo de los gastos familiares. 
    Quien aparece en la fotografía es la señora María Ester C. mamá del señor Jesús Arturo M. ya que cuando se realizo la visita el se encontraba en su trabajo, ya que es el encargado del centro de computo de una escuela.
texts.en:
Jesús Arturo M. needs to secure the windows and doors in his home because they are currently in bad shape. He does not have the money to pay someone to make the improvements. Jesús Arturo lives with his family and his mother; he is responsible for the family expenses. Mrs. María Ester C., Jesús’ mother, is in the photograph. He was at work when they came and took the picture. He is in charge of the data center for a school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the door and window securities

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Mrs. Corazon A. is a 48-year-old from Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter/ farmer and blessed with seven children. Due to financial difficulties, she decided to engage in food vending. She started a business with a minimal amount only. Being a member of Paglaum MPC she is able to acquire additional capital for her business.

She sells a variety of viands to neighbors, friends, and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business. Now, she wants a loan of PHP 4,000. Determination in life is what she has. Her heart’s desire is to have a small stall for a sari-sari (variety) store and to send their children to school and witness them be successful in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 25 años, vive con su madre y una D. sus hermanas en L. casa D. sus padres. Se dedica a vender todo tipo D. productos para las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, tales como semillas, abono, fertilizantes, alimentos y antiparasitarios para animales, etc. Tiene un local ubicado en una zona céntrica D. L. ciudad, el cual viene atendiendo desD. hace más D. 7 meses. Oscar permanece en su negocio hasta las 5 D. L. tarD. para luego ir a estudiar a L. universidad, entonces lo remplaza su tío en L. atención D. los clientes. Con este trabajo, Oscar pueD. contar con independencia económica, y le agrada realizarlo, puesto que le permite estar en el campo, al aire libre, las ocasiones cuando entrega los productos a sus clientes en sus chacras. Nos comenta que L. mejor época D. ventas es durante las temporadas D. siembra y cosecha, sin embargo, normalmente mantiene estable sus ventas y sus ingresos, por lo que a futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería para atender mayores pedidos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas D. progreso, y se compromete a responder responsablemente en el pago D. sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a L. compra D. más mercadería (fertilizantes, semillas y otros) para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar is 25 years old and lives with his mother and one of his sisters in their parents' house. He works selling all types of products for agriculture and raising livestock, such as seeds, compost, fertilizer, feed and anti-parasitics for the animals, etc. He has a shop situated in the city center where he's been operating for the last seven months. Oscar stays in his shop until 5:00 pm but later he goes to study at the university and then his uncle stands in for him in tending to his customers. Oscar is satisfied with the economic independence his work provides him and he enjoys it because it allows him to be in the open air in the countrysiD. on the occasions when he delivers products to his customers at their farms. He tells us that the best time for sales is during the planting and harvesting seasons, however his sales and his income are usually stable. For the future, he wants to increase his merchandise so he can take care of more orders. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and he has great expectations of progress. He promises to act responsibly in making his payments. The money he is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise (fertilizers, seeds and other things) in order to stock up his business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet N. is 70 years old. She is widowed and has eight children—five sons and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Janet sells vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, pepper, and so forth on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. Janet also treks to other towns to sell her products on their market days. She has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Molino, del distrito D. Juli, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 05 hijos y no tiene estudios, vive en el centro poblado D. Molino Barrio Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. lana para elaboración D. artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. lana vegetal para elaborar tejidos, como animalitos y prendas D. vestir, además comprará bayeta (tela) para realizar bordados.  Ella venD. sus productos en las ferias D. la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la forma D. trabajo D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Senora Rufina belongs to the “Molino-Juli” Community Bank, which is located in Molino, the central town in the district of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has no schooling. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of Molino.

For almost two years she has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 300 New Soles which she used to purchase wool for making handicrafts.

Now, she is asking for a loan of 500 New Soles in order to buy wool for making items such as small animals or articles of clothing. She will also buy material for embroidery. She sells her products at local markets.

Rufina’s wish is to continue working and to be able to educate her children.

She likes the work of Movimiento Manuelo Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wool and embroidery material

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata  Doucouré est une femme mariée  de 49 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui vit avec son  mari et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème  région du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce qu’elle  appris  auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires  et des céréales. Après 10 ans d’apprentissage, elle a pu maîtriser les rouages du petit commerce. Forte de cette expérience,  elle  choisit comme créneau  la vente des produits alimentaires. Elle détient une  boutique aux abords d’un boulevard d’accès très facile du quartier Darsalam. Ses articles sont  soigneusement étalés sur des étagères.
Pour réaliser plus de chiffre d’affaire en augmentant le volume de son activité elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 53 cartons de lait en poudre et divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises à  partir de la république islamique de Mauritanie.
Madame Fatoumata  Doucouré vend, en grande partie, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA, qui lui permet de faire face aux dépenses familiales (payer la scolarité de ses enfants, compléter le prix du condiment) mais également de rembourser ses dettes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Doucouré is a 49 year old married woman and the mother of 8 children; she lives will her husband and their children in a traditional family with other households in the neighborhood of Darsalam de Ségou (4th region of Mali).

At a young age she became interested in businesses which generated income, notably the business that she learned with her mother - selling food condiments and grains. After 10 years of apprenticeship, she mastered the art of small business. With this great experience under her belt, she chose a parallel business - selling food products. She owns a store next to a boulevard which can be easily accessed from the neighborhood of Darsalam. Her merchandise is carefully organized on the shelves of her store.

In order to achieve more sales and increase the volume of her business, she works with Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, which she intends to use to purchase 53 boxes of powdered milk and a variety of other food products. She supplies herself with merchandise from the Islamic Republic of Mauritania. Mrs. Fatoumata Doucouré sells mostly for cash and occasionally for credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly income of 50,000 FCFA, which will enable her to pay for her family's expenses (school tuition for her children, the full price of the condiments), and to repay her debts.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase powdered milk and a variety of other food products.

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq Q. is married with three children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Natiq has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise ten years ago with a starting capital of $200. Over time he expanded his business and now it has become domestic as his family helps him with the business.

Today, Natiq needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Daïma Minmin

texts.fr: M. Daïma Minmin est mariée à KOUMAHI Séïdou, un hôtelier. Ce couple a à sa charge trois enfants tous scolarisés dont un seul est le leur. La famille réside depuis trois ans à Lokokoukoumè, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Daïma Minmin vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Daïma Minmin vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et des produits vivriers. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Daïma Minmin achète ses produits et elle les vend chez elle à la maison. Daïma Minmin a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Daïma Minmin a eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Daïma Minmin demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de produits vivriers, de sucre, de pâtes alimentaires, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Bancomunal San Antonio de Padua, es casada, tiene 40 años, tres hijos de 20, 18 y 10 años, solamente el último esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Alicia inició su negocio con una tienda de abarrotes que la tuvo por quince años, pero la cerró por dos años, hace medio año se a dedicado a vender en su casa cervezas y gaseosas.
En Finca Perú aprendió a ahorrar y a invertir, ahora sus ventas han crecido. 
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de bebidas para su negocio.
El sueño de Alicia es de volver abrir su bodega.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the San Antonio de Padua community bank. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 20, 18, and 10 years old, with only the last one studying at the public school. Alicia started her business with a grocery store that she had for 15 years, but it has been closed for two years. For six months she has been selling beers and sodas from her house. In Finca Perú she learned to save and invest, and now her sales have increased. Alicia needs a loan of 800 soles to purchase drinks for her business. Alicia’s dream is to be able to re-open her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks for her business

loans.name: Women Blessing Group

texts.en:
Philip D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Blessing. He is 37 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 18. His children's educational levels range from kindergarten to 6th grade. He is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to poverty.

Philip and his family live in the Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Philip’s business is the sale of rice. He buys bags of rice wholesale from farmers and sells retail by cup to residents of Ziggida Town. He has been running this business for three years and is hoping to improve business. Philip sells quality rice and serves his customers with respect in order to encourage them to continue buying from him

Philip is a hardworking father who cares about his family's well-being. He started selling rice during his high school days. He paid his school fees and maintained his business. Because of poverty, Philip took care of himself as a youth and now, he doesn’t want his children to encounter what he went through as a youth. He believes that every child has the right to a comfortable upbringing.
 
He needs this loan in order to purchase more rice wholesale to acquire more profit to improve business. Philip dreams of giving his children a better education and moving to the capital in Monrovia, Liberia.

loans.use: To purchase more rice wholesale to acquire more profit to improve business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Comfort is a petty trader. She runs a provisions store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Comfort desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Frank Robert

texts.es:
Frank es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el sector Camino Real – Campiña Cascajal, en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como mototaxista desde que tenía trece años de edad, este negocio le provee los ingresos permanentes que necesita para mantener a su familia, además se dedica a la agricultura desde los quince años de edad. Usualmente siembra caña de azúcar, cebolla, ají y pimientos en un pequeño terreno que heredó de sus padres. Con los ingresos de estas actividades Frank mantiene y saca adelante a su familia.

El continuo uso otorgado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a fallar y requiera mantenimiento urgente. Por este motivo Frank se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para darle a su unidad móvil el mantenimiento y equipamiento que necesita.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir sembrando y ahorrar para comprarse un auto y trabajar como taxista mientras no esté en el campo. También desea ampliar su casa para darle a su familia la comodidad que requiere. Frank es emprendedor, honesto y entregado a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Frank is the head of his household. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife two children in the Camino Real sector – Campiña Cascajal, in the Paiján district, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region, located three hours from Chiclayo City. He has been working as a moto-taxi driver since he was thirteen years old. This business privides him the reliable income that he needs to provide for his family. He also has been working in agriculture since he was fifteen. Normally, he plants sugar cane, onions, chili, and peppers in the small plot of land that he inherited from his parents. With the income from these businesses, Frank provides for his family and helps them prosper. The continual use of his moto-taxi has made it start to break down, and it requires urgent maintenance. This is why Frank is soliciting his first Edpyme Alternativa loan of 1,000 new soles to provide his vehicle with the necessary maintenance and equipment. His greatest wish is to continue farming and to save to buy himself a car to work as a taxi driver when he is not at home farming. He would also like to expand his home to make it more comfortable for his family. Frank is entrepreneurial, honest, and dedicated to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Moto-taxi maintenance and equipment

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROXANA, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene una hija. Su hija se llama Kiara, tiene 4 años y esta en el jardín. Ellas son naturales de la ciudad de Cusco. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo como asistente administrativo en el instituto superior “SENATI” del Cusco. Ella también en su tiempo libre vende carteras a pedido del cliente. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más carteras y vender en estas fiestas navideñas.         
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Roxana is 28 years old, married, and has a daughter. Her daughter’s name is Kiara, she is 4 years old and is in preschool. They are natives of Cusco. Roxana belongs to the “Durabank” communal bank at Asociación Arariwa.

She alternates household chores with her job as an administrative assistant at the “Senati” institute in Cusco. In her free time, she also sells purses by customer request. She has already been in the business for several years and it has gone well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her job. Roxana is hardworking and enterprising, helping her family to get ahead. She needs a loan in order to purchase more purses to sell during the holidays.

Roxana is appreciative of the opportunity provided to her and she is also committed to keeping up with the schedule of repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more purses to sell during the holidays

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle C. is a God-fearing woman with big dreams. She has been a member of the Kiva field partner, ASHI, since 2008. She and her husband, Sunday, have three children. Their eldest is in high school, while the other two children are elementary students. Education of these three incurs a lot of expense for Merle and her husband to deal with. Her husband is a farmer, while Merle has been selling a variety of different small goods in her sari-sari store. Merle wanted to address the needs of her neighborhood in their community, so she started her own business through loans she received from ASHI. She will be expanding further by purchasing more supplies that will bring satisfaction to her regular costumers and accommodate their daily needs.

On her 4th loan with ASHI, she is requesting 20,000 PHP to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income. The proceeds of her business also support the immediate and basic needs of her family.

Merle hopes that her business will become successful someday. Having the opportunity to access loans through ASHI has enabled her to start reaching for her goal. Along with the success of her business, she is dreaming about the graduation of her three children. Her greatest desire is to give her children a brighter tomorrow, and that is the reason she keeps in her mind and heart, that she will not to surrender to poverty.

loans.use: to pay for goods for her variety store.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon is 23 years old and was born in Spitamen region, Tajikistan. He is the father of four children. His main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. 

A very ambitious man, Akmaljon would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a barn in which to house them, in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $1,500 USD for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Akmaljon will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help, this will be possible.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cattle for business expansion, and to build a barn

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa, la señora Maura H. es propietaria de su propio negocio de servicio de fotocopias donde le visitan muchas personas y muchos estudiantes para sacar fotocopia a diferentes documentos y ella muy atentamente los atiende con su único objetivo de que se sientan satisfechos con el servicio que ella brinda.
Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de papelería para llevar a cabo la actividad y así cuando los clientes lleguen, ella pueda tener suficiente papel para realizar las fotocopias.
texts.en:
Maura H. owns her photocopying service in Chichigalpa. Many customers and students visit her shop to make copies of various documents. Her only objective is that they leave satisfied with the service she provides so she, herself, graciously takes care of them. She is asking for funding to buy paper so that she will have enough on hand to make all the photocopies her customers ask for.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy photocopier paper.

loans.name: Noemí Del Carmen

texts.es: Noemí del Carmen G. D. R. D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como vigilante D. una empresa privada y junto a sus dos hijos D. 17 y  10 años D. edad. Noemí se dedica a vender ropa, por las mañanas la comercializa en la calle principal D. Soyapango, una D. las calles más concurridas del lugar debido a que existen varios supermercados y comerciales en el lugar. Así mismo por las tardes Noemí venD. la ropa D. forma ambulante, ofreciéndola por las calles y pasajes D. las colonias D. este municipio. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, en diferentes tallas y colores, esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder obtener mayor cantidad D. clientes y así percibir más ganancias, lo cual es muy importante para Noemí ya que el sueldo D. su esposo es bastante bajo para solventar todos los gastos del hogar, razón por la cual Noemí se esfuerza mucho por mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Noemí del Carmen G. D. R. is 56 years old and a resident of Soyapango, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a security guard at a private company, and their two children, ages 17 and 10. Noemí sells clothing in the mornings along the main street of Soyapango, which is one of the busiest places because of the different supermarkets and businesses found at this location. In the afternoons she sells clothing as a traveling merchant, offering her products as she passes through different neighborhoods.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of clothes in different sizes and colors. Noemí hopes this will help her attract more customers and generate better earnings. This is very important because her husband’s salary is not enough to cover all of their household expenses. For this reason, she works extremely hard to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in larger quantities

loans.name: Juana Sugey

texts.es:
La señora Juana S. trabaja en elaboración y ventas de mochila en su casa de habitación oficio que aprendió desde joven en el municipio de Nagarote.
Las mochilas que elaboran las vendes en el mercado de Managua donde lo ofertan a los comerciantes ya que las mochilas son de excelentes calidad.
Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de tela, zíper, hilos, y otros insumos para llevar a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
Juana S. makes and sells knapsacks in her home; this is a skill she learned when she was a young girl in Nagarote. The knapsacks she makes are sold in Managua's market to merchants because they are of excellent quality. She is asking for funds to buy fabric, zippers, thread and other supplies needed for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que no se intimida ante nada, más aún si se trata de brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia. Tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos adolescentes y su esposo Pedro de 46 años.

Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposo, se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero lamentablemente hace 2 años él sufrió un accidente en la pierna izquierda que no le permite caminar; esta situación hizo que ella trabaje con más ahínco junto a su hijo mayor porque no quiere que le falte nada a su familia y mucho menos pasar necesidades. “Mi hijo prácticamente, por el bien de sus hermanos y padre, es el hombre de la casa, por eso quizá no me afecto mucho que mi pareja deje de trabajar, pues Heber (su hijo) es más responsable y estoy muy orgullosa” refiere Ana. 
Por ello, madre e hijo, todos los días salen a las cuatro de la mañana rumbo a sus tierras llevando los operarios que contrataron, ya que les gusta ver siempre limpios sus tierras porque así aseguran una buena cosecha. 
Como les va bien en la agricultura Ana piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener una mejor productividad, asimismo planea reinstalar su tienda de comestibles, la que cerró porque tuvo que pagar a los empleados que le ayudaron a fumigar sus plantas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, ya que asegura que en cada reunión aprende cómo enfrentar situaciones difíciles que se le presenta en su vida diaria, gracias a las charlas educativas que recibe. Con el dinero que solicita, más lo que tiene ahorrado, comprará los productos necesarios para reinstalar su tienda de comestibles, especialmente bebidas gasificadas que son más rentables.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who is not intimidated by anything, especially when it comes to providing an adequate quality of life for her family. She is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her three teenage children and her husband Pedro (age 46).

For ten years, Ana and her husband have been dedicated to farming. Unfortunately, her husband was in an accident two years ago in which he injured his left leg to the point that he is no longer able to walk. This situation made her work harder along with her oldest son because she did not want her family to lack anything, much less give up basic necessities. “My son is essentially, for the sake of his siblings and his father, the man of the house. This has not affected me so much as it does my husband, since he is not able to work. Heber (her son) is very responsible and I am very proud of him,” says Ana. Every day, mother and child leave at 4am to head toward their farmland. They have hired workers since they always like to see their land cleared because it ensures a good harvest. Ana believes they have done well in their farming activities because they always plant in large numbers to obtain a more productive harvest. She also plans to reopen her grocery store, which she had to close because she had to pay workers to help with fumigating their crops.

This is her second loan with MFP. Ana is happy to be working with her Communal Bank because at each meeting she learns how to confront different situations that are encountered as a part of daily life, thanks to the educational seminars that have been provided. With the money she requested, Ana will be able to save enough money to purchase products that are needed to reopen her grocery store, especially sodas since they are the most profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise so that she can reopen her grocery store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old and married to Monicah Wairimu. He opened his retail shop in Naivasha town last year and it has proved to be a profitable venture.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to add stock by buying cooking fat, maize flour and rice in bulk.

He plans to grow in the retail sector and open a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize and rice in bulk to sell

loans.name: Pahuichi Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal “PAHUICHI” esta conformado por 11 miembros y representado por el señor Juan Oscar, este grupo esta conformado por socios jóvenes con ganas de salir adelante y crecer en sus negocios.  El señor Juan Oscar es Soltero el acaba de terminar de estudia Odontología y desea poder montar su propio consultorio y hacer una especialidad, es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para tener sus consultorio y poder trabajar y pagar sus estudios por las noches. El resto de los socios se dedican diferentes actividades como la elaboración y venta de masitas, venta de cosméticos y ropa mediante catalogo, libros, cds, atención en licorería y  otros son publicista pese a lo jóvenes que son. A  pesar de que la competencia dentro de cualquier actividad de comercio que se realice, está muy fuerte, los clientes saben por donde moverse, como realizar los contactos y cuales son las fechas adecuadas para cada producto en otras palabras tienen mucha experiencia. Los socios sutilizaran el crédito para la compra de libros de especialidad, otros para la compra de mercadería, la publicista para la compra de una cámara filmadora. La mayor expectativa que tiene este grupo de jóvenes es poder culminar sus estudios porque muchos se encuentran a mitad de sus carreras debido a que la mayoría se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para sustentarse. Varios de estos clientes ya trabajaron con otras instituciones del sistema financiero, como también algunos ya trabajaron en nuestra institución, es en este sentido que a pesar de ser jóvenes quieren salir adelante para crecer mas y ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
The “PAHUICHI” communal bank includes 11 members and is represented by Juan Oscar. This group is made up of young members who have the desire to get ahead and expand their businesses. Juan Oscar is single, and he has just finished his studies in the field of Odontology. He wants to open his own clinic and also continue specialized studies. He needs the loan in order to open his clinic, so he can work and pay for his night classes. The other members work in a range of fields, such as making and selling pastries; selling cosmetics and clothing from a catalog; selling books or CDs; or serving customers in a liquor store. Others work in public relations, in spite of their young age. Despite the fact that there is heavy competition in all of these fields, the members know where to go, how to make contacts, and what seasons are best for each product; in short, they have a lot of experience. Some of the members will use the loan to buy specialized books; others will buy merchandise; and the publicist will use it for a video recorder. The greatest expectation shared by this group of young people is to be able to finish their studies, because many of them are working full-time in their careers due to their need to support themselves. Some of these members have worked in the past with other financial institutions, and some have worked with our institution in the past. In spite of being young, they want to get ahead, expand their businesses and become better every day.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sujatha

texts.en:
Sujatha is a married woman who lives with her husband in Kekanadura, a town in the area of Matara. Her husband works as a welder. 

Sujatha manages a jewelry-making business with the help of her husband.  She has asked for a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy tools to help her business.

Thank you for taking time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Anelyn J. is 31 years old and from the barangay of San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married to Artemio J., an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), and has three school-aged children. In the photo, she is pictured with one of her children.
To make a living, Anelyn is engaged in agricultural activity, particularly in papaya production. She has been engaged in her business for one year already and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from this activity. She also receives a monthly allowance from her husband as an OFW.
In 2008, Anelyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for papaya production. This will be her third loan from PMPC. Anelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and saving for future use, especially for her children’s education.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for papaya production

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya I. makes a living brewing and selling local Sudanese alcohol and has applied for this loan to buy supplies for her company. She is 31 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build bar and stock up on supplies of beer. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy brewing supplies

loans.name: El Granito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Granito es un nuevo grupo conformado por Johana Cruz M., Denis Francisco García y Agustín Tercero T.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora M. de 42 años quien desde el 2005 se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como cuajadas, queso, leche, crema los cuales trae del norte del país.

Ella inicio con la venta de pocos productos actualmente vende ente 500 a 600 cuajadas semanales ya que distribuye a distintos tramos del mercado. Mendosa asegura que esto es gracias al apoyo familiar que tiene ya que su esposo e hijos trabajan hombro a hombro junto con ella.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Denis Francisco García quien desde hace 8 años vende granos básicos y Agustín Tercero T.  se dedica al comercio de ropa en especial calcetas, calzonetas, chores, camisetas etc.
texts.en:
The Granito (Little Grain) group is newly formed. Its members are: Johana Cruz M., Denis Francisco García and Agustín Tercero T.. Mrs. M., 42, is group leader. She has sold dairy products like, cuajada (a cottage cheese-like cheese), cheese, milk and cream since 2005; she brings the merchandise from the north of the country. She started out selling just a few products but today she sells between 500 and 600 cuajadas per week because she distributes them along several aisles in the market. She states that this is possible thanks to the help she gets from her family since her husband and children work shoulder to shoulder with her. The other group members are: Denis Francisco García who has sold basic grains for the past 8 years and Agustín Tercero T. who sells clothing, especially socks, underwear, shorts, t-shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted dairy products.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima L. is 34 years old and single, with no children. To earn a living, she sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Fatima has many years of experience in this business. Fatima needs a loan of WST 1000 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business. Fatima joined SPBD this year, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Fatima's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva at http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375 to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nizarina

texts.en:
Nizarina T. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old and single. She has one infant child.

To make a living, Nizarina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Nizarina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Nizarina joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nizarina is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
