Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Action Group Ii

texts.en:
Meet members of “Action group II" from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group. The twenty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have two children who are attending primary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil) and rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her business inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy palm oil and rice

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 42 years old and is married with two children 11 and 12 years old.

Vincent owns a grocery store where he sells a variety of goods, mainly sugar, rice, etc. He has been in this business for about ten years and the hours of his business are from six until late in the evening.

Vincent needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he will expand his business through adding the sale of beverages and some other products which seem to be in high demand by a large number of his customers.

If successful, Vincent will hopefully earn a lot of money which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy beverages and a variety of goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olimpia; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de crianza de pollos y gallinas, ella compra cuando son pequeños los pollos y los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en el mercado del distrito de Urubamba, ella trabaja en forma independiente, su esposo trabaja como albañil y juntos sacan adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio de crianza de pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  pollos y gallinas y también para comprar alimentos para los animales.
 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 23, lives with her life partner and their child. She alternates her daily activities with raising chicks and chickens. She buys them when they are young and fattens them up for subsequent sale at Urubamba disrict’s market. She works independently and her husband works as a bricklayer. Together they support their son. She wants to expand her chicken raising business and is asking for funds to buy chicks and chickens as well as animal feed for them. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks and chickens as well as animal feed for them.

loans.name: Analinda

texts.en: Analinda C. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Sto.Domingo. Analinda has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Analinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Analinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Analinda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Evangeline is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide H. is from the town of Palilan, Jimenez Misamis Occidental Philippines. She is 29 years old. Heide is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Heide owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Heide has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Heide joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Heide has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Heide is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Heide from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie F. is from the village of Brgy. Aurora, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 27 years old. Jessie is married and has 1 infant-aged child. 

To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Jessie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jessie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for fruit & vegetable farming

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hayde; La socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene  3 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de San Blas desde hace 1 año, La socia trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, alistando todas sus verduras, platos, local y todo para atender a sus clientes desde muy temprano, la socia desea implementar su puesto de comidas y para ello solicita el préstamo para poder comprar utensilios de cocina, insumos entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la cocina y de utensilios básicos para su atención.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hayde is a member of the “Sacsayhuaman” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Hayde is 48 years old.  She is single and has 3 children.  She has been selling food in San Blas market for one year.  She works from 8 o'clock in the morning getting her vegetables, dishes, premises and everything else ready so that she can serve her customers from very early in the morning.  She would like to continue with her food stall and for that reason she is requesting a loan to buy cooking utensils and supplies.  She is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies and basic utensils.

She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies and basic utensils

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group Exito Con Cristo 1, 2 & 3. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to raise her children and to educate them.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to be at her home and to cook.

Martha is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost two years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying jeans, shirts, shoes, etc. She will use the profits to invest in her business, she will purchase more products to expand her December sales. 

This Esperanza association began with us because she needed to start a business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) and Dominican clients generally.  Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries.  The main economic activities are: the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

For this group of 15 we decided to take two pictures instead of one, where faces are visible. They all belong to the same Bank of Hope.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rozakan Arzybaeva's Group

texts.en:
Rozakan A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 61 and unfortunately a widow. She has raised a daughter, 36, who went to work in Russia. In order to earn money to cover her personal expenses, Rozakan breeds livestock. Reselling some farm animals after fattening she earns 5,000 KGS per month.  With this loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the near future, she plans to start repairing her house.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo M. R. es un agricultor de 42 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Nueva Danli en el municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Wilfredo iniciò su cultivo de yuca en media manzana de tierra porque no tenìa dinero para sembrar mas. Luego de un tiempo un amigo de èl le comentò que habìa solicitado un prestamo en FAMA y entonces Wilfredo decidiò presentarse a las oficinas a solicitar un prestamo tambien. Su prestamo su aprobado y en la actualidad tiene sembrado 4 manzanas. Ahora el solicita un prestamo para sembrar una manzana mas y necesita comprar abono y pagar la chapia. Su meta es ser un agricultor diversificado para poder tener otros ingresos y asi mejorar su vida y la de su familia, porque quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales universitarios. Ha sido cliente de FAMA por cuatro ciclos y ha cance
texts.en:
Wilfredo M. R. is a 42 year-old farmer.  He is married, has three children, and lives with his family in the Nueva Danli neighborhood of Patuca, Olancho.  Wilfredo started out growing cassava on just under an acre of land because he didn't have enough money to sow any more land.  One of his friends told him that he had requested a loan from FAMA and Wilfredo decided to go to FAMA's offices to request a loan too.  His loan was approved and he currently sows over 7 acres of land.

Wilfredo is requesting this loan so that he can sow another 1.75 acres, buy manure and pay laborers.  His goal is to farm a variety of crops so that he can make more income and thereby improve his own life and that of his family because he would like his children to go to university and become professionals.  He has been a client of FAMA for four loan cycles.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay laborers

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a realizar bellos bordados, actividad que lo realiza desD. hace 41 años, esta experiencia le ha servicio para ser mas productiva diseñando nuevos modelos en sus bordados. Sus hijas la ayudan en esta tarea, siendo su casa, lugar que implementó para que sea un taller  artesanal. Lo que más le agrada D. su trabajo  es la tranquilidad que siente y las ganancias que le produce ya que esta labor a pesar D. durar un mes aproximadamente, por cada  falda  bordada y las aplicaciones que requiere como lentejillas e hilos dorados como plateados requiere D. mucha  precisión e hilos D. muchos colores. Una vez que ha terminado D. producir, su clientela  compra  muy satisfecha porque conocen D. la calidad D. su trabajo, para el futuro Betty  desea  tener mayor producción. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más materiales para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Betty, age 55, lives with her husband and their five children in her own house.  She has been making beautiful embroideries for 41 years.  Her experience has maD. her more productive in designing new patterns in her embroideries.  Her daughters help her with this work.  Her house is where she established her handicraft workshop.  

What pleases her most about her work is how peaceful she feels.  She also likes the income it produces for her.  She likes it even though it takes approximately a month of work to make one embroidered skirt and the required appliques like sequins and gold or silver threads.  It requires much precision and many colors of thread.  Once she has finished making the item, her customers are very satisfied with their purchase because they know the quality of her work.  In the future Betty wishes to have greater production.

This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments.  She is pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive.  She will use the requested loan to buy more materials for her embroidery.

loans.use: To buy different colors of thread

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Kimaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Yolanda is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food & toothpaste in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk food. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk food

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Client de 43 ans , célibataire avec 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 15 ans. Il a ouvert une papeterie en 2002, quand il finit ses etudes, et ayant prit conscience de ses faibles  revenus qui ne suffisaient pas pour supporter la charge de sa famille et joindre les deux bouts du mois , avec la somme de 150.000rs il achète des cartons de rames, des cahiers et tout ce dont les écoliers ont besoin pour leurs cours.
Avec le prêt qu'on va lui accorder il pense renforcer le stock de sa marchandise, des carons de cahiers, des rames des papiers, des stylos, feutres .
Il a des revenus journaliers de de 20000 a 50000 fr par jour.Tres entreprenant , il veut aller loin dans son activité , prendre soin de sa famille, et faire des benefices énormes pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en plus épargner pour être grossiste dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Richard S. K. is a 43 year old single man with four children aged between 2 and 15 who lives in Brazzaville, Congo. He opened a paper retail store in 2002 after finishing his studies. Having realized that his current revenues are not enough to support his monthly family needs, he is asking for a loan to purchase bulk quantities of printing paper, notebooks, pens and other supplies that students need to attend school. 

He has daily revenues of between 20,000 and 50,000 francs [approximately 21 to 54 USD]. He has a very entrepreneurial spirit and would like to continue with this financial activity in order to take care of his family and provide economic benefit to improve their livelihoods and perhaps even become a wholesale distributer in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies, paper, pens, notebooks

loans.name: Juana Marisol

texts.es:
Juana, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Huancayo y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Juana se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en la empresa LANANDINA, ella fabrica chompas, chalinas, chulos de lana de alpaca. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Juana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal y desea implementar su casa.  

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old and has two children. She was born in the city of Huancayo and lives in the city of Urubamba. Juana works marking handicrafts for the Lanandina company. She makes alpaca wool sweaters and shawls. She has worked there for three years and is doing very well thanks to her hard work. Juana needs a loan for personal use to make improvements to her home.

Juana belongs to the Mainique community bank of the Arariwa Association and is thankful for the opportunity provided to her. She promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: For her home

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai V. is a 56-year-old married woman and a local villager living in Kompong Cham province. She has a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops at least two times a year, according to rainy season and dry season. She and her husband have been getting good results from growing crops. 

They have given birth to four children. All of them are employed in different jobs, and they always share their profits with their parents to use on the daily expenses. Tai V.’s children are concerned because they face difficulties in traveling to their workplace. They always travel to work by hiring a taxi, as they don't have their own vehicle. To encourage her children, Tai V. has requested a loan in the amount of $800 to be used to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her kids to ride to their workplace

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Michel de 30, quien es agricultor, y de sus 2 pequeños hijos Xiomara de 10 y Aldair de 4 años, en un barrio ubicado en la sierra central peruana. Desde muy pequeña miraba como sus padres trabajaban la tierra y se preparaban durante meses para la cosecha. De esta manera aprendió todo lo necesario de las técnicas agrícolas que luego de unos años viene  practicando  en sus chacras, pues  siembra  papa, arvejas y habas en sus tierras. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque lo realiza junto a su esposo, aunque es algo tedioso despertarse todos los días al amanecer, siente que todo su esfuerzo es recompensado cuando recoge toda la cosecha y la vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad a buen precio. Las buenas ganancias le permiten tener una buena calidad de vida y como Felicita siempre se proyecta hacia el futuro, en adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción de arvejas, para continuar comercializando sus productos naturales. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que el trabajo de su grupo va bien ya que todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Felicita tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de habas, además de abono para asegurar sus tierras para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Felicita is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Michel, 30, who is a farmer, and their two small children Xiomara, 10, and Aldair, 4.  They live in a neighborhood in the central mountains of Peru.  Since she was very small she always watched her parents working the land and preparing months ahead for the harvest season.  She learned everything she needed to know about agricultural techniques which she has put to use on her own land where she grows potatos, peas and lima beans. 

She says she enjoys her work because she shares it with her husband.  Even though it is somewhat tedious and means getting up early in the morning, she feels the effort is compensated when harvest time comes and she sells her produce at a good price to the wholesalers in the city.

The high level of earnings allows for a good lifestyle and, since Felicita is always thinking about future projects, she plans to increase her lima bean production so she can continue selling her organic products.  

This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is grateful to all the people lending their support so she can continue working.  She claims the work of the group she is in is going very well and all the members are good about making their payments on time.  Felicita plans to use the loan to buy lima bean seeds and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: To buy lima bean seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, beef, oil, rice, coal, juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ki

texts.en:
Ki C. is a local farmer and also grows fruit on her farm in Prey Chor district. She is married to Mr. Leng Art, 37, who is a fisherman and earns an average profit of $1.50 a day, which helps to share responsibility for the expenses with Ki C.. This couple has given birth to five children:  all of them are single. Two of them are employed, as a worker and a rice farmer. The family owns a medium-size plot of farm land, where they plant jackfruit, banana, and mango trees.
 
Fishing season is approaching and the lakes are full of fish, but the existing boat is broken, and it has affected her husband's fishing activity. Therefore, Ki C. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase a new boat in order to support his business activities. She hopes to use the rest of the loan to repair her old house. Ki C. is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat in order to support her husband's fishing.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, aged 33, is married with three children aged between twelve and five years.

He sells curios in Westlands, Nairobi, and has been doing this business for the last three years, which earns him a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd.  Julius will use the loan funds to buy more curios for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and he hopes to open a business for his wife in the future.

loans.use: to buy more curio stock

loans.name: Las Chicas Del Mirador Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Chicas Del Mirador", porque viven en una loma desD. donD. se ve su comunidad, estan ubicadas en el estado D. México. Verónica es una integrante del grupo, tiene 32 años, tiene 1 hija. Ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta D. colchas, solicitó su préstamo para adquirir más productos y así tener más variedad D. modelos y tamaños para todos los gustos y necesidades D. sus clientes. La señora verónica se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad que le ofrecen para continuar vendiendo e invirtiendo en su negocio. Con las ganancias que obtenga lograr una estabilidad económica en su hogar y poder ahorrar para la educación D. su hija. Es una mujer trabajadora que busca tener una mejor calidad D. vida y la felicidad D. compartirlo con su familia.
texts.en: The “Las Chicas Del Mirador” (The Ladies of the Vantage Point) Communal bank is named that way because they live on a hill where they oversee their community that is located in the state of México. Verónica is 32 years old and has a daughter. She sells bedspreads and needs the loan to get more products to have a greater variety, models and sizes for all the tastes and needs of her customers. Mrs. Verónica feels very happy with the opportunity that she is receiving to keep selling and investing in her business. With her earnings she hopes to have economic stability in her home and to save for her daughter’s education. Verónica is a hardworking woman who hopes for a better quality of life and happiness to share with her family.

loans.use: buy bedspreads for her business.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesús

texts.es: La calle es el lugar donde Orlando tiene su negocio, pues desde hace algunos años se dedica a las ventas ambulantes de dulces en Itagüí Antioquia y aunque ya es conocido en el sector por el que transitan personas que se dirigen hacia sus trabajos, conductores de buses y universitarios, Orlando espera mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, para ello desea agregarle a su negocio frutas, pues considera que así logrará ofrecer más opciones para sus clientes, para ello necesita de un préstamo y así crecer poco a poco y seguir adelante.
texts.en: The street is the place where Orlando has his business.  He has been selling candy as a street vendor in Itagüí Antioquuia and he is known in the area by people, such as bus drivers and university employees, who pass by on their way to work.  Orlando hopes to increase his income so he can improve his quality of life.  He wants to add fruits to his business so that he can offer his customers more options.  For this he needs a loan and in this way he can grow little by little and get ahead.

loans.use: increase his stock and diversify the products he carries.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Sanquira, distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de primaria.
La señora se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de granos de la región como papa, chuño, habas y quinua.  Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en compra de abarrotes. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar veinte arrobas de papa y chuño, éstos productos los compra en Yunguyo y los vende en Desaguadero.  En el negocio la ayuda su esposo, quien  también se dedica a la costura de chamarras, pantalones, y en sus ratos libres es albañil.  Nos cuenta que también tienen algunos chanchos para vender.
Su sueño es comprar más chanchos porque dice que hay buena ganancia.
Le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en: Dominga is a member of the "San Juan de Tahuaco” community bank which is located in the village of Sanquira, in Yunguyo district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department. She is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She has an elementary school level of education. Dominga used to sell groceries. She currently buys and sells grains from her region such as potatoes, 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product), beans and quinoa. Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that loan in buying groceries. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Dominga will use this new loan for 500 soles to increase her business capital, buying twenty 'arrobas' (one 'arroba' = approximately 25 pounds) of potatoes and chuño. She buys these products in Yunguyo and sells them in Desaguadero. Her husband helps her in her business. He also sews jackets and pants. In his free time, he is a construction worker. She tells us that she and her husband also have some pigs that they sell. Dominga's dream is to buy more pigs because she says that she makes a good profit from them. Dominga likes her community bank for the meetings, the ease of obtaining the loans, the punctuality and the responsibility amongst the members.

loans.use: to buy twenty 'arrobas' of potatoes and 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product)

loans.name: Kawama Omunaku Group

texts.en:
The consumption rates of alcohol in Uganda are at an all time high. Alcoholic beverages of all types sell highly, not only in urban areas, but also rural areas where most people live below the breadline. Those who have studied this rising phenomenon made deductions to the effect that most people in Ugandan urban centers are social drinkers. 

The best part of it all is that people usually gather for this drink in the evenings after a hard day's work.

Most Ugandans take the example of 38-year-old Rose in Jinja and have been cashing in as the phenomenon grows. Rose, for example, opened her own pub in the metropolis of Jinja three years ago and the happily married mother of three says it’s been by every inch a worthwhile experience. 

She began this enterprise with capital from her erstwhile general merchandise retail trade. She sells all sorts of alcoholic beverages that she says are in high favor with old and new clients alike.

She says her sales revenue totals up to 100,000 UGX weekly. 

Rose says she is going to use this Kiva loan money to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 33 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos de 4, 6 y 9 años de edad, él es agricultor siembra cada año una manzana de terreno, tiene una larga experiencia en cultivos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono y pesticidas, para el tratamiento del cultivo, permitiéndole tener una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es que a través del cultivo pueda obtener ganancias y poder sustentar las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is 33 years old and is the father of three children, ages 4, 6, and 9.  He is a farmer and plants a plot of land each year, so he has lots of experience with crops.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide to treat his crops.  This will allow him to have a good harvest.

His goal is to produce a good income through his crops and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora cerca de su localidad hay un paraje turístico por sus ruinas arqueológicas y por que muy cerca se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, ella esta casada con el señor Carlos ellos tienen un niño el cual estudia la primaria. Doña Lupita como de cariño le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace seis años, comenta que emprendió su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende sus tortillas a sus vecinos, dice que un día antes pone su nixtamal a coser para al día siguiente llevar al molino el nixtamal para que lo muelan y hagan la masa e irse a hacer sus tortillas a su casa. Dice que hace dos veces al día tortillas en la mañana a las 8 horas y en la tarde a las 2 de la tarde para la hora de la comida. Ella pidió un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de maíz, cal, leña para hacer sus tortillas, también comenta que los fines de semana vende antojitos mexicanos por la noche como tostadas, pozole, tacos dorados, enchiladas etc. La meta que tiene doña Lupita es poner un puesto de antojitos mexicanos afuera de una primaria a diario para tener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a very hard working woman.  Near her place is a tourist spot where there are archaeological ruins and nearby a Monarch butterfly sanctuary.  She is married to Señor Carlos and they have a son who is in primary school.  

Doña Lupita, as her friends affectionately call her, has been selling tortillas for six years.  She says she started her business to help her husband with household expenses. She sells her tortillas to her neighbors. She says the day before she cooks her nixtamal (corn treated with lime) for the following day, she takes it to the mill to be ground and made into dough so that she can return home to make her tortillas. She notes that she makes tortillas twice a day, in the morning at 8 a.m. and in the afternoon at 2 p.m., for mealtimes. 

She requested a loan from FRAC for the purchase of corn, lime and firewood to make her tortillas. She added that on weekends she also sells Mexican snacks at night like tostadas, pozole (hominy soup), tacos dorados (deep fried tacos), enchiladas, etc. Doña Lupita’s goal is to set up a stand selling Mexican snacks everyday outside a primary school  in order to earn a little more income.

loans.use: to sell homemade tortillas.

loans.name: Betty Beatriz

texts.es:
Betty es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 17 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio venta de artesanías y venta de pescado, invertirá exclusivamente en mallas para la pesca, bayetas y lanas  de diferentes colores para sus bordados.  Nos cuenta que  trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia y mejorar su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 17 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. Betty has a high school education.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. Betty is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 PEN and will invest the money in her businesses of selling handicrafts and selling fish. Her loan will be invested exclusively in fishing nets, as well as cloth and wool in different colors for her embroideries. Betty says that she and her husband work together.

Her dream is to own a home and improve her business. What she likes most about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and interest she earns from the savings.

loans.use: to acquire cloth and wool for making embroideries and to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell chicken

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2  años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una ferretería.
 
Es una ama de casa muy luchadora y trabadora que para ganarse algo propio y contribuir con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende de ropa de todo tipo y joyería de plata, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También trabaja en un  almacén de venta de ropa en el centro de la ciudad por lo que recibe un sueldo mensual, nos cuenta que  ella aprovecha sus momentos libres y por las noches para realizar sus ventas. Trabaja todos los días desde las  8h00  hasta las 18h00 en su trabajo y más tarde en sus propias ventas, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 4 años se dedica a su negocio y  10 años a su empleo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén de ropa.

En la fotografía está nuestra socia con su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" Communal Bank meet every two week in the Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo which is the capital of Manabí.   Portoviejo has been well-known for a long time as "The CIty of the Royal Tamarinds".  

This is where Señora Jessenia lives.  She is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has three children aged 10, 7 and 2.  The two eldest attend primary school.  Her husband works in a hardware store.

Jessenia manages the home, and works very hard and strives to earn something herself and contribute to the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothes and silver jewelry, which she sells door to door.   She works in a clothes store in the city center, where she receives a monthly salary.  She tells us that she takes advantage of her free time and does her selling in the evenings.  She works every day from 8 a.m. through to 6 p.m. in her job, and then works later still with her own sales.  She provides credit to her customers, and collects payment every two weeks.  She has had her business for four years, and has been working in her job for the last ten years.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.  She has been in the Communal Bank since it began, and she likes the benefits that the bank offers.

Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

The photograph shows our member, with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old. She is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling sugar and soda in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more soda for sale. She says that with the extra income from this loan, she will pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soda for sale.

loans.name: Sivanila

texts.en:
Sivanila owns and operates a business venture producing flavored drinks to local communities. She is 27 years of age and married with four children. Sivanila has two years of experience in this business. 

Sivanila needs a loan of 1,500 tala to purchase large coolers for storage of drinks and sacks of sugar. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 295 tala or US $140 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sivanila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sivanila 's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase large coolers and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma  is 43 years old.  She is a single mother with 4 children.  Gemma is now engaged in making and selling charcoal from coconut husks.  She has had this business for almost a year. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for the laborer who made the charcoal. Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the labor in making charcoal from coconut husks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 33-year-old lady married to Saul, a 35-year-old man. Maria and Saul adopted a little girl named Marsella from her relatives. Marsella, who is 10, is studying at the 3rd grade in Elementary School. 

In order to meet their family needs, Maria’s husband runs an electronics (e.g. television, radio, tape recorder etc) repair shop business. As the income generated from the business is unstable, Maria took the initiative to sell gasoline in front of her house to support her husband in meeting their family needs. She has been running the business for almost five years. 

Maria intends to add more gasoline for her business after she saw the opportunity to serve people who do not have time to stand in line at the gasoline station, particularly in the morning when they should go to work and school. It would allow her business product to be sold out quickly. 

This situation led her to seek a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase more gasoline to sell. She hopes that TLM will assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia settled into marriage when she was 23 years old. She did not finish her college education and did not seek employment. She involved herself in rice farming to generate an income. She inherited this hectare plot of land from her parents. She has been cultivating it for almost two years and earns 10,000 PHP each harvest season during the month of April and November. 

Celia is now 28 years old, has two children and is married to a truck driver. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for land cultivation and to buy pesticides and herbicides used in farming. She needs to improve her crop production, and hiring laborers for land cultivation is an additional expense for her. 

In the future, Celia would like to achieve a plentiful harvest every season to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and buy pesticides and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 55 years old and is married to Jasper, who is a businessman. The couple is blessed with three children, ages 24, 26, and 30. Violet is a businesswoman who has run a medical clinic for the past ten years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES which she uses to support her family. She was introduced to KADET by a staff member. 

Violet is requesting her first loan with KADET to buy clinic equipment. With the anticipated profit from her loan she will expand the clinic. Violet’s hopes and dreams are to open a maternity clinic.

loans.use: to buy clinic equipment

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 52-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has children.

Jose has been a farmer for 20 years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earned 3000 PHP per month with his last cropping. Jose works hard to sustain his family. 
He requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farming requirements and hopes to expand his farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farming requirements

loans.name: Beatrice Rama

texts.en: Beatrice Rama  is a hair dresser and also sells banku. Beatrice's husband is a security officer and has 3 children. She has been in this business for 7 years. Beatrice uses her income to support her hushand in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be use to purchase more hair kits and maize for the preparation of the banku. Beatrice will expand her salon with the profits.

loans.use: purchase more hair kits and maize for the preparation of the banku.

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Wulaymatu.  She is married to a mechanic & businessman, and has 3 children, aged 13 years, 4 years, and 4 months.  Two of her children are going to school.   

In 2008, Wulaymatu established her business selling baby diapers, pants, towels, babywear and wrappers.  She began her business because when her father died she was brought up by her stepmother who did not think it wise to see her through school.  She taught herself this business, which has been her source of income ever since.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,961,000 every month from her business. 

Wulaymatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 previous loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy children's jeans (2 dozens @ Le400,000), jeans skirts (2 dozen @ Le450,000), babywear (4 dozen @ Le250,000),  and blouses (3 dozens @ Le300,000).  The balance of 400,000 will be used for transport and other costs.   She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 490,000. 

In the future, Wulaymatu plans to open a well-secured shop where she can display her large stock.  She also wants to build a house and give her children a good education. She hopes to access more help in terms of loans for her business, as it is her only source of generating income.  The rain  is a major factor for her because her stall is not well covered.  The competition is high, but she always has a regular supply of goods that customers demand.  She serves people around the town, about 20 per day.  She treats her customers fairly and respects their wishes.  Her suppliers are located in Freetown where she travels three times per month, and Conakry where she goes once every month by public vehicle.  She saves some of  the income and uses the rest to buy more goods for her business.  She is hard working and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: jeans wears for children - 2 dozen @ Le400,000, jean skirt - 2 dozen @ Le450,000 baby wears - 4 dozen @ Le250,000 and blouses - 3 dozen @ Le300,000

loans.name: Ivine

texts.en: Ivine is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children whose ages range from two years to four years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes, mangoes, kale, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery store. She will use the Kes 5,000 loan to buy more cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes, kale, etc. Ivine's business goal is to run a bigger grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more kale, cabbages, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a hotel. She earns approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $7 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Houn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store for her daughter to generate more income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Francisco Arnulfo

texts.es: Don Francisco tiene 59 años y es un señor muy trabajador que junto a su amada esposa dio crecer a seis hijos, los cuales ahora todos ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su única fuente de ingreso es el taxi con el que presta su servicio en la ciudad de Managua, capital de Nicaragua. El vehículo ya tiene ciertos años y don Francisco necesita componer aunque sea poco a poco según las fallas mecánicas que está presentando. No tiene suficiente dinero para sustituirlo por un carro nuevo, así que las reparaciones son la única manera de asegurar su fuente de ingreso y el pan diario de él y su esposa. Para ahora necesita el préstamo para poder cambiar las llantas, los amortiguadores y las puertas para que el taxi vuelva a estar en condiciones seguras para los pasajeros.

loans.use: Don Francisco solicita el préstamo porque necesita reparar su unidad de taxi el cual es el único sustento para su hogar, así espera brindar buenas condiciones a los clientes.

loans.name: Fdg-90 Group

texts.en:
Nayamat  is 50 years old having 10 family members. He lives in Maraliwala a native village in District Gujranwala, Pakistan.He is standing in the middle of this picture by raising holding a register in his hands. He works in his Agri fields to earn the family's living with plenty of activities, including cultivating rice, wheat and vegetables. 
He is using modern agriculture techniques to boost his Income. He has done soil testing, water testing & laser leveling in his field to increase his per acre yield from 200-250 Kgs. He is requesting KIVA to grant loan to his group Fdg-90 Group for purchasing Agri Inputs like Quality Seeds, Diesel, Fertilizer & pesticides for their rice crop. After availing this loan from KIVA his profit margin will increase and his family life style will be improved.
They are grateful to KIVA & JWS and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizers, pesticide, seeds and diesel etc.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en: As a mother of five lovely angels, Flomena's great desire is to see her children grow to become professionals. It is what encourages Flomena and fills her with enthusiasm. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past twelve years. On her farm, she grows maize, has dairy cows, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns. Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. Flomena is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Flomena is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Flomena hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people like Kiva lenders who support smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow

loans.name: Romel

texts.en: Romel is 31 years old, single and lives in Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Romel owns and operates a transportation transport service to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income aside from working in a private company. After his work, he does transportation services to earn . Recently, he took a new loan of 30,000.00 to buy tires and repair his motorcycle to commute between his work and in other village in town. His future plan is to buy another unit of motor for expansion of his business.

loans.use: To buy motor accesories and tires.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is widow with nine children.

She has been doing grocery business for very long time.

Village Enterprise Fund gave her a donation of 100 dollars in the year 2001.

She has undergone training for the beneficiaries organised by VEF.

She is capable to use and refund the loan. Given a loan of 300 dollars, she plans to expand her business by buying the following items: - cooler for her green vegetables than can go bad e.g. tomatoes, onions, cabbages, fresh beans and peas.

We have some coolers in Uganda that you can give kerosene. You light it and it is just like a deep freezer. It is very inexpensive. She has started a shop and she is going to put the cooler in her shop. These coolers are imported from Dubai and they usually cost $75-100.

Other items that she will be selling are Irish potatoes, sweat potatoes, yams, passion fruits, pineapples, paw paws etc.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and a cooler to keep them fresh.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia has a newspaper and magazine stand, located in the town where she lives, Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. She started the business in 1987 with her ex-husband, and they were able to grow a lot, and have six more stands. However, some time ago they got a divorce and she kept only one stand, while her ex-husband kept all the others. Thanks to her eagerness to get ahead and her love for her kids, she worked very hard and achieved her goals. Currently, one of her kids has his own newspaper stand, and all the kids have received professional education.

The struggle has not been easy, since she’s had to make her workday go from 4 a.m. to 9 p.m. She is currently requesting a loan of US$750 to buy larger quantities for delivery to other stores, and increase her sales that way. Don’t hesitate any longer, help Silvia. She sincerely thanks you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia tiene un puesto de periódico y venta de revistas, ubicado en la localidad donde vive, Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Ella inició el negocio en 1987, junto con su ex esposo, logrando crecer mucho, pues llegaron a tener 6 puestos más, sin embargo hace tiempo se divorciaron y ella se quedó sólo con uno de los puestos, mientras que su entonces esposo se quedo con todos los demás. Pero gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante y al amor a sus hijos, trabajó arduamente y logro sus objetivos. Hoy en día uno de sus hijos tiene su propio puesto de periódico y todos recibieron educación profesional.

La lucha no ha sido fácil, dado que ella ha tenido que hincar su jornada de trabajo desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 750 DLLS para la compra de un mayor volumen para entrega a otros negocios y así incrementar sus ventas. No lo dude más, ayuda a Silvia, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Madame Mary sells firewood in her community through her business, Mary's Firewood. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana V. M. is 40 years old and she and her husband have a carpentry business, making furniture for people in a remote village of northern Guatemala where they live. Juana and her husband came to an agreement to use this loan to purchase three horses which will be used to carry and deliver the tables that they make in their business.

The family's dream is to build a better house than the simple adobe one they currently live in.

Juana is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase three horses to help in the carpentry shop

loans.name: Reynaldo Salvador

texts.es:
Reynaldo is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example.

About 15 years ago, Reynaldo decided to start his own business selling cheese at the local market in Chinandega, which he did with $325 in start-up capital he saved from working in an auto body shop. Reynoldo's relationship with CEPRODEL has been fruitful for his business, allowing him to grow it and make improvements to the site. Currently he sells about $810 of goods each day. Thanks to his hard work and determination he has been able to purchase his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Reynaldo M. es un hombre esforzado que ha luchado para sostener a su familia y darles educación a sus hijos, los cuales hoy en día son hombres y mujeres trabajadores gracias al ejemplo de su padre.

Desde hace alrededor de quince años decide poner su propio negocio de venta de queso en el mercado EL BISNE ubicado en el departamento de Chinandega, el cual empieza con un capital de inversión US$325.00, mismos que venía ahorrando con mucho sacrificio cuando laboraba en un taller automotriz de pintura. La experiencia de Reynaldo con CEPRODEL ha sido fructífera para su negocio ya que ha logrado crecer y realizar mejoras en su local. Actualmente vende alrededor de US$810.00 diarios. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado comprar su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina is a hardworking and exemplary mother. Her husband abandoned her and her young children 8 years ago. Since then she has worked in different jobs to take care of her treasured children, who are her motivation every day. Today, she works as a cleaning woman in a government office in her native city of Juliaca. She works hard at this job from 7 at night until 2 in the morning. In addition to this work, she also creates handicrafts made of wool to help generate more income for her family. She puts in long hours making them and then sells them around the bus terminal. She is getting a lot of satisfaction and happiness from this work, and she would like to grow the business. She is requesting a loan to buy different colors of wool to continue making her beautiful pieces, selling more and improving the quality of life for her children. Melina kindly requests your support in helping provide for her family's wellbeing.

Melina es una esforzada y ejemplar madre, su esposo la l abandonó junto a sus pequeños niños hace ocho años; desde entonces trabajó en diversas actividades con el fin de sacar adelante a sus tesoros, quienes motivan su esfuerzo día a día.Actualmente esta laboriosa madre trabaja como personal de limpieza en una oficina gubernamental de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, desempeña diariamente esta noble labor desde las 7:00 de la noche hasta las 2:00 de la mañana, adicionalmente encontró en la elaboración de bellas chompitas otra manera de generar ingresos económicos para su hogar, dedicándose a tejer durante largas horas para luego ofrecerlos en forma ambulatoria en el terminal de buses interprovinciales. Ésta actividad que desempeña muy eficientemente le está otorgando mucha satisfacción y alegría y desea seguir prosperando con este oficio. Para eso solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar coloridas lanas para seguir fabricando sus hermosos trabajos y así ofrecerles una mejor solvencia económica a sus queridos hijos. Melina muy gentilmente solicita tu apoyo para seguir brindándole bienestar a su querida familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE DIFFERENT COLOR WOOLS TO CONTINUE MAKING HER BEAUTIFUL CRAFTS.

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en:
I am a widow Sardaran B. from Multan, a midsize city in Pakistan. I am a mother of two girls both of whom are above 18. I work very hard to provide for my family. 

I buy various scrap items and sell them in different cities. I need a loan of $250 to buy scrap items such as iron objects, steel bits, and pieces in bulk for the business. This way I will be able to sell more on every visit to a different city. The man in the photo is my brother. Since I am a widow, I have engaged him to help me out with my business. I am needy and hope you will not turn down my loan request.

loans.use: Buy scrap items

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a 22 year old man who lives with his parents and two younger brothers. It has been two years since he opened a tire store where he also sells new and used tires.

He hopes that in this business he is able to save and have enough to have a family in the future. Carlos is asking for a loan so that he may buy bigger quantities of used tires in order to fix them to sell. With a greater amount of tires he will increase his sales and better his income.

loans.use: To buy more tires.

loans.name: Mahofah North D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamawa M.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Jamawa is 29 years old and is single. Each week, Jamawa makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Margret N. and Monica B.. Margret N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy more cloth fabrics and materials. Monica B. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa Leonidas' Group

texts.es:
Lizette, Rosa and Albina have belonged to the Violeta community bank for 4 months, 15 years and 12 years respectively.

Lizette lives with her partner, is 21 years old and is expecting her first child. Lizette and her husband make hand-crafted bricks in the community of Huayllapampa, which is 30 minutes outsiD. the city of Ayacucho.

Rosa is a widow, 67 years old and has 9 children, 5 of whom live with her. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit.

Albina is married, 60 years old and has 8 children, 4 of whom live with her. Albina and her husband make hand-crafted bricks in the community of Huayllapampa. Additionally, Albina sells food on Sundays.

Lizette, Rosa and Albina need loans to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, pastas, potatoes and meat, and to pay their unskilled laborers.

Lizette, Rosa and Albina´s hopes are that their children become professionals, that their businesses improve and to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lizette, Rosa y Albina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Violeta hace 4 meses, 15 años, 12 años respectivamente.

Lizette es conviviente, tiene 21 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Lizette junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa que queda a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Rosa es viuda, tiene 67 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 5 viven con ella, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa, donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas.

Mientras que Albina es casada, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Albina junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa. Además Albina venD. comida los días domingos.

Lizette, Rosa y Albina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, fideo, papa, carne y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Lizette, Rosa y Albina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, que su negocio mejore y tener más capital.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as milk, rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, pastas, potatoes and meat, and make payments to unskilled laborers.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angela A. C. has a business selling shoes and small gifts at the Mercado Victoria in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. Angela has 4 years of experience selling in the market and had other small businesses before this current one. She now has many loyal customers.

Angela is 45 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents and works hard to take care of them. Her dream is to save enough money to buy her own stand in the market.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Angela is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN ($525) to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her stand with her best selling items.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her stand in the market with her best selling items.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. He is married and has 3 children. One of his children is in secondary school, and the other two are studying in primary school. They live in a rented house. He has an old taxi. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new engine and new tires and renovate the car in order to increase his income and save for a better future for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new engine and new tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 20 cases of beer

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique is a 38 year old father of one. He is single, and his son lives with his mother in Lima. He makes and sells charcoal, and most of his earnings go to support his son so that he can complete his university studies (like every father Luis Enrique dreams with the possibility of his son completing his university studies, and he knows that college is not cheap). Charcoal making is an activity that can be inconvenient for most people that live around the area, and with a reason. In order to avoid problems and arguments with his neighbors, Luis Enrique wants to rent his own space for his business (where he can make charcoal and attend his customers), and that is the reason why he is asking for a loan so that he can afford these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Luis Enrique es un padre de 38 años de edad, el no está casado, por lo que vive separado de su hijo de 8 años que vive con su mamá en la ciudad de Lima. Su trabajo consiste en la elaboración y venta de carbón, de cuyas ganancias separa el mayor porcentaje para enviarlo a Lima para los gastos de su hijo, que como todo padre sueña con que pueda completar estudios universitarios, y él sabe que la universidad no es barata.La fabricación de carbón puede resultar molesta para las personas que viven en las zonas aledañas a donde se fabrica, y con razón.Por ello, para no tener problemas y discusiones con sus vecinos, Luis Enrique quiere alquilar un local apropiado para la fabricación del carbón y para la atención de sus clientes, y para ello recurre a ustedes, solicitando un préstamo que pueda ayudar a solventar estos gastos.

loans.use: To rent an appropriate place for the making and selling of charcoal.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has two grown children. She runs a small business selling leather clothing, such as jackets, coats and vests, in one of the city markets. Her clothing sale business is successful. Irina has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $6,000. Her monthly net profit is about $700.  

Irina would like to get a loan of 1500 Grivnas to increase her working capital. We believe her natural ability to please her customers, guessing their needs and offering speedy and courteous service, will help Irina achieve her goals, sustain her success and consequently win the entrepreneurial game.  

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in one month.

loans.use: To expand her trade

loans.name: Louch

texts.en: Louch C., 35, is a construction foreman and is able to make around US$7 each day. His wife, Long Sinoeurn, is a farm worker raising pigs for sale. On average, she makes around US$2 each day. This couple together has two children and all of them are students. Mr. Louch is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more pigs for his wife. (Long is pictured outside of her home.)

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for his wife.

loans.name: Elena Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Margarita, es una persona muy humilD., trabaja con nosotros desD. que iniciaba su pequeño negocio, vive con sus cuatro hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, con la ayuda del esposo, que es empleado publico sacan adelante a sus hijos, con mucho cariño, desD. muy temprano se dedica a preparar los alimentos para el almuerzo diario, felizmente, según ella misma indica tiene unas hijas mayores quienes en sus momentos libres colaboran en la cocina y en algunos casos en la atención D. los clientes, los cuales son muy regulares, actualmente se encuentra muy felíz D. recibir ayuda D. los prestatarios D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Margarita is a very humble person who has worked with us since she started her small business. She lives with her four children who can be found studying in school. With the help of her husband, who is a public employee, they try to help get their children ahead with much care. From early in the morning, she dedicates herself to lunch food preparation, happily, as she indicates that her older daughters are able to help her out in their spare time. They collaborate with her in the kitchen and, in some instances, also help serve the customers who are there regularly. Currently, she finds herself quite happy to receive help from Kiva loans.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of provisions.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 44 años de edad, es separado, tiene 2 hijos que viven con su madre, y él aporta mensualmente para sus gastos. Su única actividad ha sido la agricultura, desde niño trabajó en sembríos de papa, cuando se enamoró de la que fue su esposa se fue a la selva y cambio su ritmo de trabajo en la chacra, desde entonces se dedica a las plantaciones de frutos cítricos, como la naranja, en un inicio trabaja como peón junto a su esposa, ahora desde su  separación, hace 5 años él se solo se prepara sus alimentos y luego se va a su chacra. Particularmente, empezó a plantar plátano y cítricos, de los cuales ahora ya está cosechando, le está yendo bien, esta temporada ha sido baja, pero los próximos meses mejorará, nos dice. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar 30 sacos de guano orgánico para que pueda abonar su chacra, todo le costará un aproximado 450 soles, ya que cada saco está 15 soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old, separated and has two children that live with his mother. He supports them by contributing to cover their monthly expenses. His only job has been in agriculture. When he was a child he worked in the potato fields. When he met the woman who would become his wife he went to the jungle to change his work routine from that of the farm. Since then he has worked on plantations of citric fruits like oranges. In the beginning he worked as a laborer alongside his wife. Now, since their separation five years ago, he prepares his meals himself and then goes to work on his farm. In particular, he started planting bananas and citric fruits that he is now harvesting and things are going very well for him. This season has been slow but he says the next few months will be better. This is his first loan with MFP. WIth the money he is requesting he is going to buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizer for his farm. In total it will cost 450 soles because each sack costs 15 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Mrs. Soth S. is a farmer in Boeng Veang village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Soth S. is 57 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is a farmer who helps on his mother's plantation. Her husband, Mr. Vorn Art, owns an electric plow which is hired by the other villagers to plow their fields. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a massage table

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es: El señor Juan Fernando y su esposa la señora Hilda Silvia tienen dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, pero tiene un problema en este momento, no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes de la escuela. El señor Juan trabaja desde hace más de 20 años como empleado general y este trabajo representa su principal fuente de ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia, él solicita este préstamo debido a que su sueldo es bajo y no puede cubrir esta necesidad ya que en la escuela les están exigiendo los útiles y uniformes de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Fernando and his wife Hilda Silvia have two children who are beginning their studies at school, but they have a problem. Right now, they do not have enough money to buy the necessary school materials and uniforms. Juan has worked for over 20 years as a general employee and this job is his principal means of income.
