He uses this income to take care of his family. He is requesting this loan because his salary is low and he can not cover for the required school materials and uniforms for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school materials and uniforms for his children

loans.name: Ami Edzodzinam

texts.fr: Cette dame  habite le quartier d’adidogomé, elle est mariée et n’a pas d’enfants, elle  fait le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle fait ce commerce deuis 2006 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock de marchandise pour mieux satisfaire la demande par l’achat des articles de mercerie, c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un prêt de 500000F.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Adidogomé district; she is married and has no children. She sells sewing notions, a business she has been in since 2006. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé. She would like to expand her inventory of merchandise and that is why she is requesting a loan of 500,000 F from WAGES.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es socio del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Nelson es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Nelson se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para quemar el ladrillo alquila hornos, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Nelson se dedica a la crianza de los cuyes. 
Nelson necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Nelson sueña con tener un carro para repartir sus productos y progresar mas.
texts.en:
Nelson is a member of the communal bank "Los Ladrilleros", located in the community of Compañía which is 40 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho. Nelson lives with his wife. He is 29 years old and has one child. Nelson makes a living by making handmade bricks. To bake the bricks, Nelson rents ovens. He sells his bricks in the community that he lives in. Furthermore, Nelson makes money by raising guinea pigs to sell. Neslon needs a loan of $400 (1,250 Soles) that he will use to buy firewood for the ovens. Nelson dreams of owning a car to sell his product outside of his community and to make a better life for himself and his family.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs.Lydia V., 53 years old, married and a resident of P9 Bongabong St., Catadman, Ozamiz City, is an active member of PDP-LP of Paglaum MPC-Ozamiz City. She has four children: one is in college, another one is already employed and the rest are still looking for a job.

Mrs. V., as a micro-entrepreneur, started her business in 1998. She engaged in the buying and selling of bananas and a little sari-sari store with starting capital from a lending institution. On January 12th, 2006, she joined Paglaum MPC and showed us her strong leadership in her group as Center Officer. Now on its 7th cycle, she is applying for the amount of P10,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store - firewood and vegetable vending.

Mrs. V. is hoping that someday she can own a residential lot through her efforts, with God’s guidance and financing from Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items, vegetables & firewood for sale

location.town: Ozamis-P9 Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años vende verduras en un mercado de la zona central de la ciudad donde vive, todas las mañanas, con la ayuda de su esposo, carga la mercadería que transporta hacia el mercado, luego se dedica, durante todo el día, a ofrecer sus productos, con un buen trato a las personas, verduras de calidad y un precio justo, lo que le garantizará el retorno de sus clientes. Vilma cuida bastante la presentación de sus productos, ya que de eso dependen sus ventas y ese ritmo de trabajo la hace sentir muy satisfecha, porque este negocio es un pilar en el sostenimiento de su hogar. Para más adelante, Vilma desea tener un puesto en el mercado amplio y propio donde pueda ofrecer toda clase y variedad de verduras. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por ser parte de su banco comunal, porque es un espacio de crecimiento personal y empresarial, por ello se compromete a seguir trabajando por el bienestar en común.Vilma está solicitando este préstamo para comprar más verduras al por mayor, y otra parte para pagar el transporte al mercado.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. She has sold vegetables for ten years at a market in the center of the city where she lives. Each morning she loads the merchandise to take to the market with her husbands help. Then she works all day offering her products while treating people well. Good quality vegetables at a fair price is what guarantees that her customers return. Vilma presents her products nicely since her sales depend on it. She is very happy with the rhythm of work because this business is a pillar that her house stands on. Later on Vilma would like to have a large stall of her own at the market where she could offer all types and varieties of vegetables. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). She is very thankful to be part of her community bank because it’s a place to grow personally and professionally. She is committed to continue working for the common good. Vilma is applying for this loan to purchase more vegetables at wholesale and partly to pay for transportation to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum S. is 43 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. Since 2006, she has been selling fish in the market and makes US$15 in revenue per day. Her husband is a taxi driver. On average, he makes US$10 to US$20 in revenue a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are students. Mrs. Oum would like to take out a loan to replace an old taxi for her husband. The old one needs many repairs and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old taxi.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanessa D. Sánchez tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Karla tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta y compra de bolsas plásticas y verduras. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Karla inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, ya que siempre le ha gustado y con el tiempo fue incrementando sus productos. Es por eso que el propósito de Karla es invertir cada día en su negocio. Y así solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo en la compra de bolsas plásticas y verduras. Sus deseos son de obtener un lugar que sea propio y acondicionarlo humildemente.
texts.en:
Karla Vanessa D. S. is 28 years old and unmarried. Karla has 4 children, and for the past 9 years she has bought and sold plastic bags and vegetables to make a living. She started this business on her own, since she has always liked selling things, and with time she has been able to increase her sales volume. It is to this end that Karla is going to invest every day in her business. She is asking for a loan to finance the purchase of more plastic bags and vegetables. Her dreams are to have a place that is her own and to fix it up, however modestly.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags and vegetables

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
S. HoàngThị (214030892) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, S. owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. S. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Akinlade

texts.fr:
Cet homme très dynamique a ouvert une boutique de prêt-à-porter en 1999, il vend des vêtements pour hommes. il dispose d’une clientèle fidèle, beaucoup de personnes aiment ses marchandises car elles sont de qualité. Voulant aménager sa boutique avec de nouveaux modèles de vêtements, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 40 chemises hommes de nouvelle qualité et de nouveaux modèles de chaussures.
il est marié et père d’1 enfant.
texts.en:
This is a very energetic man who opened a ready-to-wear store in 1990. He sells men's clothing and has a faithful clientele, many people likes his clothes since they are of quality. Eager to supply his store with the latest clothing styles, he's seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 40 men's shirts of new quality, as well as new shoe models. He's married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 men's shirts and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up and sell palm nuts

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa K. is a villager in Ta Saum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

On her plantation, she faces an obstacle because she has always hired a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. Instead, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to use them to reduce her expense of plowing her field.

Her husband, Mr. Phan Sort, is a traditional-medicine seller. This couple has two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband and a child are shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and to reduce the expense of plowing her field

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 39 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks. She lives in Ibadan Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Cerafina Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Cerafina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos (solo uno esta a su cargo), estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en el Barrio Asunción Jr. Zepita 444.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando golosinas para su negocio. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, etc. Cerafina compra sus productos en Puno y Desaguadero y los vende en su puesto del mercado en Juli.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y ampliar su casa construyendo un segundo piso.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los desembolsos.
texts.en:
Sra. Cerafina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children (only 1 is still a dependent). She has a 2nd grade education and lives in the neighborhood of Asunción Jr. Zepita 444.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy candy for her business.

At the moment, she is requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, cheese flavored snacks, etc. Cerafina purchases her products in Puno and Desaguadero and sells them from her stall in the Juli Market. She dreams of improving her business and expanding her house by adding a second floor.

She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and her loan disbursements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, cheese flavored snacks, etc.

loans.name: Eva Isabel

texts.es: Dona Eva Isabel R. T. cuenta con 40 años de edad es casada vive con su familia se dedica a la artesanía elaborando delantales típicos teniendo cinco años a esta actividad por los recursos que vive actualmente no son suficientes para poder compra más materia prima por la necesidad se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo para poder cumplir la demanda de sus clientes que actualmente atiende, aprovechando el mejoramiento de su capital de trabajo para poder seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Eva Isabel R. T. is 40 years old and married. She has been making traditional aprons by hand for five years. Her current resources are insufficient to support her living expenses, so she has approached the offices of Asociación ASDIR in order to request a loan. She plans to buy more materials so that she can meet the demands of the customers she currently serves. Doña Eva hopes to take advantage of this operating capital so that she can fuel the growth of her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more materials

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose Luis es un joven cliente que trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, tiene 4 hijos los cuales pidieron salir en la foto a excepción de la hija mayor ya que le daba vergüenza. Una vez que Jose Luis enviudo se traslado a vivir a una casa que le fue cedida por sus ex suegros, esto debido a que dos de sus hijos son del primer matrimonio. Cuando la esposa estaba viva atendía un local donde se vendía comida el lugar estaba instalado en su mismo domicilio, ahora Jose Luis dadas las circunstancia vio por conveniente instalar un bar en una zona estratégica de la ciudad. Jose Luis en la actualidad convive con la Magali con quien tuvo 2 hijos.  Jose Luis es muy trabajador y están muy esperanzados en que su nuevo negocio tenga éxito. Lo bueno es que no hay otra competencia cerca y hay muchos talleres y tiendas cercanos que esperan sean sus clientes. El crédito solicitado fue para comprar una rockola pero no les alcanzo ya que el alquiler que les cobraron por adelantado le resto mucho del dinero por lo que alquilaran uno. Jose Luis es un buen cliente de Agrocapital quien cancela sus cuotas con mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is a young client who works as an employee of a private company. He has four children. All of them asked to be in the photo with the exception of his oldest daughter; she was embarrassed. Once Jose Luis became a widower he moved to live in a house that was given to him by his ex in-laws. This is because two of his children are from his first marriage. When his wife was alive she managed a place where she sold food. It was set up in his own home. Now, given the circumstances, Jose Luis saw that it would be convenient to set up a bar in a strategic area of the city. Jose Luis currently lives with Magali. They have two children. Jose Luis is very hard-working, and they are very hopeful that his new business will be successful. The good thing is that there is no competition nearby, and there are lots of shops and stores that are close. They hope these people from these places will be their customers. The loan he asked for was to buy a jukebox, but it was not enough. The rent they charged ahead of time took much of the money, so they rented one. Jose Luis is a good client of Agrocapital. He makes his payments very punctually and responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a jukebox

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr:
Madame Aida N.  s est pendant cinq ans spécialises  dans la vente de produits cosmétiques .Cependant selon les événements elle oriente son activité vers la demande de la clientèle.C est ce qui explique qu elle s'adonne a la vente d articles scolaires a cause de   louverture des classes. Elle habite non loin de la caisse de  Camberene  une localité qui se situe au nord de Dakar .Elle assiste beaucoup son mari dans l entretien de  ses deux enfants.par conséquent  le prêt  qu’  elle sollicite va lui permettre d augmenter son fond de roulement ce qui lui permettra d accroitre ses revenus mensuels de 10 000 frs chaque mois est le premier crédit qui lui a été  octroyé  par l U-IMCEC caisse de Camberene.
Madame Aida N.  est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF)  Seydina  Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
For five years, Ms. Aida N. has been specializing in selling cosmetics. However, according to events, she has oriented her business toward customer demands, which explains why she devotes all her time to selling school supplies, since classes have started. She lives near the office in Camberene, a town located north of Dakar. She does a lot to help her husband care for her two children. And so, the loan she’s requesting will enable her to grow her monthly revenues by 10,000 francs each month. This is the first loan allocated to her by the U-IMCEC office of Camberene. Ms. Aida N. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s kickoff in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Rina Olivia

texts.es: Rina Olivia C. D. O. resiD. en El Congo departamento D. Santa Ana ubicado en occidente del país. A sus 50 años D. edad Rina vive solo con su hijo quien ya es mayor D. edad e impediente. Rina es una mujer muy luchadora que ha sobresalido en su negocio por su gran empeño y motivaciones que tiene por seguir adelante en sus ventas, ella maneja un inventario en productos D. ropa, carteras, zapatos y otros, los que sale a vender día a día D. manera ambulante, con gran entusiasmo y fe D. que obtendrá buenas ventas, ella ahora esta decidida a aumentar su inventario y es el motivo por el cual solicita D. tu ayuda a través D. un crédito, que será un gran pilar D. apoyo para Rina.
texts.en:
Rina Olivia C. D. Orozco lives in the El Congo department of Santa Ana, which is located in the western part of the country. At her 50 years of age, Rina lives alone with her son who is an independent adult. Rina is a fighter, and she has succeeded in her business because of her great effort and the motivation that she has to get ahead in her sales. She manages an inventory of products like clothes, purses, shoes, and others. She sells them day to day as a street vendor. She has great enthusiasm and faith that she will get good sales. She has now decided to increase her inventory. That is why she is asking for your help with a loan. It will be a great pillar of support for Rina.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia YOLANDA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. Ella tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más muebles para vender a sus clientes. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank "Mercamueble" and lives in the Imperial City of Cuzco. She is 28 years old and single. She alternates her activities between home and business selling furniture such as desks, armoires, chairs, tables, beds, etc. She has a furniture stand in the "Mercamuebles" market, located in the first location stop in the San Sebastian district, in the Cuzco province. She's being selling furniture for several years and it has gone very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. Yolanda is requesting a loan to increase her business capital to buy furniture. She wants to buy more furniture to sell to her clients. She appreciates the opportunity offered by means of this loan and promises to make the payments corresponding to the timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to buy wood furniture to sell in market

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta E. is from the village of Bonfal Proper, in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Violeta is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and other products in the local community. Violeta has owned her general store for over 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old, married without children.  She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports the home. She sells medicine to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her customers are usually residents and friends. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Morgiane

texts.fr: Née le 17 Avril 1979, G. Morgiane est mariée à DANVIKPENON André et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Hêvié dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi au Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Morgiane n'a fait que l'école primaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Morgiane mène comme activité, la vente de maïs au marché de Gbégamey à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Morgiane vend des fruits. Morgiane s'approvisionne à Parakou, dans le Nord du Bénin. L'activité de Morgiane lui génère de revenu qu'elle utilise pour la développer davantage et pour venir en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille. Morgiane est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant bénéficié autrefois de trois crédits auprès de l'institution. Morgiane a bien remboursé les trois crédits. Malgré la passion qu'elle a pour son activité, Morgiane ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens pouvant lui permettre de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Pour ce fait, Morgiane sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on April 17, 1979, Ms. G. Morgiane is married to Mr. DANVIKPENON André and is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  The family lives in Hêvié, in the community of Abomey Calavi, in Benin.  Together, the couple ensures that family responsibilities are met. Morgiane attended primary school only.  For ten years, she has been running a business selling corn at the Gbégamey market in Cotonou.  Aside from this work, she sells fruit.  She stocks up in Parakou, in northern Benin.  Her business generates the revenues she uses to develop it further and to help out her husband where it concerns family expenses.  She is a previous ALIDé client having benefited in the past from three loans from this micro-finance institution.  She has repaid all three loans.  Despite the passion she has for her work, Morgiane doesn't have enough funds available to enable her to bolster her business further and to satisfy customer demands.  In order to do so, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn P. is a 40-year-old hardworking mother who dreams of having a denture. Anyhow, she feels so insecure about her looks especially when she deals with her customers. That is why, with the loan she is requesting for the first time through ASHI, she will try her best to grow her fish selling business to be able to have more profit so that she can afford a denture.

Aside from that, Analyn also wishes to invest in raising farm animals someday to supplement the proceeds of her fish-selling business and to have the capability to send four of her children, aged from 7 to 14 years old, to college. Her two eldest children, who are from 18 to 20 years old, chose not to continue their education and help her earn money instead.

Fernando, Analyn’s husband, is a fisherman and a source of Analyn’s fish for selling, in addition to the volume she buys from other fisher folk in their village.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Julia Catalina C. G., vive con su familia en el barrio san Agustín tiene tres hijos uno a su cargo es madre soltera.
La Señora Julia Catalina C. es  profesora de primaria desde hace diez años, en el centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth.
 Es primera vez que trabaja con crédito en esta Financiera.
texts.en:
Julia Catalina C. G. lives with her family in the San Agustín neighborhood; she is a single mother and has three children under her care. Mrs. Julia Catalina C. has been an elementary school teacher for ten years at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. This is her first loan with this financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for family expenses and for my son's school fees.

loans.name: Cyborg Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs are residents of Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who want a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group in order to improve their businesses. They call their group 'Cyborg' and made Adamsay Baby K. their leader. The 40-year-old Adamsay was born in Matam village. She is married to a miner and they have three children.

Adamsay sells market food – rice, onions, palm oil, etc. She also sells fried cakes. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Ablavi Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Grand-Popo, au Bénin, Ablavi Justine H.  vit depuis environs 20 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ablavi Justine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Ablavi Justine a un cinquième enfant à sa charge. Ablavi Justine vit seule avec ses enfants et subvient également seule à tous leurs besoins. Pour assurer une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants, Ablavi Justine exerce comme activité principale la vente de maïs et de manière secondaire, la vente de farine de manioc de façon ambulante. C’est à Ouègbo, au Bénin, que Ablavi Justine s’approvisionne. Ablavi Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais exerce cette activité depuis 11 ans. En tant que cliente fidèle de ALIDé, Ablavi Justine a déjà obetnu deux crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but de fructifier ses revenus afin de s’acheter une parcelle, Ablavi Justine sollicite un troisième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Grand-Popo in Benin, Ablavi Justine H. has been living for the past 20 years in the Fiegnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin . She is married and is the mother of four children, all having attended (or still attending) school. She also has a fifth child to care for. She lives alone with her children and is their sole support for all their needs. To ensure her children receive a good education, Ablavi Justine is an itinerant vendor who sells corn as her main activity and cassava flour as her secondary activity. She gets her supplies from Ouegbo in Benin. She has not attended school, but has been in this line of business for the past 11 years. She is a regular client of ALIDé, and has already been granted two loans, both of which were repaid in full. Wishing to increase her earnings so she can purchase a plot of land, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn flour and cassave flour

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Cirila es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Cirila tiene un puesto en el mercado D. las Nazarenas en donD. venD. jugos D. frutas, además junto a su esposo tienen una tienda D. venta D. lubricantes y repuestos.
Cirila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lubricantes.
Los sueños D. Cirila son mejorar sus negocios y seguir implementando el taller D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Alianza communal bank. She is 54, married, and has five children. Cirila has a stand in the Nazarenas market where she sells fruit juices. Besides that she and her husband have a store where they sell motor oil and spare parts. Cirila needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy oil. Her dream is to improve her businesses and continue building up her husband’s shop.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor oil

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 38-year-old man who is married to a businesswoman.  He has five children who are of school age.  

He has been operating a retail shop for two years.  He is also employed in a security firm.  Francis works hard in his business so that he can educate his children and provide other basic needs for the family.  

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to add to his stock of head phones, extension cables and mobile phone chargers in his shop.  He has been guaranteed this loan by his group members called Kindiria Faulu in Faulu Kenya.  

Francis hopes to expand his business for better sales in the future.

loans.use: To buy head phones, extension cables and mobile phone chargers

loans.name: Mrs. Seam Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Seam S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members living in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. This village bank loan has eleven people, who will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Seam S. and her husband, Mr. Sophany Lak, are farmers who own 1.5-hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil and is far away from any irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Seam S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of five children, four of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the youngest one is one year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gblinkomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003. Elle a connu une baisse de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 3 sacs de charbons de bois
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Gblinkomé, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She has a revenue-generating business involving charcoal. Her customers include anyone. She has been in this business since 2003. She has experienced a drop in inventory, so she wants to stock up again. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying three sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sope Nabi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABI 1  est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 03 enfants. Elles sont âgées de 30 à 50 ans et se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe est créé depuis un an, les membres Fatou D. et Kathy C. viennent faire leur adhésion et ont reçu leur premier prêt. Elles développent des activités diverses, telles  le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques, de chaussures, d’encens etc. Madame Oulimata S. n’a pas pu être prise en photo, elle était absente pour des raisons familiales

Marème D., à droite de la photo est le responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 46, mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est tutrice de 03 enfants qui lui sont confiés  par des parents et/ou des proches. Elle produit et vend de l’encens. Elle est aussi vendeuse de produits halieutiques qu’elle achète dans un village de pêcheurs distant à environs 80 kilomètres de sa ville. L’objet de son crédit est de faire la promotion de son activité et son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, SOPE NABI 1, is one of the solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois in RANDOULENE SUD. It is made up of nine women, who all come from the same neighborhood. They are all married and have at least three children each. They are aged between 30 and 50 and got together as they live near to one another and get on well. The group was created a year ago, and Fatou D. and Kathy C., who are now members have just joined and got their first loan. They are building up various activities, such as a small clothing business, cosmetics, halieutic products, shoes, incense, etc. Mrs. Oulimata S. is not included in the photo since she was absent for family reasons. Marème D., who is on the right of the photo and in charge of the group, is 46 years old, married and mother to four children, who are in her care. She is the guardian of three children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives and/or close friends. She produces and sells incense. She also sells halieutic products that she buys in a distant fishing village about 80 kilometers from her town. The purpose of her loan is to promote her business and her ambition is to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote the solidrity group's commercial activities

loans.name: Lavasi

texts.en: Lavasi T. is 43 and is married with six children aged from 4 to 20. She owns a business venture catching and selling ocean-caught fish and has two years of experience in this business. Lavasi needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately USD 136 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Lavasi joined SPBD and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie S. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 21 years old. Rosie is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en vivienda propia con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar, el señor realiza trabajos de construcción en viviendas particulares de esta ciudad, con los ingresos que obtiene mantiene a su familia; la esposa realiza tejidos artesanales para una tienda de exportación. El crédito que saco anteriormente fue para el revoque y pintado de una habitación que es el único dormitorio con el que cuentan, es cliente de Impro con 5 créditos. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos. El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de 1000 ladrillos para la construcción de una habitación más en su casa.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Se considera a Juan como buen cliente.
texts.en:
Juan lives in his own home together with his wife and children in the Pasankeri community in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has four school aged children. He is a private contractor in the city. The income that he earns supports his family. His wife knits crafts that are sold to an export company. The loan that was previously disbursed to him was used to renovate and repaint the only bedroom in their house. He has been a member of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and has had 5 previous loans. He is very grateful for the loans he has received. The loan he requests is to purchase 1000 bricks to build another bedroom in their house. His previous history grants him access to another loan. Juan has been a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 1000 bricks to make home improvements.

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es: El señor Carlos Daniel  está muy contento con su trabajo él tiene 36 años, pues él se dedica a un taller de soldadura, además de esto también se dedica a la venta de repuestos y mecánica automotriz pues siempre con mucho esfuerzo y empeño por salir adelante es que estos negocios han sido fundamentales para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para comprar gafas protectoras, tenazas, alicates y comprar ciertas cosas necesarias para los otros negocios. Pues tiene ciertos encargos pendientes que no ha podido realizar porque no tiene toda estas herramientas. El sueño de Carlos es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer los mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Carlos Daniel, 36, is very happy with his work because he is a welder. He also sells vehicle replacement parts and is an auto mechanic because he’s always working hard to get ahead with these various businesses that have been fundamental in providing for his family’s basic daily needs. He is once again asking for funds to buy protective goggles, pliers, pincers and certain other needed items for the other businesses because he has a few pending jobs that he hasn’t been able to perform due to lack of tools. Carlos’ dream is to expand his business and offer better services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita M. is from the village of Cabgan, Punta Miray. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a business selling fish. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for the activities.

In 2006, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing boat

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 26 years old, single, and has a 9-year-old child. To make a living, Sharon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

Sharon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it and to start a reserve fund for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara I. is the leader of the group. She is 43 and a widow. She has raised two sons and two daughters.  Fifteen years ago, Gulnara started to sell fruits and vegetables raised in her own garden.  In this way, she makes 9,750 soms per month.  That profit made it possible for her to purchase cattle for breeding. With money received from the loan, Gulnara wants to purchase apples in order to resell them at a higher price. In the future, she wants to build a house for her sons.
 
Aikukul T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and married. She has two daughters and two sons.  Aikukul is a teacher at school and her husband works in construction. Aikukul is also engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding. 

Malike R., 45, is married. She has a son and three daughters. Her husband works in Russia and she is the director of the rural school. A year ago, with an initial investment of 25,000 soms, Malike started to breed cattle. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase four calves for breeding. 

Merinsahan M., 42, is married. She has a son and three daughters. Her husband works as a teacher of physical training at school. In order to earn money, Merinsahan sells toiletries in the market.  In this way, she earns 3,500 soms per month.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more goods in order to increase the turnover of her business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135   If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase apples

loans.name: Higinia

texts.en:
Higinia P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 52 years old. Higinia is married and has four children. Her eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 20. Higinia earns her income through farming and raising livestock. She helps her husband plant rice and vegetables at their farm. She also spends time raising pigs and chickens. Higinia works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Higinia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is thankful for the services she availed of and dreams of having her own money for capital someday. Higinia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa T. is from the village of Brgy, Ibung, Villaverde, in Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Felisa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felisa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Hayme Iris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hayme Iris; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de palos, de leña y palos de madera, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y junto a su esposo trabajan en este negocio de venta de palos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de palos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar palos de madera y leña al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "Manos Juntas" ["Hands Together"]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, and belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Hayme Iris. She is 33 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling sticks and firewood. She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm. She works with her husband in this business of selling wood. The partner wants to grow and improve her wood selling business. She asks for the loan to buy wholesale sticks and firewood. 

The partner thanks those who form part of this dream by means of this resource. She promises to follow through with the payment of her dues in the established location.

loans.use: To buy sticks and firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras - Saños Grande Group

texts.es:
Isabel V. M., Sociologa, madre soltera, 1 hijo, socia del grupo comunal: "Mujeres Emprendedoras-Saños GranD."
Isabel V., es sociologa D. profesion y trabajò varios ejerciendo esta carrera; a los 35 años D. edad tuvo a su ùnico hijo, al cual tuvo que criar y educar soL., pues el padre D. su hijo se desinteresò D. ellos y formò otro hogar. 
Trabajaba todo el dìa y su hijo se tenìa que quedar solo con L. niñera; conforme crecìa, siempre preguntaba por su padre, a pesar que elL. trataba D. llenarlo D. cariño; pero eso era suficiente, ya que L. carencia D. un padre no se pueD. llenar y menos con cosas materiales.
Cuando una D. sus hermanas falleciò, L. tristeza fue devastadora y no tenìa fuerzas para nada; pues eran muy unidas; èsta hermana le habìa dejado unas propiedades pero lamentablemente sus otras hermanas se lo quitaron todo y solo le dejaron 2 habitaciones  pequeñas para vivir; elL. no les reclamo nada, pues no le parecìa bien pelearse entre hermanas.
Posteriormente dejò D. trabajar y solo susistìa con L. pensiòn que recibìa, pero tenìa a su cargo a su menor hijo quièn estaba en edad escolar y el dinero no alcanzaba. En aquel entonces una D. sus hermanas tenìa una pequeña tienda donD. alquilaban vestidos y ternos, pero èsta hermana obtuvo una oportunidad D. trabajo en el extranjero y clausurò L. tienda; entonces se le ocurriò L. idea D. volver a abrir aquelL. tienda y poner un bazar, ya que su hermana habìa dejado algunas prendas en alquiler, telas y otros; asì Isabel confeccionò y comprò mas vestidos; D. este modo empezò con este negocio y hasta ahora le ha ido bien. Su anhelo es que este negocio crezca y pueda expandirse. 
(En L. foto Isabel V. esta en L. parte superior izquierda)
El uso del prèstamo serà para incremento D. capital.
texts.en:
Isabel V. M., sociologist, single mother, 1 son, member of the community bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras-Saños GranD.".
Isabel V. is a sociologist by profession and she practiced this career for a number of years. She had her only son when she was 35, and she has to raise and educate him alone as the father of her child lost interest in them and started another home. 
She used to work all day and her son was looked after by a babysitter. As her son got older, he would always ask for his father despite the fact that she tried to give him all the affection he needed. But that was enough, though the affection of a father can't be replaced, and certainly not with material things. 
When one of her sisters passed away, her grief was devastating and she hadn't the strength to do anything; they had been very close. This sister had left her some properties but, unfortunately, her other sisters took everything and only left her with two little rooms to live in. She did not claim anything else because it did not seem right to her to fight with her sisters. 
Subsequently, she stopped working and lived only on the pension that she received. But, she had her small son in her care and he was of school age and the money did not stretch far enough. At that time, one of her sisters had a small store where she rented out dresses and suits, but this sister got the opportunity to work abroad and closed the store. Then the idea occurred to Isabel that she could reopen this store and have a bazaar, as her sister had left behind some rentable garments, cloth, and other things. So, Isabel maD. and bought more dresses, and in this way she began her business and it has been going well to date. Her wish is that the business will grow and she can expand it. 
(In the photo, Isabel V. is in the upper left.) 
She will use the loan for business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Lilibeth's Group

texts.en:
Lilibeth A. is from the village of Union, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Lilibeth is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lilibeth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lilibeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Lilibeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Friad People Yone Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL each, to enable them expand their businesses. With their loans they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by feeding and clothing their children, and sending them to school.

Isatu C. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni, 47 years ago. Isatu is married and has five children – one in primary school, two in college, and two adults.  

Isatu sells items like rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) and salt. She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more of these items at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy items like rice and salt at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La joven Señora Cecilia Elizabeth U. C. es comerciante individual, se dedica a la venta de Ropa Americana clasificada, tiene mas de 2 años de tener su negocio, pero fue hasta en el mes de Diciembre del año pasado que estableció su negocio en un local, ya que antes lo realizaba de forma ambulante, su negocio iba creciendo rapido y se le hacia imposible mostrar la mercadería a sus clientes, entonces fue como decidio montar su negocio en un local y esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de El Paraíso, calle principal de mayor afluencia comercial.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar 2 fardos de ropa para surtir más su negocio, desea tener un buen surtido en ropa de calidad y tambien mejorar los precios de venta.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Cecilia Elizabeth U. C. has worked selling used American clothing for more than two years. She used to sell door-to-door, but in December of last year she set up a shop. Her business had grown rapidly and it had become impossible to display her merchandise for her customers. So she set up a shop in downtown El Paraíso, on the main shopping street.
She will use the loan to buy two bundles of clothing to stock her store. She would like to have a good supply of quality clothing and be able to raise her prices. She needs the income to help her son get ahead in the world.

loans.use: Purchase two bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Josil

texts.en:
Josil M. has a "sari-sari" (variety store) in order to generate her daily income. She is 48 years-old and married.  She lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She has seven children. Out of seven, three of her children are still in school. Josil worked hard to make her family live comfortably. 

Josil joined Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative due to her desire to access funds for her "sari-sari" store business. Today, she is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP. The money will be used to provide additional capital for her store. She hopes to replace her present "sari-sari" store with a concrete one and she plans to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil, bags of flour, rice, onions, tomatoes etc to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Víctor, tiene 25 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Apurímac y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Víctor es chofer y hace trabajar el carro de su hermana, el cubre la ruta de Urubamba – Cusco y viceversa. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte y le va muy bien. Víctor también se dedica  a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo vacas y toros. Víctor en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales.   El sueño de Víctor es abrir una empresa de transportes.
texts.en:
Víctor belongs to Los Solidarios communal bank, part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity this program offers him. He promises to make all repayments according to schedule.

Víctor is 25 years old. He has one son. He was born in the city of Apurímac. Today he lives in the city of Urubamba. Víctor is a taxi driver. He works with his sister’s car. He travels the route from Urubamba to Cusco and back. He has worked offering taxi services for 8 years now. It’s going very well for him. Víctor also works raising animals such as cows and bulls. At this time Víctor needs this loan to buy animals. Víctor’s dream is to open his own taxi company.

loans.use: To purchase animals.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, milk, beverages, and food seasonings in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marcelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages to sell. This loan will be Marcelin'a third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods,snack foods, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Renato Hermogenes

texts.es:
RENATO HERMOGENES G. V., ACTUALEMNETE TRABAJA COMO TECNICO EN LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EL COLEGIO.
EL ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMOS PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: PIEDRA CANTERA, ARENA, CEMENTO Y HIERRO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN MURO EN LA PARTE DE ATRAS DEL PATIO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA MEJORAR SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Renato Hermogenes González V. currently works as a technician in the city of Managua.  He has three children who are in school.

Renato came to Ceprodel's offices to request a new loan to buy construction supplies such as quarry stone, sand, cement and iron to build a wall at the back of his outside patio area.  This will improve his home and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIREN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Oropesa y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma: es soltera y la socia tiene una pequeña tiene de abarrotes junto a sus familia y se alternan el trabajo, la socia es policía de profesión y ella se dedica a su institución y cuando está en sus horas libres la socia administra su tienda, la socia es una mujer muy optimista y emprendedora, ella en esta oportunidad manifiesta que desea el crédito para invertir en la tienda de abarrotes y amoblar y comprar mercadería al por mayor. La socia solicita el crédito para invertir en su tienda abarrotes.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The borrower, Ms Vilma, belongs to the community bank "VIREN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA ", located in the province of Oropesa and department of Cusco.

Ms. Vilma, is single and has a small grocery store with her family where they alternate work.  She is a policeman by profession, is dedicated to the institution, and in her free time she runs her store.  She is an optimistic and enterprising woman and says she wants the loan to invest in the grocery store to furnish it and buy merchandise wholesale. She is requesting a loan to invest in her grocery store.

She is very grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments on the loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Jane Mbithe

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old and married to M., who contributes to the family income. They have five children. She has been running her farm for a period of five years, providing an income of 6,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her fifth loan cycle in KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more maize and bean seedlings and pesticides. She hopes to improve the living standard of her family and be a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 45 years old and married to Nancy, who is a housewife. They have six children ages six, nine, 12, 14, 16 and 18. For the past eight years, Josphat has run a retail shop in the Chemase trading center. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Josphat was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he is applying for his first loan. He is requesting 20,000 KES to buy more stock such as sugar, wheat flour, and bags of rice. Josphat will use the profit from his loan to increase his shop’s inventory. In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as sugar, wheat flour and bags of rice

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
César es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad que vive en casa de sus padres en una comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. César tiene una excelente relación con sus padres ya que estos siempre le han brindado su apoyo.

César se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y vacuno. Además cuenta con terreno agrícola (que su padre le heredó) en el cual siembra limón semanalmente y actualmente se encuentra en producción. César también ayuda a su madre en las labores agrícolas que esta desarrolla. Existe un apoyo mutuo que ayuda a que el negocio familiar se desarrolle.

César solicita un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles, a Edpyme Alternativa, para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de deshierbo. Así mismo, César, comprará alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus ovinos y vacunos. 

Este crédito le será de suma utilidad a César, pues sus negocios se verán beneficiado ya que él podrá vender sus productos a mejores precios.

César es un joven trabajador que goza de buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
César is a young, 23-year-old entrepreneur living in his parents’ house in a rural community in Tambogrande-Piura District.  César has an excellent relationship with his parents since they have always supported him.

César raises sheep and cattle.  Besides, he has a tract of farmland that his father passed on to him where he currently grows lemons that he harvests weekly.  César also helps his mother with the farming chores she carries out.  There is mutual assistance among them that helps the family business progress.

César is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy fertilizer for the lemon crop and to do weeding.  At the same time, César will buy balanced feed for his sheep and cattle.

This loan will be of the utmost use for César because his businesses will benefit when he is able to sell his products for better prices.

César is a hard working young man who has good personal references.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to do the weeding and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Balbina

texts.en: Maria lives in the town of Danli where she sells freshly prepared bread for a living. She has many regular customers and sells mainly to local businesses. Maria also takes in seamstress work on the side to earn additional income. Between these two businesses, she has been able to raise her family and send her children to school. Maria is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras with which to buy bulk quantities of ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, butter and margarine.

loans.name: Ninfa Minoslaba

texts.es:
La Señora. Ninfa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive por el sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida y la  variedad de su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
Doña Ninfa tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Ninfa tiene una tienda de comestibles  hace 10 años, labora en ella de domingo a domingo y trabaja desde las 12 del medio día hasta las 3 de la mañana.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos y más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio.
 
Su sueño es conservar su salud para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Señora Ninfa is a member of the communal bank, “Mujeres Triunfadoras.”  She lives in the neighborhood of Batan in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and great architectural and natural beauty.  Its people are very warm, and it has a variety of gastronomy, both local and foreign, that captivates the palate.

Doña Ninfa is 41, is a single mother of an 8-year-old son, who goes to school in the city.  She doesn’t have her own home, so she rents.

Señora Ninfa has had a grocery store for 10 years.  She works in it every day from noon until 3 a.m.  This is her first loan with her communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of products like rice, sugar, detergent, sausages, and other basic goods to supply her business.  Her dream is to maintain her health so she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 year old single woman she owns a cafe in Tala market where she supplies food to her daily customers. She has been doing this for  one year and gets an income of KES.15,000 per month. 


Mary  was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. She has a good credit history and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to buy cooking cereals, maize, beans, flour, utensils and others items for her cafe.


Mary  will use the extra profit to put back to business. She hopes to own a big restaurant. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cooking cereals, maize, beans, flour, utensils and other items.

loans.name: Saul Abraham

texts.es: Saúl Abraham es un joven muy trabajador y responsable que ayuda a su padre con los gastos del hogar, preocupado por el bienestar familiar y la situación quiere enjarrar las paredes de un cuarto que ya tiene construido y levantar las paredes de otro para ampliar su casa que en un futuro será para el. El joven Saúl aun sigue soltera pero quiere preparar su patrimonio para ofrecer a su futura esposa, el trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad donde el cubre los gastos.
texts.en:
Saúl Abraham is a hard working, responsible young man who helps his father cover household expenses.  Concerned about his family’s wellbeing he wants to plaster the walls in a room he already has built and erect the walls for another room to enlarge the house that will be his in the future.

Saúl is still single but he’d like to start preparing his estate to have something to offer his future wife.  He’s employed at an assembly plant in the city which allows him to cover expenses.

loans.use: to build and plaster a room.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian, tiene la edad 21 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para su plantación de frijol. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la siembra de frijol y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas y mano de obra  para obtener una buena cosecha. El quiere implantar un frijolar que de buena producción para vender un producto de calidad en el mercado local o en lugares aledaños y también para autoconsumo. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su  familia y crecer con el proyecto del frijol. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Adrian is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. With this loan he hopes to purchase supplies for his bean fields. He has a plot of land that is suitable for planting beans. He will invest in inputs such as fertilizer and fungicides and will pay for labor so that he can have a good harvest. He wants to establish a bean farm with good outputs so that he can sell a quality product in the local market and in neighboring areas. His work is for his own consumption as well. He wants to generate a greater amount of income for his well-being and for that of his family and expand his bean business. 

This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously he had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow beans.

loans.name: Jecil

texts.en:
Jecil is married with one child. Jecil is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Jecil is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy two piglets and feed. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jecil hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina, de 37 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija. Ella  se dedica a la venta de verduras: yuca, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, chiles, güisquiles, etc. ya tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio y es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Para Luz lo más importante es su familia y sueña con el día en que su situación económica se vea mejorada. Ella trabaja duramente para llevar el pan de cada día a su casa y no se cansa  de hacerlo ya que es el que le brinda la oportunidad de accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio con el fin de mantenerlo surtido y que los clientes puedan encontrar siempre lo que buscan. Con el crédito desea comprar mayor variedad de verduras como: yuca, tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, chiles, güisquiles, etc. De esta manera espera que sus ventas se vean incrementadas y logre tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 37 years old and lives in her family home with her husband and young daughter.  She sells vegetables for a living such as yucca, carrots, tomatoes, onions, chilies, güisquiles [edible plant in the gourd family], etc.  She has a lot of time to dedicate to her business and it is one of her main sources of income.  For Luz, what is most important is her family and she dreams of the day when her financial situation is better.  She works very hard every day to provide for her family and she doesn't tire of doing it as she knows this is what will give her the opportunity to give them a better quality of life.  


She made the decision to request a loan with INTEGRAL so she could invest in her business and keep it stocked so her customers can always find what they are looking for.  With the loan she wants to buy a greater variety of vegetables such as yucca, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chilies, güisquiles, etc.  She hopes that this will increase her sales and allow her access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a greater variety of vegetables such as yucca, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chilies, güisquiles, etc.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia, de 37 años es una valerosa madre soltera, que cuida con amor a su hijo Jhonson en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. A pesar de no tener el apoyo, ella trabaja con ahínco para salir adelante. Desde niña ocupó la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura y aprendió a vivir de ello, por eso desde que conformó su familia no tubo inconvenientes en sembrar papa y alverja en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 17 años de experiencia y lo más difícil es mantener el precio de sus cosechas, ya que varían constantemente.
